loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala is 50 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a fieldhand and works in corn harvesting. She makes napkins, tablecloths and artisanal shawls which she later embroiders and sells to wholesalers with established businesses in San Cristobal. The main customers are tourists who like the products for their bright colors. Pascuala belongs to the group Rosas 4 along with Maria Hernandez G. who is also an artisan. With the loan, they hope to share the costs of thread and fabric as a way to cut costs and increase production.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA TIENE 50 AÑOS , CASADA , 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES CAMPESINO TRABAJA EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ ..ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR SERVILLETAS , MANTELES , CHALES ARTESANALES Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA Y LAS VENDE AL POR MAYOR A PERSONAS QUE TIENEN NEGOCIOS ESTABLECIDOS EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL .LOS PRINCIPALES COMPRADORES SON LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA QUE GUSTAN DE SUS PRODUCTOS POR LOS COLORIDOS QUE POSEEN. PASCUALA PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 4 JUNTO CON MARIA HERNANDEZ G. QUIEN TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE PIEZAS ARTESANALES .CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPARTIR LOS GASTOS DE LA COMPRA DE HILOS , GENEROS Y MANTA PARA REBAJAR LOS COSTOS Y ASI AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION DE PRENDAS .

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is 32 years old. She is married with 7 children. Her husband works in the fields. She makes embroidered artisanal products and she also has a small grocery shop in her house. She hopes to invest half of the loan in the purchase of thread and fabric for the artisanal products and the other half in the purchase of merchandise for the store (rice, oil, pastas). This way she can increase her income. She belongs to the group Rosas 4.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

MAGDALENA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA , TIENE 7 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO . ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE PRENDAS ARTESANALES Y BORDAR , TAMBIEN TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDITA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA .ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR LA MITAD EN LA COMPRA DE HILOS Y MANTA PARA LA CONFECCION DE SUS PRENDAS Y LA OTRA MITAD COMPRAR MERCADERIA ( ARROZ, ACEITE, PASTAS ) PARA SU TIENDITA Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS . PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 4.

loans.use: Artisan sales and grocery store.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 46 years old. She is married with 8 children. Her husband works in the corn and bean fields. She works from home, making artisan embroidery which she sells to her community and to some wholesalers who place orders for her products. She hopes to invest in more embroidery thread with the loan money. She belongs to the Rosas 4 group.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

CATALINA TIENE 46 AÑOS CASADA 8 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ Y DEL FRIJOL . ELLA AYUDA EN SU CASA CONFECCIONANDO PRENDAS ARTESANALES Y LUEGO LAS BORDA VENDIENDOLAS ENTRE LAS GENTES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y A ALGUNOS MAYORISTAS QUE LE SOLICITAN A PEDIDO .CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN MAS HILOS PARA SUS BORDADOS .PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 4 .

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 31 years old. She is married with 5 children. Her husband works in rose cultivation. In their region, the land is good for floriculture and most of the men in the area work in this sector. Maria helps her husband increase the family income by making tablecloths and napkins which she later embroiders. She belongs to the Rosas 4 group. With the loan, she hopes to invest in fertilizer for the land and also in thread and fabric for her artisan products.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 31 AÑOS , CASADA, TIENE 5 HIJOS SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA DE LAS ROSAS YA QUE EN LA ZONA QUE ELLOS VIVEN EL TERRENO PERMITE LA FLORICULTURA Y A ESTO SE DEDICAN LA MAYOR PARTE DE LOS HOMBRES DEL SECTOR . MARIA AYUDA A SU ESPOSO EN AUMENTAR LOS INGRESOS CONFECCIONANDO MANTELES, SERVILLETAS A TELAR Y POSTERIROMENTE BORDANDO . PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 4. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN ABONOS PARA LA TIERRA Y ADEMAS COMPRANDO HILOS Y TELAS PARA SUS ARTESANIAS .

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is 22 years old. She is single and she works in the production of artisan embroidery of the Zinacantan region such as tablecloths, napkins, shawls and embroidered blankets. She and Mrs. Juana P. Sanchea are part of the group Rosas 3. They both work in regional craft production. With the loan, they hope to purchase raw materials in bulk and thereby cut costs. This will help them increase production. Later, they will sell the products in the artisan market in town.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

MAGDALENA TIENE 22 AÑOS , ES SOLTERA Y SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE ARTESANIAS BORDADAS DE LA ZONA DE ZINACANTAN QUE GENERALMENTE SON MANTELES , SERVILLETAS, CHALES Y MANTAS BORDADAS. JUNTO CON DOÑA JUANA P. SANCHEZ FORMAN PARTE DEL GRUPO ROSAS 3.AMBAS SE DEDICAN A LAS ARTESANIAS TIPICAS DE LA ZONA EN DONDE VIVEN . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAATERIALES AL POR MAYOR Y ASI REBAJAR LOS COSTOS DE COMPRA Y ADEMAS AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION QUE POSTERIORMENTE SALDRAN A VENDER EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD .

loans.use: Craft sales

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 53 years old and is married with 10 children. Her husband cultivates flowers in their home and she makes tablecloths, napkins, quilts and shawls that she sells to established salespeople in San Cristobal. She also sells them to tourists who visit her local area. She belongs to the group ‘Rosas 3’. She hopes to invest the loan in basic materials and canvas, and fertilizer for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

MARIA TIENE 53 AÑOS, CASADA , TIENE 10 HIJOS , SU ESPOSOS SE DEDICA A LA COSECHA DE LAS FLORES EN UN INVERNADERO QUE POSEEN EN SU CASA . ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION Y BORDADO DE PRENDAS ARTESANALES TALES COMO : MANTELES , SERVILLETAS , MANTAS , CHALES, LOS CUALES VENDE A UNOS COMERCIANTES ESTABLECIDOS DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL , TAMBIEN EN LAS CERCANIAS DE SU CASA A LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA. PERTENECE AL GRUPO ROSAS 3. ESPERA INVERTIR EL PRESTAMO EN GENEROS , HILOS DE SEDA Y TAMBIEN EN ABONO PARA SU INVERNADERO .

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 31 years old and is married with 2 children. Her husband is a horticulturist along with other family members. She, as well as others in the group, make tablecloths, napkins, centrepieces, traditional skirts, cushions and pillowcases, which she sews and sells in the town’s artisan market. The other members of the group are: Catalina P. Vasquez and Fidelina P. P., both of whom are in the group ‘clavel 9’. With the loan they hope to increase their production by buying more material and thread.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

ROSA , ESTA CASADA TIENE 31 AÑOS Y 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO ES FLORICULTOR JUNTO A OTROS MIEMBROS DE LA FAMILIA . ELLA SE DEDICA JUNTO A LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO A LA CONFECCION DE PRENDAS ARTESANALES ( MANTELES , SERVILLETAS , CENTROS DE MESA , FALDAS TRADICIONALES, COJINES, FUNDAS ) LAS CUALES BORDAN Y VENDEN CADA UNA EN FORMA INDEPENDIENTE EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL DEL PUEBLO. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : CATALINA P. VASQUEZ Y FIDELINA P. P. AMBAS ARTESANAS DEL GRUPO CLAVEL 9. ESPERAN CON EL CREDITO AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION DE PRENDAS COMPRANDO MAS MATERIAL DE GENEROS , HILOS Y PALILLOS PARA LA CONFECCION DE TELARES ARTESANALES ,

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is 21 years old and is single. Along with the rest of her family she makes tablecloths, napkins and patterned shawls. They currently sell them in the artisan market to people who have established businesses. She and Doña Rosa H. Lopez belong to the group ‘Montaña 4’. With the loan they hope to invest in more material and thread to make more and therefore sell more to the tourists in the area where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

CATALINA TIENE 21 AÑOS , SOLTERA JUNTO CON SU FAMILIA TRABAJAN EN LA CONFECCION DE MANTELES , SERVILLETAS Y MANTAS ARTESANALES Y LAS BORDAN . POSTERIORMENTE LAS VENDEN EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL A LAS PERSONAS QUE TIENEN NEGOCIOS ESTABLECIDOS . JUNTO CON DOÑA ROSA H. LOPEZ PERTENECEN AL GRUPO MONTAÑA 4.ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS TELA E HILOS PARA ABASTECERSE DE MATERIA PRIMA Y AUMENTAR DE ESTA FORMA SUS CONFECCIONES Y ASI PODER VENDER ELLAS TAMBIEN EN SU LOCALIDAD A LOS TURISTAS DE LA ZONA .

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIAS

loans.name: Ana Delia

texts.es:
Ana Delia is married with two small kids, ages 3 and 9. Her husband is a construction worker. After the birth of their first son, Ana Delia decided to help her husband with family expenses, since his salary was insufficient to provide for them all. She started a business buying and selling used clothes, and in little time began building customers. Currently she sells at open markets, rotating to different parts of the city throughout the week.

Ana Delia is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to buy more clothing, since the summer is one of the busiest times of the year for her business. She plans to repay the loan within three months and is counting on your support to keep her business going and grow it little by little until she is able to have a fixed store and increase her sales. Ana Delia and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Ana Delia es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, uno de 3 años y el otro de 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil, desde que tuvo su primer hijo decidió ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que el salario que el gana no era suficiente, por ello, ella empezó con el negocio de la compra y venta de ropa de segunda mano, se hizo de clientes en el poco tiempo y desde entonces a continuado con este trabajo, actualmente Ana Delia vende en mercados rodantes su mercancía ya que como estos mercados no son fijos ella puede abarcar distintas zonas de la ciudad en una semana y así va rotando todos los meses.

Ana Delia está solicitando de un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para la compra de mercadería, ya que esta segura que va a vender mucho en esta época del año y en el verano, ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y espera contar con su apoyo para continuar con su negocio y crecer poco a poco hasta poder establecerse en un lugar fijo e incrementar sus ventas, ella y su familia te agradecen por tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Dimitry

texts.en:
Dimitry is a hard-working taxi driver from the Ivano-Frankivsk region of Ukraine. For the last nine years he has driven thousands of kilometers transporting passengers all around the city and at times around the country. Dimitry owns his own car, but contracts with a taxi dispatching company called Radiotaxi 051. He is able to use a radio in his car to make his work more efficient. Dimitry started as a taxi driver because he was unable to find another good job. He makes about $30 in a typical day which is enough to support himself and his wife, Irina, and their five year old daughter.

Dimitry has requested a loan for $1200 to make some repairs to his car engine. One of the drawbacks to being a taxi driver is the potential for costly repair overhead. Eventually Dimitryi hopes to purchase a newer vehicle, but until that time this loan will help him keep his car running and out on the road.

loans.use: Dimitry would like to repair his car engine so he can continue as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica is married and has a 5-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker, and his job is on and off. Angelica wanted to help him with expenses because they couldn't survive on his wages alone. Two year ago, she decided started her own business. Prior to this, she had helped her sister sell used clothing. At first, she started selling beauty products of a well-known Mexican brand, and later she decided to combine both ventures, which is what she does currently.

Angelica is requesting a loan of $200 to add more clothing to her stock and to satisfy her clients' orders for beauty products. She plans to repay the loan within three months and hopes you will help her continue growing her business. She is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Angélica esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su trabajo es eventual, por ello es que Angélica decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar por que no les alcanza con el sueldo del esposo. Hace 2 años fue que ella decidió tener su negocio propio por que antes de eso, ella ayudaba a su hermana en la venta de ropa usada, pero luego empezó ella a vender productos de belleza de una marca muy conocida en México y posteriormente, decidió combinar ambas actividades y es ahora a lo que ella se dedica.

Angélica esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder abastecerse de ropa y también pode cubrir los pedidos que ya tiene de sus productos de belleza, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y espera que la apoyes para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella te agradece tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Galina has a small building supplies store located at a shopping center near the middle of Ivano-Frankivsk. Her business is a vital source of income for Galina. She is a widow and depends on the funds from her store to meet the needs of herself and her two youngest children, a 20-year-old son and a 26-year-old daughter. Her oldest daughter’s husband has started working with her, so the store also provides income for her daughter and son-in-law. 

Galina started the business 3 years ago and currently makes around $1200 per month. She has requested a loan $900 to help purchase additional supplies of plastic molding and tile. These are popular with the booming remodeling business in Ukraine and should sell very well during the summer months.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of plastic molding and tile for her building supplies store

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba is married and has a 9-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker. Ever since she was very young, Rosalba always enjoyed selling things, and, years later, she began helping her mother sell a variety of products to help her husband with household expenses. Three years ago, she started her own business selling solely beauty products. It has gone well for her, and she currently has a clientele who order several items from her.

Rosalba is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies and satisfy her clients' orders so she can keep them coming back. She doesn't want to lose customers because there is a lot of competition in her field. She plans to repay the loan within three months. Rosalba and her family are very grateful for your support so they can continue growing their business and improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalba esta casada y tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y ella desde muy joven siempre le han gustado las ventas y empezó años atrás para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ayudando a su mamá en venta de diversos productos, con el paso del tiempo aproximadamente 3 años atrás se independizó y comenzó ella sola a vender productos de belleza. Le ha ido bien por ello continúa con su negocio y ya tiene una cartera de clientes los cuales le tienen varios pedidos y ella se siente a gusto con su trabajo.

Rosalba está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 200 para comprar mercadería y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y así mantenerlos y no perderlos ya que existe mucha competencia en este mercado, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Rosalba y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya decided to leave his previous job as a paid driver in order to be self-employed. Like many other entrepreneurs, he recognized the benefits of working for himself and wanted to have his own business. He has been driving his own taxi now for three years. Through a taxi dispatching company, he offers transportation services around the city of Ivano-Frankivsk or further distances if required. Kostya makes about 120-130 Ukrainian Hrivna per day which is around $26 dollars. His business is the main source of income for himself and his wife, Victoria.

Kostya has requested a loan for $1000 to help with some car repairs. This is his third loan from Nadiya Ukraine. He appreciates the availability of financial services which helps with large expenses and adds stability to his business. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Kostya in developing and running his business.

loans.use: Kostya would like to make repairs on his car so he can continue to drive his taxi.

loans.name: Michail

texts.en:
Michail has been in business for himself for five years. After graduating from college with a fine arts degree, he decided to put his training to work and started his own furniture manufacturing business. He currently works from his home and produces quality furniture for reasonable prices. His business has done well. In a typical month he makes about $400 profit for himself.

Michail has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine. He has taken three loans so far – a regular term loan and two smaller express loans, and has repaid each on time. He has requested an additional loan of $500 to help him purchase some necessary equipment and buy wooden frames that he will use to make furniture.

loans.use: Michail would like to purchase tools and wooden furniture frames for his furniture store.

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav runs his own small printing business in the city of Ivano-Frankivsk in western Ukraine. He loves technology and he loves working for himself, so having this type of business has been a great fit for Miroslav. He has been in business for about ten years, and has developed a good name and loyal clientele. His reputation for quality at reasonable prices easily brings repeat customers.

Miroslav has requested a loan for $1000 to help him with the purchase of some necessary new equipment and to buy supplies of paper stock and ink. The equipment he’d like to purchase includes several new printers, a laminator and a cutting machine. Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have been an important ingredient in the success of Miroslav’s business. We are grateful for this opportunity to help him further develop and increase his trade.

loans.use: Miroslav would like to purchase equipment, paper and ink for his small printing business.

loans.name: Felipa De Jesús

texts.es:
Felipa is married and has three children, ages 14, 21 and 25. Her husband is a construction worker. More than three years ago, she started working for a maquiladora (factory), while at the same time she runs a business selling men's and women's clothing. She sells the clothes to co-workers, neighbors and friends, all in an effort to help her husband with family expenses and keep moving their three kids forward, although only two are still school-age. Felipa already has a good fixed clientele, whose buying changes with the seasons, and since summer is coming she is certain she will take in good sales.

Felipa is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase clothes and add to her stock, since she knows her demand is increasing and already has orders for the upcoming season. She plans to repay the loan within four months. She is grateful for your support in continuing her business and helping improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Felipa esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 21 y 25 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil, ella desde hace más de 3 años atrás trabaja como empleada en un empresa maquiladora y a la vez tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para dama y caballero, la cual la vende entre sus compañeras de trabajo, vecinos y amigos, todo por ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar y sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que aún están en edad escolar los dos últimos. Felipa ya tiene una cartera de clientes fijos los cuales le compran por lo general por temporadas y ya se viene el verano por lo que ella esta segura de que va a tener buenas ventas.

Felipa solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $250 para comprar mercadería y poder surtirse por que ella conoce a su demanda y aparte ya tiene pedidos para esta temporada que se avecina, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, agradece tu apoyo para continuar con su negocio y poder con el ayudar a sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin earns a living working as a taxi driver. Many weeks he works seven days in a row, always making himself available to drive. Valentin works with a taxi dispatching company and has a radio in his car. This not only makes him more efficient in his work, but it helps ensure a steady supply of customers. He typically makes between $24 and $30 per day. The more he is able to work the more money he can make.

Valentin has requested a loan for $500 so that he can have some welding work done on the engine of his car. Having a reliable vehicle is vitally important to Valentin’s business. We are happy for this opportunity to help him complete these repairs and continue to provide safe, dependable service to his customers.

loans.use: Valentin would like to repair his taxi so he can continue making money as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina has five children, ages 12, 24, 28, 30 and 34. She is married, and her husband works as a chauffer. She started her business to help her husband with family expenses. Initially, she sold used clothes to relatives, and later, with the money she earned and saved, she decided to buy a small amount of new clothes to sell. That went well, so she continued selling new clothes, specializing in women's and children's clothing. She currently has established a slate of fixed clients, but she wants to grow her business. She has contact with someone who works in Mexican Social Security Institute who is giving her a list of people who work there so Armandian can offer them her products and increase her sales.

Armandina is requesting a loan of $250 in order to have supplies to meet her current demand and so she can offer a wider selection to meet future demand. She plans to repay the loan within four months. She is certain her business will grow with your support, and for this she is very grateful. With your help, you can keep her business going and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Armandina tiene cinco hijos de 13, 24, 28, 30 y 34 años de edad, ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer de ruta foráneo, empezó su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, inicialmente ella empezó vendiendo ropa usada de sus familiares y posteriormente con un poco de ingresos que tuvo y ahorro, decidió comprar una pequeña cantidad de ropa nueva para vender y le fue muy bien, por ello continuó con ese negocio centrándose en ropa para niños y damas. Ella tiene ya actualmente una cartera de clientes fijos pero quiere crecer por lo que actualmente tuvo contacto con una persona que trabaja en el IMSS quien le esta dando una lista de personas de esa empresa para que Armandina pueda ofrecer sus productos ahí y ampliar su mercado.

Armandina está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para poder abastecer su demanda actual y proveer de variedades a la demanda futura que va a tener, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella está segura de que su negocio crecerá con tu apoyo, por ello te agradece mucho esta ayuda para continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a sterilizer machine, an electric shaver machine and more shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her vegetable stall and start another one

loans.name: Petrona Mercedes

texts.es:
Petrona is 18 years old and is single. She makes napkins, shawls, quilts, tablecloths and decorations, all of which she sews and patterns herself. The salespeople in the Santo Domingo market in San Cristobal or people who are going to travel to different states where there are lots of tourists sell her products. She belongs to the group ‘Montaña 4’. With the loan she hopes to buy more thread and materials to produce more.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

PETRONA TIENE 18 AÑOS SOLTERA, SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA CONFECCIONANDO SERVILLETAS , CHALES , MANTAS , MANTELES E IMPLEMENTOS DE ADORNO TODOS BORDADOS LOS CUALES VENDE CON LOS COMERCIANTES DEL MERCADO DE SANTO DOMINGO UBICADO EN SAN CRISTOBAL O CON PERSONAS QUE VAN A COMERCIALIZAR SUS PRENDAS A OTROS ESTADOS POR SER ZONAS DE MUCHO MAS TURISMO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MONTAÑA 4. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS HILO Y GENERO PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION

loans.use: To sell craft products/VENTA DE PRODUCTOS ARTESANALES

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona is 77 years old and she is married with 9 children, all of whom have left home. Her husband is a horticulturist and she helps to maintain their home by making napkins, tablecloths and shawls with rustic designs on them which she creates and sews herself. She belongs to the group ‘Montaña 4’ and the other members are: Maria de los Angles Hernandez (artisan) and Maria Hernandez Lopez (artisan). With the loan they hope to buy more material and wood and therefore increase the quantity of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

PETRONA TIENE 77 AÑOS , CASADA Y SUS 9 HIJOS YA ESTAN SEPARADOS DE SU CASA . SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA FLORICULTURA Y ELLA LO AYUDA EN LA MANTENCION DE SU HOGAR HACIENDO SERVILLETAS MANTELES Y CHALES ARTESANALES EN TELARES RUSTICOS CREADOS POR ELLA MISMA EN DONDE TEJE Y BORDA SUS PRODUCTOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MONTAÑA 4 Y SUS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : MARIA DE LOS ANGELES HERNANDEZ ( ARTESANA ) Y MARIA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ ( ARTESANA ) . CON EL PRESTAMO ELLAS QUIEREN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL PARA CONFECCIONAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y MADERA PARA HACER MAS TELARES Y ASI AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE ARTESANIAS.

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIAS

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 30 years old and is married with 3 children. Her husband is a salesman and goes house-to-house selling electrical products that people pay for in weekly instalments. Juana makes linen clothes that she sews patterns onto. She gives them to salespeople who take them to the cities most popular with tourists where people like them a lot because of the pretty patterns. She belongs to the group ‘Gladiola 7’ and the other members are: Juana S. G. (artisan) and Martha Gonsalez S. (artisan). With the loan they hope to buy large quantities of threads and materials to share out and cover the cost of buying them.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

JUANA TIENE 30 AÑOS , CASADA TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO COMERCIANTE VENDIENDO ARTICULOS ELECTRICOS DE CASA EN CASA CON SISTEMA DE ABONOS SEMANALES. ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR ROPA DE VESTIR DE MANTA QUE LUEGO SE BORDAN Y SE VENDEN CON MAYORISTAS QUE LO LLEVAN A COMERCIALIZAR A CIUDADES TURISTICAS DONDE SON MUY APRECIADOS POR LA BELLEZA DE SUS BORDADOS . PERTENECE AL GRUPO GLADIOLA SIETE Y SUS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : JUANA S. G. ( ARTESANA ) MARTHA GONZALEZ S. ( ARTESANA ) . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR GENEROS , HILOS Y MANTA EN CANTIDADES GRANDES PARA DESPUES REPARTIRSE Y ABARATAR COSTOS DE COMPRA.

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is 50 years old and is married with one child. Her husband is a construction worker and she makes typical foods such as ‘empanadas’ (fried, filled tortillas) and tacos, and she sells them close to where she lives. She is part of the group ‘Gladiola 8’ in which the other members are: Candelaria Gomez S., who sells food products from catalogues, and Martha Gomez Giron, who sells juices, soft drinks and sandwiches in the market. With the money they hope to find a permanent place to sell their products

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

REBECA TIENE 50 AÑOS , CASADA UN HIJO , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO ALBAÑIL EN LA CONSTRUCCION Y ELLA SE DEDICA A PREPARAR ALIMENTOS TIPICOS TALES COMO EMPANADAS , TACOS Y LOS VENDE EN UNA COLONIA QUE ESTA LOCALIZADA EN LA PARTE ALTA DEL CERRO DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA VIVE .FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO GLADIOLA 8 QUE ESTA INTEGRADO POR : CANDELARIA GOMEZ S. (VENDE PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS POR CATALOGOS ) MARTHA GOMEZ GIRON ( VENDE JUGOS , REFRESCOS , SANDWICHS EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD ).. ESPERAN CON EL CREDITO INSTALARSE CON PEQUEÑOS LOCALES DONDE PUEDAN VENDER SUS PRODUCTOS .

loans.use: To sell food/VENTA DE ALIMENTOS

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela is 30 years old and is married with 6 children. She makes skirts, shirts and patterned trousers and she sells them in the ‘Santo Domingo’ market alongside the established salesmen and women and therefore she does not earn much. She is a part of the group ‘Arcos 4’ in which all of the members work in the same trade. They are: Rebeca Santiz L. and Andrea Gomez Jimenez. With the loan they hope to buy different coloured thread and large quantities of material and therefore produce more garments.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

ISABELA TIENE 30 AÑOS , CASADA SEIS HIJOS , ELLA SE DEDICA A HACER FALDAS , BLUSAS , PANTALONES DE MANTA BORDADOS Y LOS VENDE EN EL MERCADO DE SANTO DOMINGO CON LOS COMERCIANTES QUE YA TIENEN LOCALES ESTABLECIDOS LO QUE IMPLICA QUE SUS GANANCIAS SEAN LAS MINIMAS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ARCOS 4 DONDE TODAS SUS INTEGRANTES LABORAN HACIENDO LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD . Y ELLAS SON : REBECA SANTIZ L. Y ANDREA GOMEZ JIMENEZ CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR HILOS DE DIFERENTES COLORES Y MANTA POR GRANDES CANTIDADES Y ASI AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION.

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIA

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is married and has two small children, ages 7 and 12, who are currently in elementary school. Her husband works at a glass factory. Because her husband's salary was insufficient to be able to cover all the family expenses, Maria Guadalupe decided to start her own business a year ago to help pay the bills. After think about what she could offer, she decided to sell shoes by catalogue, since she couldn't neglect her kids or her home. Initially she offered her products to family members, neighbors and friends, and little by little she began building a clientele, who would recommend her services to their friends.

Maria Guadalupe is requesting a loan of $250 to be able to add supplies, tend to her customers better and show off the products she sells in real life and not via catalogue, because she says people are more likely to buy if they physically see things. She plans to repay the loan within three months and is very grateful for your support in helping her move ahead with her business and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

María Guadalupe esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños de 7 y 12 años respectivamente, ellos están en la escuela primaria actualmente, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica de vidrio. Debido a que el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente para poder cubrir los gastos familiares María Guadalupe decidió iniciar su propio negocio y ayudar en la economía familiar. Inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente un año atrás, pensando en que podía ofrecer y se decidió por la venta de zapatos por catálogo, así no descuidaba el hogar ni a sus hijos, inicialmente empezó ofreciendo sus productos a sus familiares, vecinos y amigos y poco a poco fue teniendo una clientela, la cual también la recomendaba con sus amistades.

María Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para poder surtirse de mercadería y así atender bien a sus clientes y también poder mostrar los productos que vende en vivo y no solo por el catálogo, por que dice que la gente se anima más a comprar viendo las cosas físicamente. Ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brindes para poder salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and supplies

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca is married and has two children, ages 6 and 10, who are in elementary school. Her husband is an electric engineer. She started her business to help with family expenses and so they could be able to give their children a good education, and also to lend an economic hand to her mother. She analyzed her abilities and decided to start a business making and selling foods. She consulted with people with similar businesses and learned the ropes, and started her own business five years ago. Blanca is a hard-working and enterprising woman, so she has been able to make her business grow and wishes to see this growth continue.

Blanca is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase pans, utensils and ingredients necessary to make her meals. Since her business is growing, she needs more tools and capacity to meet the demand. She plans to repay the loan within five months. Blanca and her family are grateful for your support in helping her: grow her business, give her children a good education and improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Blanca es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 6 años quienes están actualmente en primaria, su esposo es ingeniero eléctrico, ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar en los gastos de la casa y poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos y además ayudar económicamente a su madre. Por ello analizó sus habilidades y decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de comidas. Ella se asesoró de personas que se dedicaban a lo mismo para así estar segura de dedicarse a este negocio y aprendió bien, fue así que ya desde hace 5 años atrás tiene su negocio, Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, por ello ha hecho crecer su negocio y desea continuar con ese crecimiento..

Blanca esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 650 para comprar cazuelas, utensilios y materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, ya que al incrementarse su negocio necesita tener más herramientas y capacidad para poder cubrir su demanda, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen el apoyo que le puedas brindar para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y brindarles la educación y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils and ingredients

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta is married and has two school-age children (15 and 16). Her husband is a laborer. She started her business seven years ago when her children were smaller, so she can help with household expenses. Her business began by coincidence; she was thinking of how she could help out her husband, and one day he brought the kids some candy. Their little friends asked them who was selling the candy, and they said their mother, and that is how she started her little store. It did well and grew because at that time there weren't any stores in the neighborhood since it was just recently populated. Little by little she added supplies, and now her business also sells beauty products.

Jacinta is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase supplies and stock her store with products in high demand by her clients, so they are satisfied and she doesn't lose their business. She plans to repay the loan within five months. She hopes that you will support her so her business can keep growing and she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Jacinta es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar de 15 y 16 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como obrero, ella empezó su negocio hace 7 años, cuando sus hijos estaban más pequeños y fue para apoyar en la economía del hogar, inicio el negocio por una coincidencia, ya que estaba pensando que hacer para ayudar a su esposo y un día él le trajo unos caramelos a sus hijos y sus amiguitos le preguntaron que quien vendía dulces y ellos le dijeron que su mamá y fue así como ella empezó con su tiendita y fue creciendo ya que en su colonia no habían tiendas en esa época por que se estaba poblando recién y poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio, ahora en su negocio también vende productos de belleza.

Jacinta solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos que son muy demandados por sus clientes y además tener surtido para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y no perderlos, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 5 meses y espera que la apoyes a continuar con su crecimiento, para que pueda brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Maria is married and has three daughters, ages 11, 3 and 1. Her husband is a laborer. She always wanted to help her family move ahead in life, and her husband's salary wasn't enough to cover family expenses. So she got a job as a cleaning lady, and one of the women whose home she cleaned asked her if she wanted to get involved in selling beauty products. She agreed and it went well, and she has been in the business 11 years, which has help her provide for her children's education.

Maria is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase supplies and to satisfy client orders on time. She plans to repay the loan with in five months. She is grateful for your support in helping her grow her business and achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

María del Refugio es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijas, la mayor tiene 11 años y las otras dos tienen 3 y 1 año respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como obrero. Ella siempre a querido sacar adelante a su familia y con el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos familiares por eso ella empezó trabajando como empleada del hogar aseando casas y una de las señoras en donde trabajaba le propuso que incursionara en el negocio de la venta de productos de belleza y ella se animo y le fue bien, entonces desde ya 11 años que tiene su negocio, el cual nos comenta le ayudará a brindarles educación a sus hijas.

María del Refugio esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 550 para poder comprar mercadería y tener abasto para cubrir los pedidos que ya tiene a la fecha de varios de sus clientes, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 5 meses y te agradece por el apoyo que le puedas ofrecer para que continúe con el crecimiento de su negocio y pueda lograr lo que se propone.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria is divorced and has four children, all of whom are married. She takes care of one of her daughter's two daughters, but she doesn't have a husband's income and what her daughter sends her couldn't cover the expenses for her granddaughters or herself. So she decided to start her own business. Prior to her current business she sold beauty products, but she met a person who told her it was more profitable to sell Stanhome and Tupperware products, and she switched to selling those and that has gone much better. Since then her business has helped her provide for herself and the granddaughters who live with her.

Maria is requesting a loan of $1,100 to satisfy the orders she has from many of her customers - so they don't get upset and take their business elsewhere -and also to stock supplies so she can offer and sell more products. She plans to repay the loan within five months. Maria is very grateful for your support in helping her move forward and take care of herself and her granddaughters.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

María esta divorciada y tiene 4 hijos, todos están casados y una de sus hijas le dejo a dos de sus hijas, por ello es que María al no tener ingresos de su esposo y lo que le mandaba su hija no cubría los gastos de las niñas ni de ella, fue que se decidió por empezar su propio negocio, antes a su negocio actual ella se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza, pero conoció a una persona que le dijo que mejor se dedique a la venta de productos Stanhome y Tupperware y ella cambio a la venta de los mismos y le fue mucho mejor y desde entonces tiene este negocio el cual le ayuda para mantener a sus nietas que viven con ella y a ella misma.

María solicita un préstamo por US $ 1,100 para surtir los pedidos que tiene de muchos de sus clientes y no quedarles mal y así retenerlos y también para poder tener un stock para ofrecer y tener mejores ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. María te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante y mantener a sus nietas y a ella misma.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela has been dedicated to planting rice for more than five years. She has been able to sustain her household with the income from this activity thanks to her hard work and dedication. Although her land can be used to plant other crops, she focuses on rice because of the small investment capital it requires and because of her experience. Graciela will use the loan to invest in rice seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that with this final investment she will be able to maximize the production of the crop.

Graciela is 20 years old and only has one son. She lives alone in her home and does not have much contact with the father of her son. Her home is made out of a mix of bamboo and wood, and she hopes to improve it with any extra profits from her rice production.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a farmer who has worked in agriculture for over 10 years with his parents. He has been able to be successful farming rice which is the main crop in the area because of its fertility and investment price. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides that will help cultivate the rice that he has already planted. He also hopes to put in a new patch of rice.

Willy is 20 years old and has not yet had children. He hopes to start his family when he feels more secure about his future and has constructed a home out of cement. His goal is to accumulate profits and begin to purchase land so his business may continue to grow.

loans.use: Farm Rice

payments.comment: This is an adjustment to an incorrectly marked payment.

loans.name: Choo

texts.en: Mrs. Choo S. is 31 years old and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with her husband and their two children.  Her husband is a fisherman, while Mrs. Choos S. sells his daily catch at the market.  Together, they earn about $5/day profit which is enough to put their 2 children through school.  This loan will be used to purchase a new fishing net so they can increase the number of fish they can catch each day.  In the future, Mrs. Choo S. and her husband would like to purchase a second boat so they can increase their fishing business, and also to build extra rooms on their house that they can rent out.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and repair her house

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum S. and her husband earn their living fishing in the Tonle Sap Lake just outside of Siem Reap, Cambodia.  Sum S. is 40 years old, and she sells the fish that her husband catches at the local market.  Combined, they earn about $5/day in their business.  Sum S. and her husband have 5 children--2 of whom work at a local hotel, and 3 of whom are students.  This loan will be used to buy new fishing materials, including a net and rod.  With the new equipment, they hope to expand their fishing business so that they can send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net, fishing rod, and other fishing materials

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun N. lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia with her husband and their 6 children.  Phun N. raises pigs and also makes rice wine.  She earns about $3/day in these businesses.  He husband, 42, is a traditional musician and plays for tourists around the Angkor Wat temple complex earning about $3/day.  All six of their children go to school, but right when they get home they help their mother with the pigs and also producing wine.  This loan will be used to purchase more pigs that will eventually be sold to market.  In the future, Mrs. Phun N. hopes to expand her wine business so that her children can have a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs

payments.comment: Phun Nghit has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Thong

texts.en: Mrs. Thong P. is an aspiring 18-year-old who works at a private tourist company and earns $3/day.  Her husband is a teacher and earns only $0.50/day.  Mrs. Thong P. wants to have a family, but first would like to build her own house.  Although she has a steady stream of income, she does not have enough cash to buy wood in bulk.  She will use this loan to buy wood to build her first home.  In the future, she hopes to have children and give them a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a house

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Thong Pharn start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en: Mrs. Keang M. is 24 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband, 35, and their 3 children.  Kean M. and her husband sell charcoal around their village and earn about $7/day combined.  She will use this loan to buy a motorbike so that they can begin selling their charcoal to other nearby villages.  In the future, she would like to start raising animals so that she can increase her income and send her children to higher education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport their charcoal

payments.comment: Keang Makara has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en: Mrs. Loeung N. is 29 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband and their 2 young children.  They earn a living by painting cars, and they can typically earn about $6/day in this business.  Loeung N. is seeking this loan so that she can buy more paint in order to increase her business.  She would like to keep expanding this business, possibly by hiring one more staff.  She also hopes that she can support her children's education until they are old enough to get jobs.

loans.use: Buying paint for her business

payments.comment: Loeung Neit has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Iris Amador

texts.en:
Iris is determined to start working on selling various tropical fruits as a start to her own business. She plans to start off buying fruits at the “people’s central market” and bring them with a hired transport to her market area. She is presently living with her husband and three children, two boys and one girl.

For the time being, Iris is assisting the family’s economic needs by working three days a week as a maid in a private residence at the capital city of Santo Domingo. This means she has to take public transportation to get to work. Just this factor takes a 25% toll from her precious USD$100.00 (approximate equivalent) a month salary. She lives in the northern part of Santo Domingo, in an a populous area called Los Alcarrizos, in the community of Barrio Paraiso, where she has lived for 12 years now.

loans.use: To start her fruit selling stand by buying fruits at the market

loans.name: Koun

texts.en: Mrs. Koun L. is a 58-year-old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 4 children.  Koun L. works as a recycler, earning about $4/day.  She collects and buys small pieces of recyclable items and resells them in bulk for a profit.  Two of her children help her in this business, and the other two help support the family by working as mototaxi drivers.  This loan will be used for Koun L. to purchase recyclable items from her fellow villagers that she can resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase recyclables to resell in bulk

payments.comment: Congratulations to Koun Lorn for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mr. Cheng B. is 37 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife (pictured here because Cheng was at work when we visited) and their 5 children.  Cheng works as a trailer driver around the market, transporting food and other goods.  He can earn close to $6/day in this business, while his wife earns $3/day as a recylcer.  Of the couple's 5 children, 3 are students and the remaining two are still infants.  This loan will be used for Mr. Cheng to buy a new trailer.  In the future, he would like to help his wife expand her recycling business and also to send his children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Cheng Bunthoeun has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Mrs. Sing K. S. is 56 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children.  Sing K. S. sells fruit at the market while her husband is a construction foreman.  Together, they earn approximately $7/day.  One of their children works in Malaysia and sends back part of their income to the family, and the other 6 children are students and help around the house.  This loan will be used to purchase pipes and other construction materials for Sing K. S.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase pipes for construction business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sing Kim Sry has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mr. Im S. U. is 71 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife.  He works selling motor oil, gasoline, and autoparts--earning about $5/day.  He also fixes motorbikes with one of his children and they can earn $2/day doing this as a side business.  This loan will be used to buy spare parts for cars that he will sell in his store.  In the future, he would like to make his shop larger so that he can leave it for his son.

loans.use: To buy auto parts for his store

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin C. is a 44-year-old widow living in Phnom Penh with her 4 children.  She works selling scallops along the roadside and her children help with her business.  This loan will be used to purchase more scallops for selling, and also to buy a motorbike so that she can transport her product to different markets.

loans.use: To purchase scallops

payments.comment: Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off her loan a head of time. She would much appreciate from her heart to all lenders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil is a 29  year old single man, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. This young man has sold building materials with his truck for 6 years. He now needs a loan of $1200 to repair the chassis of  his truck, so that he can improve his business.

loans.use: To repair the chassis of  his truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve snack bar business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Mukhammad

texts.en: Mukhammad is 44 years old, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Qubadl region, settled in Absheron region. He is married and has 4 children. Mukhammad has had his own grocery store for 6 years. He used to sell only foodstuffs, but then he started selling light manufactured goods such as perfume, shampoo, etc. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs for his grocery store.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her Fruit Business

loans.name: Zalgay

texts.en: Zalgay lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is a tailor who has good talent in his craft. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and rent a new shop in one of the beautiful places of Kabul. He wants to attract more clients and make a good monthly income to help his family and make good future for himself.  He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her Fruit Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her business by diversifying her stock

loans.name: Abdul Wasah

texts.en: Abdul Wasah lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his wife whom he married last year. He wants to advance his life successfully. He is a tailor and he wants to enlarge his shop and buy extra materials so he wants to take an individual loan to buy sewing machines and  change the design of his shop to attract more clients and make a better future for his family. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Zarmena

texts.en: Zarmena lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and lives with her children. She supports her family as an embroiderer and she has 10 years of experience. She has 3 students. She took her 1st cycle group loan and changed her machines and worked hard and made a good monthly income. She wants to take anther loan to change the machines of her students to expand her business. She is happy that she can help her family.

loans.use: To change the machines

loans.name: Shah Jan

texts.en: Shah Jan lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is divorced and lives with her brother. She is a tailor and works at home. She sews clothes at home and her brother sells them in the bazaar. She took her first cycle group loan and bought tailoring materials and made a good business and found more clients in the bazaar. She wants to take anther loan to expand her business and make a good life for herself. She wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en:
Rafail is 53 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjavand region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children. He has sold metal for 10 years.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy equipment for compressing and cutting metal to sell.

loans.use: To buy equipment for compressing and cutting metal to sell.

loans.name: Nishana

texts.en:
Nishana was born in 1952 in Shakarli village, Salyan region. She is a mother of 5 children and is a widow. She has been in this business for 10 years. She provides for her children by selling milk, cheese, and cream. Nishana wishes to increase her income to support her children and offer them a better future.
This business is the only source of income for her and her family. Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy a calf and grass to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a calf and grass

loans.name: Gulbala

texts.en: Gulbala is a father of 2 children. His wife died and he is raising their children alone. He was born in 1950 and lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Now he would like to apply for a loan of $475 to buy  grass.

loans.use: To buy grass

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: wholesale purchase and retailing of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wholesale and reselling retail

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela lives in her own home on Jaimes Freyre Avenue, in the zone Tembladerani in the city La Paz. She is 74 years old and ever since she was very young, she has sold vehicle lubricants, such as oils and other fluids. When her husband passed away, she needed to continue the business in order to support her children and she still continues to work in order to support herself. The loan will be used to purchase oils and other fluids that she stocks. Her previous business history with Impro demonstrates she is a good customer and can responsably take on another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Graciela vive en casa propia en la Av. Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 74 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de lubricantes (Aceites y fluidos para vehículos motorizados). A la muerte del esposo ella tuvo que seguir con el negocio para mantener a sus hijos y actualmente ella continua con la actividad para mantener su subsistencia. El crédito que ella solicita es para compra de aceite y otros fluidos que son sus productos. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase oils and other fluids.

loans.name: Erlinda Juana

texts.es:
Erlinda is 28 years old and is married with two children. Her husband works in a clothes shop. She belongs to the group ’10 D. abril’ and she sells cosmetic products from house to house in her community. With the loan she wants to increase her earnings by buying more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

ERLINDA TIENE 28 AÑOS ES CASADA CON 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADO EN UNA TIENDA D. ROPA.ELL. PERTENECE AL GRUPO 10 D. ABRIL 4 Y TRABAJA VENDIENDO PRODUCTOS COSMETICOS D. CASA EN CASA ENTRE LAS PERSONAS D. L. COMUNIDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS COMPRANDO MAS MERCADERIA

loans.use: To sell cosmetics/VENTA DE COSMETICOS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a vegetable shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a vegetable kiosk for his wife

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a grocery shop

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino is a self-employed driver and has a 1974 van that he uses to complete moves, transporting construction material and all other types of jobs he is hired for. He works in the city of El Alto and this business is his main source of income his used to support his wife and his son, who goes to school at the state University. He lives in the zone Rio Seco El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase a motor and tires for his van. This is the second loan he has applied for from Impro, and his timely repayments of his first loan make him a good candidate for a second, enabling him to continue working as a professional driver with his van.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Marcelino es chofer de transporte libre y tiene una camioneta modelo 1974 que le sirve de herramienta de trabajo con la cual realiza mudanzas, carga material de construcción a las obras, lleva todo tipo de carga en la Ciudad de El Alto y se constituye en su fuente de ingreso con que mantiene a su esposa y su hijo que estudia en la universidad estatal. Vive en la Zona de Rió Seco El Alto. El destino del crédito es para la compra de motor y llantas para la camioneta. Es el segundo crédito que solicita de IMPRO; el buen comportamiento de pago del anterior le faculta para solicitar otro préstamo, para continuar trabajando con su camioneta.

loans.use: Maintenence of his vehicle.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es:
Alfonsa lives in her own home on Heroes Avenue at number 229 in the zone Pasankeri, in the city La Paz. Her husband is a metal worker and they live with their two children. She began to work as a seamstress a while ago, making "polleras;" skirts that are worn by the countrywomen in her country and are very eye-catching because of their bright colors. Because Alfonsa had a high demand from her customers, she also began to make coats from llama wool and has seen much success, so much so that she is applying for this loan in order to purchase more material-namely llama wool-so that she can continue to meet demand. Her previous history with Impro and the growth of her business make her an excellent candidate to recieve a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Alfonsa vive en casa propia en la Av. Héroes del chaco Nº 229 de la zona de Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja de albañil y viven con sus dos hijos. Desde hace tiempo se dedica a la confección de centros de pollera y polleras (polleras son especie de faldas que usan las campesinas en nuestro país, son muy vistosas por sus colores llamativos). Debido a que tiene bastante demanda de sus clientes, Alfonsa empezó a confeccionar mantas de vicuña y ha tenido mucho éxito en este negocio, de tal manera que el crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar material – lana de vicuña - y poder seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes. Su antecedente histórico con Impro y el crecimiento de su negocio la califican como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase llama wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bike transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bicycle transport business

loans.name: Moira

texts.es:
Moira lives in a rented home with her two children; she has been separated from her husband for 6 years. Two months ago, she used her savings to begin a small business. She sells metal working materials, buying her stock and then selling it to the metal workers, where she has been warmly received. Her first loan with Impro was for education, which she repayed punctually. Now she has come back to Impro to apply for a new loan which she will use to purchase more metal working materials and to stabilize her new business. Her previous history with Impro demonstrates she is a good candidate to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Moira vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos; ella esta separada del esposo hace más de seis años. Con sus ahorros hace dos meses inicio la actividad de venta de material de ferretería comprando lo necesario y fue a ofrecer a las ferreterías, donde tuvo muy buena aceptación. El primer crédito que solicito a IMPRO fue para educación, el cual lo pago puntualmente. Ahora recurre a Impro para solicitar un nuevo crédito que será destinado a capital de arranque que servirá para comprar mas material de ferretería e iniciar la actividad ya como un negocio estable. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, la califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To purchase matieral

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 23 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband works outside the city in the fields, and therefore she has to sustain her family selling clothing. She travels to offer her merchandise in several communities close to San Cristobal de las Casas. She is a member of the "10th of April" group #4, together with Ms. Lucia Huacash Moshan (who has a grocery store).

Ms. Cristina wants to invest the loan to buy more clothing to increase her sales, and Ms. Lucia wants to buy non-perishable food to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

CRISTINA TIENE 23 AÑOS , CASADA CON TRES HIJOS SU ESPOSO ESTA FUERA DE LA CIUDAD TRABAJANDO EN EL CAMPO , ES POR ESO QUE ELLA SOSTIENE AHORA SU HOGAR CON SU TRABAJO VENDIENDO ROPA Y SALIENDO A OFRECER SU MERCADERIA A LAS DISTINTAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO 10 DE ABRIL 4. JUNTO CON DOÑA LUCIA HUACASH MOSHAN ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES )

CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN INVERTIR DOÑA CRISTINA COMPRANDO MAS ROPA PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y DOÑA LUCIA COMPRANDO ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA ABASTECER SU LOCAL .

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Verónica N. lives in her own house in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of La Paz, with her husband, Mr Francisco Quispe, and her 4-year-old son, Juan. Ms. Verónica N. works as a weaver in a nearby micro-business and her husband works in as a carpenter in Sopocachi.

She shares her house with her three brothers. Each of them occupy a single room, and there is only a single common bathroom.

The requested loan will be used to construct an additional bathroom (toilet and sink) on her own part of the lot, and this way improve her living standard. This is the fourth time that she is approved for a loan with IMPRO, and her loan history and credit analysis show that she is qualified to receive this loan. The income of husband and wife and their cash flow indicate a stable economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica N. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ubicada en la ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Francisco Quispe y su hijo Juan de cuatro años. La señora Veronica N. trabaja como tejedora en una microempresa de su zona y el esposo es carpintero empleado en un taller de la zona de Sopocachi.

La vivienda es compartida con sus tres hermanos y cuenta con una habitación para cada familiar y solo tiene un baño común.

El destino del crédito ira a la construcción de un baño adicional (inodoro y lavamanos) en la parte del lote que le pertenece.

Esta es la cuarta ocasión que Verónica se beneficia con un crédito en Impro y sus antecedentes y el análisis crediticio la califican para poder acceder al préstamo. Los ingresos de ambos esposos y los flujos de caja efectuados indican una situación financiera estable.

loans.use: To construct an additional bathroom

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidia lives in her own house in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the west side of La Paz, with her husband, Mr Francisco Pérez, and her 4-year-old son. Ms. Lidia works as a weaver in a nearby micro-business and her husband works in construction. She shares her house with her three brothers. Each of them occupy a single room, and there is only a single common bathroom.

The requested loan will be used to construct an additional bathroom (toilet and sink) on her own part of the lot, and this way improve her living standard. This is the third time that she is approved for a loan, and her loan history and credit analysis shown that she will be able to honor her repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Francisco Pérez y su hijo de cuatro años. La señora Lidia trabaja como tejedora en una microempresa de su zona y el esposo es trabajador de la construcción.

La vivienda es compartida con sus tres hermanos y solo cuenta con una habitación para cada familiar y solo cuentan con un baño común.

El crédito solicitado es para construir un baño adicional (inodoro y lavamanos) en la parte del lote que le pertenece y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Esta es la tercera ocasión que accede a un crédito y sus antecedentes y el análisis crediticio demuestran que puede honrar sus obligaciones crediticias.

loans.use: To construct an additional bathroom

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito lives in the Las Lomas neighborhood in the west side of La Paz. He produces men's shoes with a partner, which he sells to wholesalers that subsequently export them to Perú.

In the year 2002, Benito was one of the victims of a landslide on his property, which caused him to lose his existing house. Only a single room was left standing, and Mr. M. was forced to live rented during this time. Currently, the local government has given him permission to rebuild.

The loan that he requests is to do the basic construction of three rooms using brick.

This is the fourth time that he requests a loan. His payment history with IMPRO shows that the payments were made on time and in their entirety, which indicates that he can honor his credit obligations. This loan will be extended by through our program for housing and home improvement, under the section "construction".

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Benito es vecino de la zona de las Lomas, ladera Oeste de la Ciudad de la Paz. El se dedica a la elaboración de calzados de varón y tiene un socio; el producto se vende a comerciantes mayoristas que luego lo exportan al Perú.

Benito en el año 2002 fue uno de los damnificados de deslizamiento en el terreno de su propiedad y perdió la construcción existente, quedando solo una habitación y obligando al señor M. a vivir en alquiler durante ese tiempo; actualmente el gobierno municipal le dio la autorización para poder construir nuevamente.

El crédito que solicita es para la construcción en obra gruesa de tres habitaciones de ladrillo.

Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un crédito y los antecedentes históricos con Impro demuestran que los pagos fueron realizados en su totalidad y puntualmente, lo cual indica que puede honrar sus obligaciones crediticias. Este crédito se canaliza a través de nuestra línea de vivienda y mejora de hábitat, dentro del rubro de construcción.

loans.use: construction of 3 rooms

loans.name: Víctor

texts.en:
Victor sells clothes and accessories. He stared the business with the help of a brother who provided merchandise for him to get off the ground. At first he only sold clothes and plastics door-to-door and now he has opened a store where he sells all types of clothing and accessories.

Several months ago, Victor received his first loan from Kiva and Mifex. He did extremely well with the loan as he was able to break into the household appliances market while continuing to buy clothing. The investments in appliances were the most successful as he was able to make significant profits from those items. He immediately invested the profits into his business by fixing up his store with more glass cases, a new sign outside and doors to keep his business safe. Business has been booming ever since. He has also decided to pay the rest of his loan off early in hopes to receive a larger one soon. He plans to continue investing in appliances as he did before. His goal is to save up enough money to open a second point of sale for his products.

loans.use: Invest in more appliances and possibly open a new point of sale

loans.name: Eudocia

texts.es:
Eudocia and her husband have 12 years of experience in the making of paintings. Her husband acquired this skill by working for his father. She saved and decided to set her own framing business. She works everyday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. In the morning she works on the frames and in the afternoon she goes out on her tricycle to sell her work close to her residency. She began with 10 clients and now has a group of 100 clients to whom she delivers her work.

She will use this loan to buy prime materials needed to make her framed pictures. With this investment she will gain better discounts when purchasing and, therefore, increase her income.

Eudocia is married. She is 44 years old. She has five children who currently study. The older children help her husband make the pictures. Besides helping her husband, she is a teacher. She works in a school near her residency. She also works in the afternoons teaching how to do homework. Their desire is to be able to increase their income in order to purchase a second-hand handcart which would be of great help to transport the framed pictures.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer

Eudocia junto a su esposo tienen ya una experiencia de 12 años con su trabajo de elaborar cuadros. Actividad que la adquirió su esposo trabajando para su padre. Fue ahorrando y como ya tenia el conocimiento decide poner su propio taller de cuadros. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Los elabora por las mañanas y en las tardes los sale a vender en un triciclo por un sector cerca de su domicilio. Comenzó con 10 clientes. Actualmente tiene una cartera de 100 clientes a los cuales les deja sus trabajos.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de cuadros. Con esta inversión obtendrán mayores descuentos en sus compras. Por ende sus ingresos van a mejorar.

Eudocia es casada. Tiene 44 años. Cinco hijos los cuales todavía estudian. Los mayores ya le ayudan en la elaboración de los cuadros a su esposo. Además de ayudarle a su esposo Eudocia es profesora. Trabaja en una escuela cercana a su domicilio. Y también por las tardes ella trabaja enseñando tareas. El deseo de ellos es poder mejorar sus ingresos para poder comprarse un carrito usado. El cual le serviría de mucha ayuda para trasladar sus cuadros.

loans.use: Buy wood and other prime materials

loans.name: Bella

texts.es:
Mrs. Bella owns a café which is located in a school. She has 5 years of experience running it. She tends the café from 7am until 10pm from Mondays through Fridays. She sells are sorts of sweets, hot dogs, fries, hamburgers and beverages. She began this business because she helped her sister in a restaurant. With the experience she gained, she decided to open her own café with money that was lent to her.

Mrs. Bella wishes to buy ice cream and beverages because of their high demand. She also would like to expand the sales of lunches that she is starting with.

Mrs. Bella is 41 years old. She and her husband separated more than 10 years ago. She has an 18-year-old son who helps her occasionally running the business. She owns a two-story house made of concrete that she inherited from her parents. It is now undergoing improvements. She wishes to work and grow with us in all aspects to better her quality of life.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Bella es propietaria de una bar. El negocio esta ubicado en un colegio. Ella lleva 5 años de experiencia. Atiende su negocio desde las 7am hasta 10pm. De lunes a viernes Vende todo tipo confiterías, salchipapas, hamburguesas, jugos, colas. Su negocio lo inicio porque ella ayudaba en un restaurante a una hermana y con la experiencia que adquirió decidió poner su propio negocio con un dinero que le prestaron.

Doña Bella desea comprar lo que es helados y mas productos como cacitos, helados, jugos, colas etc. Ya que tiene bastante demanda de estos productos. Además de ampliar la venta de almuerzos que lo esta iniciando.

La señora Bella tiene 41 años. Se separo de su esposo hace mas de 10 años. Tiene un hijo de 18 años quien le ayuda en ciertas ocasiones en el negocio. La casa en la que vive es propia, herencia de sus padres es de 2 pisos de cemento, el 2do piso lo esta adecuando. Ella desea trabajar y crecer en todos los aspectos con nosotros y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Invest in ice cream and beverages

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline’s passion is in the beauty salon business! She started her own business about a year ago. Her loan request is to buy shampoo and rinse products for her clients. These are a rare commodity in the impoverished area where her salon is located. By having them, she expects to increase salon activity, attracting more customers. Before this line of business, she used to work in various other salons. This gave her the experience and desire to start her own.

Jaqueline is married with three sons: Luis Fernando (10), Jean Luis (8), and Joan (8 months), and she has lived in the area for 9 years.

loans.use: Buying new hair products for her clients.

loans.name: Yoli

texts.en:
Yoli, a particularly young woman, started her business eight months ago. She sells food on a wheel cart (locally called a “chimi”) commonly used in populated areas to serve those who go out in the night time and need a place to have a bite when they come out of a bar or night club. She typically serves cooked meat products such as hot dogs, hamburgers, and sandwiches. Her husband and a brother-in-law assist her in this business. She tells us that the “chimi,” although it is a business that requires sacrifice, provides the family with a higher income.

She plans to buy “pierna” (roasted leg of ham), which is in high demand by those who have had a few “frias” (cold beers). This, she feels, will probably bring in either a higher number of customers, or at least she’ll be able to mark up her products according to the increased value added by this specialty food ingredient.

loans.use: To buy a new cart and buy goods for it.

loans.name: Sara Mendoza

texts.en:
Sara Mendoza M. is a single mother raising her three children, Antonio Medoza, age 17, Mariella, age 15, and Jonatan, age 4. Sara sells household supplies and groceries from her own general store in her community of Munoz, located near the north coast of the Dominican Republic. This loan of $150 will be used to purchase grocery items such as rice, beverages, and other basic supplies.

Sara has owned her home-based store, Colmado Sara, for more than two years now and has gone through Esperanza's business training courses with other microentrepreneurs in her community. She is optimistic that the business, as her sole source of income, will continue to be a blessing to her family.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items such as rice, beverages, and other basic household supplies

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda sells cosmetics and perfume throughout her community. She usually travels door to door offering her products but also sells some from her home. She allows her clients to pay her for their purchases in weekly installments in order to maker her products much more accessible.

Herlinda used her first loan to invest in new products and to fix her home. She is happy with the results as she has been able to witness the growth of her business. She now makes fliers in order to market her products and announce special sales. Her family is now much more involved in marketing her products as they see that she sells quality items at affordable prices. She is very grateful for the loan and hopes she will be able to continue to grow with a new loan she will use to invest in more products.

Herlinda has four kids, three of which are still in school. She hopes that by generating more income she can continue to pay for their educations and make improvements to their home.
