loans.use: Buy more cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Thoi

texts.en:
Miss Thoi is 38 and her husband is 39 years old. They have 4 children between 17 and 10 years of age. Her first son works as a day laborer but he is the only one of her children to contribute money to the family. The other children are going to school in grades between 8 and 5.

The family has 10.000 square meters for growing cashew nuts but their land is poor and they don’t have capital to buy fertilizer so productivity is low. So selling vegetables is thus important to increase their income by about $2.5/person/month. Their average income is $10/person/month. Miss Thoi has already repaid her third loan in time. Now she wants to borrow $75 for her vegetable selling business and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy vegetables to sell and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melba has a store in her home where she sells basic groceries such as oil and rice. She started off very small when she bought the goods from another market that was going out of business and her business has steadily grown since. She now also sells gas tanks to the local community, which always provides a steady flow of business.

Several months ago she received a loan from Kiva and Mifex. She invested in fresh fruits and vegetables while also making some improvements to her home. Her business has done well since receiving the loan. She has now started to distribute rice to other small markets in the sector. She is seeking a second loan in order to fix up her store. She hopes that she will be able to invest in a luminous sign for her business.

loans.use: Fix up her store

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Miss Trinh is 35 years old. Her husband died of cancer and Miss Trinh had to pay $3700 for her husband's medical treatment, so her first son must stop going to school. Her second and third are going to school. Miss Trinh doesn’t have any land for cultivation.

Her soft drink selling is thus important to increase her income by about $3/person/month. In addition, Miss Trinh works as a laborer at the cashew nut factory in the morning. She is a hard-working woman. Her average income is about $11/person/month. She wants to earn money from her business so that she can repay the debt for her husband's medical treatment. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Miss Hue is 39 and her husband is 41 years old. They have 4 children between 14 and 7 years of age. They are supporting all their children to go to school in grades between 9 and 1. Hiep, her husband, suffers cataract disease and Hong suffers from a tumor. The family has had to pay a lot of money for their medical treatment.

Miss Hue sells food for breakfast in the morning to increase their income by about $2/person/month. However, their average income is low at $6.5/person/month. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her breakfast food selling business.

loans.use: Sell food for breakfast

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Miss Ngoc is 35 years old. Her husband died of a brain hemorrhage 3 years ago. She is supporting two children by herself. She doesn’t have any land for cultivation. Ngoc suffers from spinal column, stomach and sinus problems.

Ngoc’s selling fish sauce and dried fish at her house is thus important to increase her income by about $1.5/person/month. Her average income is $8.5/person/month. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: Selling dried fish and fish sauce

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 45 years old. She has 3 children between 16 and 11 years of age. Her husband left her for another woman. Mrs Lan is supporting all her children by herself. The family’s situation is very difficult, so her first son stopped going to school early. Her second and third are going to school in grades 8 and 6.

Lan doesn’t have any land for cultivation. Lan buys material waste form door to door and then she sells it at the local recycling company. This work increased her family income by about $2/person/month. Now Lan wants to borrow $75 to buy more recyclable material.

loans.use: Buy material waste for recycling

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Mrs. Prom H. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by renting a house and operating a Karaoke business in her area, where she typically makes about 10 USD per day in revenue. Her husband sells containers of gasoline along a roadside and earns in average about 4 USD a day, while three of her children work at a local garment factory. In order to maximize her Karaoke business and meets her clients' needs, Prom H. is currently requesting for a loan amount of 700 USD to purchase a larger variety of beverages and foods to serve her customers and clients.

In the future, Prom H. is thinking about being able to have enough money to keep expanding her current business and build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to run in her Karaoke business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Prom Heng has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina started a new business based on the skills she learned at the Mifex MERIT Centers. At our training facilities she participated in a course where she learned arts and crafts. Specifically, she makes party and house decorations. She was making the products prior to receiving a loan from Mifex, but her growth was restrained because she could not afford materials. She used the capital from Kiva lenders in order to buy scissors, glue, a glue gun and other decorative items.

She has been able to establish her business nicely as she markets her products in the local schools. She has also started passing along the knowledge from the MERIT Centers to others in the community. She is hoping her new loan will allow her to invest in a glass case and new products. She hopes that she can begin to contribute to her family income in order to provide for her 3 children.

loans.use: Invest in a new glass case and new products

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en: Muzafar A. has been in the trading business for 10 years. He is married and has three children. He started his business from one small booth with $80 worth of goods. In 2002 he became a client of Microinvest. Today his revenue is $1400. His little shop is located in one of the central markets of Pandjshanbe. Since he has been in the business a long time, he has many clients. He is intuitive and responds quickly to customers demands. He would like to reopen his shop in a new location where he can store a larger inventory of goods.

loans.use: To purchase his own shop

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.en: Abdumavlon S. is married and has two children. His children attend school and his wife is a housewife. His parents are retired and live with their son. Abdumavlon started his business by giving his cows to be slaughtered. His parents supported him in his decision. He has been a butcher for five years. Abdumavlon needs $1125 loan to buy additional livestock, so he can increase his revenue and be able to better support his parents and his family.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Magaly

texts.en:
Magaly sells clothes in her local community. This type of activity allows her the flexibility to bring in a stable source of income while also giving her time to spend with her children. While she is out selling, her mother takes care of her youngest one while the others are at school. She began in this line of work with only $15 in investment capital.

Magaly is now requesting her second loan with Mifex and Kiva. With her first loan, she invested in buying clothing in bulk in order to increase variety and lower prices. This investment was successful as she was able to attract more clients. Also, to provide incentive she allowed her clients to make payments plans on certain items and she also had sales every so often. All of this helped Magaly gain popularity in the sector and increase her customer base. She is requesting a new loan in order to buy a glass case for her products and fix her home up as a store.

Magaly is 29 years old and has 4 small children. She feels proud to be able to help her family with the extra money she makes. She is very grateful of the help her mother provides, without her she would not be able to run this business and care for her children.

loans.use: She wants to buy a new glass case for her products

loans.name: Nadjmiya

texts.en: Nadjmiya A. has been in retail for the past 12 years. She started her business with $50. She has 5 children that she has to feed and support. She borrowed from her friends and started by retailing two to three types of fabrics. In 2006 she became a client of Microinvest. She always pays off her loans on time. At this time she needs $475 to expand her stock of fabrics for the new season in order to increase her revenue.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for the upcoming season

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
A. Mavzuna is selling children’s clothes on a Panjshanbe central market. She has been an entrepreneur for no more than 5 years, but she became a client of Microinvest only recently. She started her business from selling chilren’s clothes. She is obtaining and delivering his products by herself. She is divorced and has 3 children. Her children go to school; she is working days and nights for their education. She has nowhere to get the help from; that is why she asked Microinvest for support. She is hoping to receive a loan for 400$ for buying and selling goods and to use profits to provide her children with all the necessary needs.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдувалиева Мавзуна торгует детской одеждой в центральном рынке «Панчшанбе». Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не более 5 лет, но клиенткой «Микроинвест» стала только недавно. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит сама. Она разведена и у нее подрастают 3 детей. Ее дети учатся в школе, и для их обучения она трудится день и ночь. Ей не откуда ждать помощи, поэтому она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой. Она надеется получить займ 400$ для приобретения и реализации товаров, а от прибыли обеспечить своих детей всеми необходимыми нуждами.

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been running this store out of her home for about 2 years. Prior to running this business she worked as a seamstress but she did not generate enough income to support her family. She and her husband decided to open it when he was fired from his job. With their savings they invested in products and they have been slowly growing these past years.

Maria and her husband decided to open a bakery several months ago with the help of a loan with Mifex and Kiva. They were able to start their bakery and increase the sales of Maria's store. Her husband makes bread every morning and they now own a true family business where their daughter now helps by tending to the store. They plan to invest the new loan in a variety of new soft drinks and snacks that are high in demand.

loans.use: Invest in snacks and beverages

loans.name: Abdulojon

texts.ru:
A. Abdulojon is 22 years old; he has been an entrepreneur for 3 years. He started his business selling household supplies. Supplies are delivered by his suppliers. He is married and recently he had a son. Because his family size increased he has to provide for them. He came to decision that he needed to increase inventory, that is why he needs 1200$.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдуманонов Абдуллочону 22 года, предпринимательской деятельностью занимается 3 года. Начинал свой бизнес с продажи хоз. товаров. Товар ему привозят его же поставщики. Он женат и недавно у него родился сын. Так, как в его семье пополнение, он должен их обеспечить. Он пришел к решению, что ему надо увеличить свой товарооборот, поэтому эму необходимо 1200$.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov C. is 28 years old, married and a mother of two children. Both are students. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To service the family's expenses, she sells second hand clothes at a nearby market and makes around 5 USD each day, while her husband can typically earn a meager amount of money from working at a private company as a security guard. Nov C. is humbly requesting a loan amount of 200 USD to purchase more clothes to increase her inventory, as well as satisfying her clients' needs. She hopes to have enough money to keep expanding her business and be able to build a new house one day.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mutluba

texts.ru:
A. Matluba is married, she has 2 children. She has been an entrepreneur for 15 years. She started her business sewing women’s dresses. She was taking orders at home. Now she is sewing in an atelier. She needs 600$ for buying materials, necessary for making new kinds of dresses.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Азизова Матлюба замужем, имеет 2 детей. Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается 15 лет. Начала свой бизнес шитьем женских платьев. Заказы принимала на дому. Сейчас она шьет в ателье. Ей необходимо 600$ для купли сырья, необходимых для шитья новых видов платьев.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
A. Mahfirat is married and has 6 children. She has had her business for 4 years, 2 of them she is working with Microinvest. She started her business selling groceries. Groceries are delivered by her suppliers. A. Mahfirat is asking for 900$ for increasing her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Алимова Махфират, замужем и имеет 6 детей. Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается 4 года, из них 2 года работает с Микроинвест. Начинала свой бизнес с продажи продовольственных продуктов. Продукты поставляют ее же поставщики. Алимова Махфират запрашивает 900$ для увеличения своего товарооборота.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru:
A. Nuriniso has been an active client of Microinvest for the past 2 years. She has been an entrepreneur for 6 years. She orders candies and cookies from her vendors. She started her business after she was left alone with her two children. Now all the responsibilities of the children are on her shoulders. Her children are going to school. She dreams about giving them an education, but she doesn’t have enough money for it. She needs $300 for opening a new stall in the market. She is hoping to get a maximum profit from selling her products and she will use this profit for her children’s education.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Ахмедова Нуринисо, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 6 лет. Товары заказывает у своих поставщиков. Предпринимательской деятельностью начала заниматься после того, как она осталась одна с двумя детьми на руках. Теперь вся забота о детях лежат на ее плечах. Ее дети учатся в школе. Она мечтает дать им высшее образование, а для этого ей не хватает средств. Ей необходимо 300$, для открытия новой торговой точки. Она рассчитывает получить максимальную прибыль от продажи своих товаров, а полученную прибыль потратит на образование своих детей.

loans.use: To expand her business by opening a new stall in the market

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru:
Munavvar A. has been in business for 2 years and an active member of MicroInvest for the past year. She delivers her goods by herself. She is married and has 2 children. Her children are going to school. She needs $300 for purchasing seasonal merchandise. She is counting on receiving maximum profit from selling her merchandise and using the proceeds for her family’s needs.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Ашурова Мунаввар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 1 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 2 лет. Товары привозит сама. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Ей необходимо 300$, для закупки сезонного товара. Она рассчитывает получить максимальную прибыль от продажи своих товаров, потратить их на нужды семьи.

loans.use:
To increase sales turnover
для увеличения товарооборота

loans.name: Oitutikhon

texts.ru:
B. Oitutikhon has been in business for the past 2 years and she is an active client of MLF MicroInvest. She delivers her goods by herself. She is married and has 3 children.. She needs $300 for purchasing seasonal merchandise. She is counting on receiving maximum profit from selling her merchandise and using the proceeds for her family’s needs.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Байпочоева Ойтутихон, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 2 лет. Товары привозит сама. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ей необходимо 300$, для закупки сезонного товара. Она рассчитывает получить максимальную прибыль от продажи своих товаров и потратить их на нужды семьи.

loans.use: To increase sales turnover

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru:
B. Tolib is an active member of MLF MicroInvest, he has been in business for the past 3 years. Tolib orders his merchandise from his vendors. He started his business by selling men’s shoes. Currently he sells men’s clothing. He is married and has 2 children. He works to provide for his family while his wife stays at home. He needs $300 to increase the assortment of merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Баротов Толиб является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 3 лет. Товары заказывает у своих поставщиков. Начинал свой бизнес с продажи мужской обуви. На сегодняшний день он начал продавать и мужскую одежду. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. В семье работает только он, жена домохозяйка. Ему необходимо 300$, для увеличения ассортимента товара.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of  merchandise.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
Gulsara Boltueva has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest over 2 years. She has been an active entrepreneur for no less than 4 years. Gulsara Boltueva orders goods from her suppliers. She began her business selling 4-5 varieties of candies. Today, she has tripled her assortment of goods. Gulsara Boltueva is married and has 3 adult children. All her children are now in college. Gulsara Boltueva has to obtain $800 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold, so that she can use the extra profit to pay for education of her children.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Болтуева Гулсара является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2-х лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 4 лет. Товары заказывает у своих поставщиков. Начала свой бизнес с продажи 4-5 видов конфет. На сегодняшний день ее ассортимент увеличился втрое. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Дети взрослые и учатся в ВУЗ-ах. Ей необходимо 800$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.ru:
Gulsun G. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 2 years. She has been in business for no less than 3 years. She personally buys and delivers her goods. Gulsun G. began her business by selling men's clothing. Today, she sells shoes for men and children. Gulsun G. is married and has 3 children. She asks for $800 loan to increase assortment of the goods sold, so that she can use the extra profits to pay for education of her children.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гафурова Гулсун, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 3 лет. За товаром ездит сама. Начала свой бизнес с продажи мужской одежды. На сегодняшний день она торгует детской и мужской обувью. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ей необходимо 800$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar D. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 2 years. He has been in business for no less than 3 years. He orders his goods directly from his suppliers. Zafar D. began his business by selling 4-5 varieties of candies. By now, he has tripled the assortment of goods. Zafar D. is married and has 2 children of school age. He asks for $300 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold, so that he can use the extra profits to pay for education of his children.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Чураев Зафар является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2-х лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 3 лет. Товары заказывает у своих поставщиков. Начала свой бизнес с продажи 4-5 видов конфет. На сегодняшний день его ассортимент увеличился втрое. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Дети учатся в школе. Ему необходимо 300$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на обучение своих детей.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru:
Zebiniso K. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 5 years. She has been in business for no less than 13 years. She personally orders and delivers her goods from her suppliers. Zebiniso K. sells chicken eggs at the central market “Panshabe.” She is married and has 4 children. Zebiniso K. asks for $700 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold and use the extra profits to pay for her family needs.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хамидова Зебинисо является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 5 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 13 лет. За товаром ездит сама. Торгует куриными яйцами на центральном рынке «Панчшанбе». Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ей необходимо 700$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на нужды семьи.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Svetlana S. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 5 years. She has been in business for no less than 20 years. She is married and has 3 children. Svetlana S. asks for $600 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold to use the profits to renovate her apartment.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Светлана является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 5 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 20 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ей необходимо 600$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на ремонт квартиры.

loans.use: Increase the volume of goods sold

loans.name: Orif

texts.ru:
Orif S. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 3 years. He has been in business for no less than 8 years. He personally acquires and delivers the shoes from his suppliers. He began his business by selling 4-5 shoe styles. By now, Orif S. tripled the assortment of the shoes that he sells. He is married and has 2 school-age children. Orif S. asks for $500 loan to increase the assortment of the goods sold. He plans to use the profits to buy an apartment for his family. Today, Orif S.’s entire family lives in a studio apartment. With the children growing up, the studio is no longer adequate for his family.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипов Ориф является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3-х лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 8 лет. За товаром ездит сам. Начинал свой бизнес с продажи 4-5 видов обуви. На сегодняшний день его ассортимент увеличился втрое. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Дети учатся в школе. Ему необходимо 500$, для увеличения ассортимента товара, а полученную прибыль потратить на закупку квартиры. Он с семьей живет в однокомнатной квартире, так как его дети взрослеют, им необходимо купить квартиру.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
A. Mavzuna is selling children’s clothes on a Panjshanbe central market. She has been an entrepreneur for no more than 5 years, but she became a client of Microinvest only recently. She started her business from selling chilren’s clothes. She is obtaining and delivering his products by herself. She is divorced and has 3 children. Her children go to school; she is working days and nights for their education. She has nowhere to get the help from; that is why she asked Microinvest for support. She is hoping to receive a loan for 400$ for buying and selling goods and to use profits to provide her children with all the necessary needs.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдувалиева Мавзуна торгует детской одеждой в центральном рынке «Панчшанбе». Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не более 5 лет, но клиенткой «Микроинвест» стала только недавно. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит сама. Она разведена и у нее подрастают 3 детей. Ее дети учатся в школе, и для их обучения она трудится день и ночь. Ей не откуда ждать помощи, поэтому она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой. Она надеется получить займ 400$ для приобретения и реализации товаров, а от прибыли обеспечить своих детей всеми необходимыми нуждами.

loans.use: для расширения бизнеса

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.ru:
Mukadam I., 36 has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 4 years. She has been in business for no less than 7 years. She is married and has 4 children. Two of her children are in college. Her husband’s earnings were not enough to provide for their family. To supplement her family’s income, Mukadam I. engaged in business. She began by selling clothing for children. She asks for $200 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold to pay for renovation of her family’s apartment.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Исобоева Муккадам-36 лет, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 4 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 7 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Двое ее детей учатся в ВУЗ-е. Муж зарабатывал мало, и им не хватало средств на проживание, поэтому она решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Свою деятельность начала с продажи детской одежды. Исобоевой Муккадам необходимо 200$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратит на ремонт квартиры.

loans.use: To increase the volume of the goods sold

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru:
Sanavbar K. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 4 years. She has been in business for no less than 10 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are in college. Sanavbar K. began her business by selling clothing for men. She buys her goods in Bishkek. She asks for $300 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Санавбар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 4 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 10 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Дети учатся в ВУЗ-х. Свою деятельность начала с продажи мужской одежды. За товаром ездит в Бишкек. Ей необходимо 300$ для увеличения товарооборота.

loans.use: To increase the volume of the goods sold

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar K. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 3 years. She has been in business for no less than 9 years. She is married and has 3 children. Dilbar K. started her business by selling apples. Today, she also sells bananas, cherries, etc. She asks for $600 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold during this fruit season.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кобилова Дилбар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 9 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Свою деятельность начала с продажи яблок. Сейчас также торгует бананами, черешней и т.д. Так как сейчас сезон фруктов, ей необходимо 600$ для увеличения товарооборота.

loans.use: To increase the volume of the goods sold

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Sadriddin M. has been an active client of MLF MicroInvest for over 3 years. He has been in business for no less than 7 years. He is married and has 3 children. Sadriddin M. started his shoes selling business with only $200 in startup capital. He personally buys and delivers goods from his suppliers. Now his business value has grown to $800. He needs $600 loan to increase the volume of the goods sold to use the profits to pay for his mother’s medical expenses.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муйдинов Садриддин, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 3 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 7 лет. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Свою деятельность начал с продажи мужской обуви, его актив составлял 200$. За товаром ездит сам. Сейчас его активы составляют 800$. Ему необходимо 600$ для увеличения товарооборота, а полученную прибыль потратить на лечение своей матери.

loans.use: To increase the volume of the goods sold

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: P. Mavluda is a married, has three children and three grandchildren.  Her husband works as a security guard in a private company. She worked as a laboratory assistant in a boiler plant before. She has had her own business selling underclothes and dresses for 3 years. She started her business with 100 USD. Now she has a 2000 USD in investment. She would like to extend her business, so requests additional support in the amount of 875 USD. Nobody helps her with her business.

loans.use: To purchase new goods.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
A 28-year-old mother of two children who are students, Soeun K. T. lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement the entire family income, she runs a tailoring business and makes on average about $6/day, while her husband drives a passenger trailer attached to a motor-bike and typically makes about $3 each day.

In order to maximize profit, Soeun K. T. has an idea to replace the trailer to a car so that she can make much more revenue. To do so , she is currently requesting a loan amount of $1200. Combined with her savings, she thinks it enables her to purchase a simple car for her husband to operate a taxi business which offers a big amount of profit in return. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a simple car to operate a taxi business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Soeun Kun Thear has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San V. L., 48 years old and a mother of 3 children, lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She doesn't run any business besides cooking meals for her members in a family. Meanwhile, her husband operates a motor-taxi business and barely makes enough to service in his household. To help supplement the entire family income, two of her children run a tailoring business and typically make around $5/day, which is a big help to the family's expense.

In order to increase her family's saving and maximize the size of the business, San V. L. is humbly requesting a loan amount of $1000 to purchase tailoring tools such as cloth, thread, and a sewing machine to facilitate her children's business. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to expand her children's business by adding more sewing machines and hiring a few people to help them.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread, and sewing machine to run a tailoring business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! San Van Lim has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala is a mother of one child. She is 47, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She has raised cattle. Lala started this business 8 years ago. Now she requests a loan of $475 to buy a cow for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Alvan

texts.en: Alvan is married and has 3 children. He is 57, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He has sheep. He started this business 15 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy grass and fodder for his sheep.

loans.use: to buy grass and fodder

loans.name: Alvan

texts.en: Alvan was born in 1965, lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has 3 children. He raises cattle. He has calves and he wants to buy a cow for increasing his herd. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow and grass.

loans.use: To buy a cow and grass

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida was born in 1975, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is a mother of 3 children. In the beginning of her business she bought a cow and so she began her own business . Now she applies for a loan of  $475 to buy 2 meaty calves.

loans.use: To buy 2 meaty calves

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif is married and has 2 children. He is 40, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. Asif has raised cattle for 6 years. He has calves and cows. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy grass.

loans.use: To buy grass

loans.name: Huseyinaga

texts.en: Huseyinaga was born in 1970 and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has 2 children. He has been in this business for 7 years. Now he applies for a loan of $475 to buy hay.

loans.use: To buy hay

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian has a metal shop where he works with metal (windows, doors, curtains, drawers, and others). His wife helps him and he also has two employees to whom he pays per work finished and one helper on salary. His shop is located in the cross roads of the village of San Antonio in the city of La Paz and his home is located in the street 13 de Junio # 28 on the same area. This is the second time he requests a loan. And his history with our institution indicates his first loan was paid in time and qualifies him as client 0, which means excellent payment of the loan. The amount requested is to buy raw material (iron bars, rounded and straight, electrodes). His previous records and his work qualify him to access this credit, because of experience in his business, which gives him income to cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Don Nestor sells fruits like grapes, apples, peaches, avocados, etc. in the market. He has 10 years of experience in this business. His business hours are from 6am to 1pm. He began as a street vendor of several articles and with his savings decided to buy fruits and get a place in the market. He has long experience and good usual clients.

Don Nestor wishes to buy a larger variety of fruits, he also wants to help his wife who is currently selling makeup products, and also because of high demand he would like to invest to increase his capital.

Don Nestor is 40 years old, he lives with his wife in free union for 18 years. They have 3 small kids who are in school. They have their own house which is made out of cement and very modest. His wife sells make-up products and helps with the home expenses. They have a very stable relationship. Don Nestor wants to improve his family’s quality of life with our loan.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy larger variety of fruits

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura sells all kinds of pampers and articles for babies, she also sells juices, sodas, yogurts, etc. She has 2 years in the business. She began with some capital from his husband and she began selling first at her home and then she established the store of pampers. Her business is open from 9am to 9pm every day. She has 10 years of experience in the business.

Laura wants to buy more merchandise for babies. Her business is very well located and has lots of demand. Also she acquires products at lower costs because she buys inventory in cash.

Laura is 29 years old, is married and has 3 kids, 2 of them are already in school. She lives at her mom’s house, which is a 2 floors house made of cement. Also her husband works in a business that imports home appliances and with his salary he helps at home. She wants a loan from Kiva in order to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for babies

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Mrs. Lilian has a party supplies store for 18 years already. She started it with her savings from the money her husband gave to her and bought merchandise. She sells yogurt, juices, snacks and presents and toys. Her business hours are from 6am to 10pm every day. She has lots of experience in this activity.

Mrs. Lilian whishes to buy more merchandise like pampers and candies, because her business is located a block away from the school and she has lots of demand for candy, also her husband has a business of stamps and would like to buy a machine to help in the creation of stamps..

Mrs. Lilian is 37 years old and has 4 kids, all of them are in school. Her husband creates all types of stamps for the Postal office in Guayaquil, colleges and schools, with both businesses they support their home and both work hard to succeed. Her house is a 1 floor made of cement and modest. When she learned about Kiva loans she got very interested and would like to apply in order to grow and improve her quality of life and her family.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy products for babies and kids

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto has a grocery store where he sells food, candy and school supplies and is located at his home since last year. His business hours are from. 6am to 10pm. Without experience and with small savings from his previous job he decided to begin his own source of income. His business has succeeded thanks to the constant dedication and hard work he and his wife have given to it.

Roberto needs a loan in order to buy more inventory, a hanger to improve presentation and products conservancy. Because he is in a very good location and has few competitors, his clients have requested him to provide them a larger variety of products.

Roberto is 55 years old and his wife helps him with customer service and buying products for the business. They have 3 children who are grown and independent. His house is located near the ocean stream. The house is made out of wood and the floor is in the soil. With the credit he would like to improve his business and his life turning into an example for the community.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy more inventory and a hanger for his products

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is 27 years old. She has five children and her husband is a construction worker. She is an artisan who manufactures typical regional blouses. She makes the blouses and then embroiders their neck and sleeves with colorful flowers (which is typical regional artisan work). She sells these blouses to a store inside the San Cristobal de las Casas artisans market. Esperanza is part of a solidarity group called Montebello1 with Guadalupe Gomez Gomez, who raises pigs and sells them locally. Esperanza wants to get the loan in order to purchase thread and fabric to continue making blouses. Maria wants the loan to purchase pig food (maize and restaurant´s waste) and plague-preventing medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

ESPERANZA TIENE 27 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO ALBAÑIL . ELLA ES ARTESANA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR BLUSAS DE MANTA Y POSTERIORMENTE LAS BORDA EN EL CUELLO Y LAS MANGAS CON FLORES DE DIVERSOS COLORES (ARTESANIA TIPICA DE LA REGION), Y LE VENDE A UNA PERSONA QUE TIENE ESTABLECIDO UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO DE ARTESANIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS. ESPERANZA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MONTEBELLO 1 Y LO INTEGRAN: GUADALUPE GOMEZ GOMEZ QUE SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS Y LOS VENDE CON GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD. CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERANZA COMPRARA TELA E HILOS PARA SEGUIR HACIENDO BLUSAS,Y MARIA COMPRARA ALIMENTO (MAIZ Y DESPERDICIOS DE LOS RESTAURANTES) Y MEDICINAS PARA EVITAR PLAGAS.

loans.use: purchase thread and fabric to embroider blouses

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 34 years old. She has six children and her husband is a construction worker. She raises pigs and sells them to people that commercialize them in the consumption market. She is part of a group called Montebello1 with Esperanza Mendez Morales, who also raises pigs. At the moment, the pigs live at Juana's and Esperanza's home. They want to use the loan in order to get a bigger place for the animals to live and to increase their reproduction.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

JUANA TIENE 34 AÑOS, SEIS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO ALBAÑIL. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS Y LO VENDE CON GENTE QUE LO COMERCIALIZA EN EL MERCADO EL CONSUMO. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO LLAMADO MONTEBELLO 1, QUIENES LO INTEGRAN: ESPERANZA MENDEZ MORALES QUE SE DEDICA TAMBIEN A LA CRIANZA DE PUERCOS. ACTUALMENTE EL LUGAR EN DONDE TIENE LOS ANIMALES ESTA EN SUS CASAS, CON EL PRESTAMO PRETENDEN OBTENER UN LUGAR MAS AMPLIO PARA QUE LOS ANIMALES HABITEN Y AUMENTAR LA REPRODUCCION DE LOS MISMOS.

loans.use: purchase a pig stable to increase pig reproduction and keep them away from their homes

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona is 36 years old. She has four children. She separated from her husband due to his alcohol and physical abuse. She makes corn "tostadas" and sells them in San Cristobal de las Casas, which is about an hour away from where she lives. Petrona is part of a solidarity group called Azalia3 integrated by: Irma Sanchez Santiago, who also makes corn "tostadas", and Cristina Hernandez Bautista, who owns a store at home. Petrona and Irma would use the loan to purchase corn and firewood. Cristina would use it to enlarge her store. They are very hard working women who not only want their business to grow, but also want to better their economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

PETRONA TIENE 36 AÑOS, CUATRO HIJOS, SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO POR CAUSA DEL ALCOHOL Y EL MAL TRATO. ELLA SE DEDICA A ELABORAR TOSTADAS DE MAIZ Y LO VENDE EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS UBICADO A UNA HORA DE DONDE VIVE. PETRONA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO AZALIA 3 QUIENES LO INTEGRAN: IRMA SANCHEZ SANTIAGO QUE ELABORA TOSTADAS DE MAIZ Y CRISTINA HERNANDEZ BAUTISTA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA. CON EL PRESTAMO PETRONA E IRMA COMPRARAN LEÑA Y MAIZ, CRISTINA COMPRARA LO NECESARIO PARA AMPLIAR SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES. ELLAS SON MUJERES TRABAJADORAS QUE NO SOLAMENTE QUIEREN QUE SU NEGOCIO CREZCA SINO TAMBIEN MEJORAR SU CONDICION ECONOMICA.

loans.use: Purchase corn and firewood to produce artisan food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his store and buy spare parts for bicycle repair.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
Maria de la paz is 26 years old. She has two children and her husband works for a construction material dealership. She makes "Morraletas" that are bags used to store market purchases. "Morraletas" are made of thin colored plastic (usually 0.5 to 1 cm. thick). She uses wooden rectangular molds of various sizes in order to shape the "Morraletas". She is part of a solidarity group called Marcos8 integrated by Maria G. Sanches, who makes maize "tostadas". They both go to San Cristobal de las Casas to sell their produce. Maria de la Paz would use the loan to purchase more material to continue producing "Morraletas" and Maria would to purchase maize and firewood.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman. Kiva Volunteer

MARIA DE LA PAZ TIENE 26 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA COMPAÑÍA REPARTIENDO MATERIALES PARA CONSTRUCCION. ELLA SE DEDICA HACER MORRALETAS (BOLSA QUE SE USA PARA ALMACENAR LAS COSAS QUE SE COMPRAN EN EL MERCADO), QUE ESTA HECHO DE MATERIAL PLASTICO DELGADO (0.5 A 1 CM DE ANCHO) QUE SON DE DIVERSOS COLORES. PARA HACER ESTO ELLA UTILIZA UN MOLDE DE MADERA EN FORMA RECTANGULAR DE DISTINTOS TAMAÑOS EL CUAL SIRVE PARA DARLE FORMA DE MORRALETAS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MARCOS 8 Y LO INTEGRA MARIA G. SANCHEZ QUE HACE TOSTADAS DE MAIZ, AMBAS LO LLEVAN A VENDER A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS. CON EL PRESTAMO MARIA DE LA PAZ COMPRARA MATERIAL PARA SEGUIR CON LA PRODUCCION DE MORRALETAS Y MARIA COMPRARA MAIZ Y LEÑA.

loans.use: Purchase material to increase production of market bags

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria is 40 years old. She has five children and she separated from her husband about five years ago due to alcohol and physical abuse. She owns a grocery store at home where she sells salt, sugar, oil and candies. She is part of a solidarity group called Marcos8 integrated by Juana Gomez Gomez, who manufactures colorful "Morraletas" (grocery market bags). Juanita uses rectangular wooden molds of various sizes in order to manufacture the "Morraletas". These molds help shape the final product. Maria Guadalupe would use the loan to purchase various necessary products and Juana would purchase plastic and molds.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA VICTORIA TIENE 40 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, HACE COMO CINCO AÑOS SE SEPARO DE SU ESPOSO POR EL ALCOHOL Y EL MALTRATO. ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN DONDE VENDE SAL, AZUCAR, ACEITE, DULCES. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MARCOS 8 Y LO INTEGRA JUANA GOMEZ GOMEZ QUE HACE MORRALETAS (BOLSA QUE SE USA PARA ALMACENAR LAS COSAS QUE SE COMPRAN EN EL MERCADO)QUE SON DE DIVERSOS COLORES. PARA HACER ESTO JUANA UTILIZA UN MOLDE DE MADERA EN FORMA RECTANGULAR DE VARIOS TAMAÑOS EL CUAL SIRVE PARA DARLE FORMA AL PRODUCTO TERMINADO. CON EL PRESTAMO MARIA GUADALUPE SURTIRA SU TIENDA CON LOS PRODUCTOS NECESARIOS Y JUANA COMPRARA PLASTICO Y MOLDES.

loans.use: grocery store supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beatuy supplies, articles for the hair and improve her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy school supplies and other products for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts to increase inventory and to pay his suppliers.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra is 33 years old. She has four children and her husband works in the maize fields. She makes corn "tostadas" and sells them in San Cristobal de las Casas which is about an hour away from where she lives. She also sells her produce with people that know her and request orders. She is part of a solidarity group called Mar3 integrated by: Laura Gonzalez Zuñiga, who sells female cosmetics, creams and perfumes and Margarita Zuñiga Ton, who sells shoes to people from her town. Alejandra would use the loan to purchase more firewood and corn. Laura and Alejandra get their supplies wholesale in order to decrease costs.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

ALEJANDRA TIENE 33 AÑOS, CUATRO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN LA SIEMBRA DEL MAIZ. ELLA SE DEDICA A ELABORAR TOSTADAS DE MAIZ Y LO VENDE EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS UBICADO A UNA HORA DE SU LOCALIDAD, TAMBIEN VENDE CON PERSONAS QUE LA CONOCEN Y LE HACEN LOS PEDIDOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO MAR 3, QUIENES LO INTEGRAN: LAURA GONZALEZ ZUÑIGA SE DEDICA A VENDER COSMETICOS, CREMAS Y PERFUMES PARA LA MUJER; MARGARITA ZUÑIGA TON VENDE ZAPATOS CON LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD. CON EL PRESTAMO ALEJANDRA COMPRARA LEÑA Y MAIZ; LAURA Y ALEJANDRA SE ABASTECERAN AL POR MAYOR PARA REDUCIR COSTOS.

loans.use: purchase wholesale corn and firewood to produce corn tostadas

loans.name: Maria Artiles

texts.en:
Maria A. lives with Manuel Hidalgo in the community of Munoz and runs a small grocery store that she calls Cafateria Artile. This $150 loan will go to purchase refrigerated goods such as meat, dairy products and beverages. She has already paid off a previous loan with Esperanza and has gone through business training courses to help her develop her microenterprise.

Maria is a member of an Esperanza Bank of Hope in Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. Though living in an impoverished community, Maria’s group of women forms a strong bond to hold one another accountable to repay their loan and develop their business while offering social support.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerated goods

loans.name: Arisleida

texts.en:
Born in Yamasá, a town some 30 kilometers (about 18 miles) northeast of the capital city of Santo Domingo, Arisleida, a mother of two ( 16 and 17), used to sell personal hygiene products. About 4 years ago she started selling (with her husband) fruits, beans, and other foodstuff.

She has established her business on a road which brings a decent developing market. Today she buys the food for resale in the city warehouses. Having to pay expensive public transportation every time she goes to the city, she needs to maximize her grocery purchases to minimize inventory costs. Hence her loan request.

loans.use: Buying supplies for her business

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette P. raises lives with Joseph Sedeño. Together they raise their four children, Yesica Brasa (15), Junior Pierret (14), Miguel Andap (12) and Alexi Martino (3).

Bernadette has run her own general store and is currently working to expand her business ventures to include a clothing shop. She has gone through Esperanza’s business training and has successfully participated in Esperanza’s program. Bernadette has requested this loan of $200 to expand her inventory of women and men’s clothing.

loans.use: Expand inventory of apparel

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, born in Yamasá, started selling natural medicine products 2 years ago, but reached a slump when she ran out of money to buy more product. This circumstance maD. her stop her selling activity. With the requested loan, she wants to initiate restocking of natural herbs and thereby renew her sales activity over time. She intends to buy the medicine in the capital, Santo Domingo, an hour’s travel time from her community in Yamasá. Thus, to minimize costs, she intends to buy more products on each trip.

She also works at the nearby Yamasá hospital. When she got separated from her husband, in order to feed her 5 children, she needed this stable job. It wasn’t enough. That is why, at the same time she needs to continue her former business.

loans.use: To buy natural medicine products for resale

loans.name: Alba Iris

texts.en:
Alba, an elderly lady, used to work in a duty free zone for seven years. Lately, she’s been working (for three years) selling beans to the neighbors in her community, Palma Real. The fact is that many would rather buy the cooked beans instead of burning the otherwise costly amount of energy (usually natural gas) needed for cooking them. She works on the beans from 9-12 A.M. and sells clothing in the afternoon. With this loan Alba intends to buy more beans and natural gas to increase her production and income.

She has to support 6 people who live with her: 4 of her own children, 1 grandchild, and her husband. He is the “doorman” in a construction company warehouse, and without Alba’s help his income would not be sufficient to feed the family.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business

loans.name: Khadidja

texts.en:
Khadidja was born in 1965. She is married, has 2 children and lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. She started her business 6 years ago.
First she bought a pregnant cow and she increased the number of her cows.
Now she requests a loan of $475 to buy 2 calves for improving her business and to get a better income.

loans.use: To buy 2 calves

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a mother of one child. She is divorced from her husband and  she bringing up her child alone. She has raises cattle to support her child. 
Halima has 12 years of experience in this business.
Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy hay ( grass ) for the cattle.
This kind woman is  36 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Djabrayil region, settled in the Salyan region, Yenikand village.

loans.use: To buy hay

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira was born in 1950. She is a mother of 4 children and lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village.
She has her own orchard, where she raises strawberries.
Elmira has been in this business for 7 years.
Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer and medicine  which is used  for the strawberries

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine , which is used in her orchard for strawberries

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila is a 57 year old mother of 4 children,. She lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. 
She has raised poultry for 30 years. 
Nazila needs a loan of $725 to buy 100 hens,and 50 Indian guinea hens for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy 100 hens, 50 Indian guinea hens

loans.name: Djavanshir

texts.en:
Djavanshir  raises sheep and calves. He is 57 and lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is  married, has 3 children. 
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy sheep and calves to improve his business and get a better income for his family

loans.use: To buy sheep and calves

loans.name: Ziyafat

texts.en:
Ziyafat is married and has 3 children. He is 37and lives inthe  Salyan region, Yenikand village. 
He has his own shop  where he sells decorations.
Ziyafat has been in this business for 4 years. 
Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy decorations more expand his business.

loans.use: To buy decorations

loans.name: Shorku

texts.en: Shorku is 44 years old and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She is single. She has been farming her own plot of land for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of $375 to buy fertilizer to improve the yield of her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 49 years old , an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. She is marriedand has a child.
Fatma has her own drugstore. She has been in this business for 5 years.
Now she needs a loan of  $950 to expand the area of  her drugstore and to buy medicines.

loans.use: To expand the area of  her drugstore and to buy medicines

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. 
This 34-year-old man is married andhas 2 children. He has his own shop where he sells mobile phones. He has run this business for 4 years.
Now he needs a loan of  $1200 to expand his shop.

loans.use: To expand his shop

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en:
Gunduz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Makhmudlu village. He is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.
Gunduz has raised sheep for 5 years.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 30 sheep to expand his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 30 sheep

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en:
Hafiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He is married and has 2 children.
He has run this business for 5 years. Hafiz supports his family by selling milk.
Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy a milk cow  to increase his milk sales.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Isakh

texts.en:
Isakh is 36 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDP. He is married and has 2 children.
This young man has sold milk for 5 years. 
Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: He would like to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Gulbuta

texts.en:
Gulbuta is a mother of 3 children. She is 50 years old,  an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
6 years ago she decided to start her own business. She has raised cattle.
Now she requests a loan of $950 to purchase a pregnant cow. She plans to increase the number of her cows to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Hadiya

texts.en:
Hadiya is a mother of 2 children. She run this business 5 years ago. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the  occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
This 36-year-old young woman raises cattle. Now she needs a loan of $950 to buy 2 cows.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  hasrun this business for 4 years. She is is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
This 34-year-old woman is married and has a child. 
Previiously she bought a cow and so she supported her family. 
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the number of her cows and to meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock of rope and expand his market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock his store

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo is married and retired. His wife stays at home, so he is the sole provider of the family's income. When he retired, he realised he needed a greater income in order to support his family since his pension was insufficient.

Therefore, he decided to start his own business. With time, his business grew little by little and now his shop is too small for the demand and his growing client portfolio.

He is a person with a great will to live and pull through to leave his family with a greater patrimony and improve their quality of life.

Arturo is requesting a loan for US $925 in order to expand his shop, since it's too small to serve all the clients he has. He is proposing to pay back the loan in 6 months and is thankful of your support which will allow him to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Arturo es un hombre casado y jubilado, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar y el tiene que mantener a su familia, cuando se jubilo de su trabajo, el necesitaba tener una mayor fuente de ingreso ya que su pensión era insuficiente para mantener a su familia, por ello decidió abrir su propio negocio, con el tiempo el fue creciendo poco a poco y ahora ya tiene un taller que le esta quedando pequeño para la demanda que tiene y su cartera de clientes se ha incrementado. Él es una persona con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante para dejarle a su familia un patrimonio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Arturo esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para poder ampliar su negocio ya que el espacio con el que cuenta esta muy pequeño para cubrir a todos los clientes que tiene, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y les agradece mucho su apoyo para poder continuar con su crecimiento.

loans.use: Purchasing parts

loans.name: Flerida

texts.en:
Flerida has a stand where she sells fruit in a local market. She started off with a very small amount of investment capital and with her husband’s help learned the trade quickly. She has been doing this type of work for about 10 years along with her husband.

The most difficult part of this business is offering competitive prices to the customer. In order to do this Flerida requested a loan so that she may purchase her fruits at wholesale quantities and prices. She did very well with her first loan and is hoping to take out a second. She will continue to invest in wholesale fruits in an effort to increae her supply and diversify the fruits she sells.

She and her husband have three children together including one who they are currently putting through college. Her dream is to have all her kids attain a college degree.

loans.use: By her products wholesale

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra has had a general store in her house for three years. She is open for business from 7am to 10pm. They started the store with the very little money she was able to raise with the help of her husband. She's been able to keep up the business thanks to her constant dedication and the good service Mayra provides to her clients.

Mayra requests a loan to buy new products and increase the variety of products in her store. In this way, she'll be able to take advantage of the good location of her house, since there isn't much competition in the area.

Mayra is 27 years old. Her husband works as a farm labourer. They have 3 small children, who are still studying. Her house has a mixed structure made of cement and wood; its floor is made of soil. They wish that with the product of their work they can improve their family's quality of life and be an example to the people in the area where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Mayra tiene su negocio de venta de víveres desde hace 3 anos en su vivienda. El horario de atención es de7.a.m. A 10 p.m. Lo inicio con poco capital que con la ayuda de su esposo lograron juntarlo. Lo ha logrado mantener gracias a la constante dedicación y buen servicio que Mayra brinda a sus clientes.

Mayra solicita el crédito para comprar nuevos productos y dar variedad a su negocio. Y de esta forma aprovechar la buena ubicación en el sector donde casi no tiene competencia.

Mayra tiene 27 años. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero. Tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian. Su vivienda es de estructura mixta cemento y madera. Su piso es de tierra. Su deseo es que con el producto de su trabajo mejorar la condición de vida de su familia y ser ejemplo en el sector donde habitan.

loans.use: Purchasing new products and increase the variety of products

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: DO NOT POST

loans.use: Surtir su negocio y mejorar la presentacion de sus productos

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz has been running her business for 4 years. She started working in a packaging company, where she managed to save money to start her own business. She was motivated by a friend to start selling these products. She works every day of the week visiting her clients in the area where she lives. She works from 9am to 4pm. Besides, she keeps another business in her house where she sells colas and drinks.

She will invest this loan in purchasing cosmetics and jewelry. And another part of the loan she will invest in supplying her house business with colas, drinks and juices.

Luz is a single mother. She has 5 children who are all studying. She's been able to pull her family through thanks to her work. Her children are very happy with how her mother is facing her responsibility. She wishes to be able to finish building her house little by little. And in this way provide her children with a better living environment. She hopes she can make their dreams come true, with the support she provides them with.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Luz tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio. Se inicio trabajando en una empacadora de donde logro ahorrar dinero para poner su propio negocio. Por medio de una amiga le motivo para trabajar vendiendo estos productos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana visitando a sus clientes por el sector. Su horario es de 9 a.m. hasta las 16:00 p.m. Además en su domicilio se dedica a la venta de colas y bebidas.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y bisutería. Otra parte del crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio de venta de colas, bebidas, jugos.

Luz es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos los que estudian. Ella ha base de trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Los cuales están contentos con el acto de responsabilidad de su madre. Su deseo es poder poco a poco terminar de construir su casa. Y de esta manera darles un mejor ambiente a ellos. Espera con la ayuda que se le brinda poder cumplir sus sueños.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and drinks

loans.name: Qamar Gul

texts.en:
Qamar Gul lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with all the members of her family. She is married and her husband is sick so he can’t work and she is the only to support her family.

She is a tailor. She took her 1st cycle group loan and bought new machines. She wants to take anther loan to buy extra materials for her work and expand her business to help her family more. She is happy that she can make a good future for her family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old has two children. He has a small shop in the Kirkuk market. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He wants to buy up more goods for his shop and increase his income and enhance his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 23 years old, single, and lives with his disabled mother in his home. He has a small mini-market. He wants the loan to purchase an ice box to sell ice cream. He wants to marry in the next year and therefore he depends on his business to develop himself and build a strong future.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 23 years old, single, living with his mother and sister. He has a small shop to sell spare part for cars and vehicles. He got his shop from his father who died in a terrorist attack. He wants to get $1200 to purchase new goods. He wants to improve and enhance his life. He is looking forward to increasing his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new goods

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. is a mother of four children.  With a jobless husband, she manages multiple businesses to support the family. She runs a small shop in her home and, assisted by her young sister, Kadiatu, sells pans and second-hand clothes from door to door in addition to her small store.  Kadiatu uses the income to pay her children’s school expenses and daily needs for the the family. She joined SMT two years ago and invested her last loan to diversify her businesses and would like to take another loan to expand the business so that her husband can participate in hawking/door-to-door selling.

loans.use: Purchase stock of second-hand clothes and pans for addtional salesperson

loans.name: Manseray

texts.en: Forty five years old, Manseray lives on the outskirts of Makeni town in Sierra Leone with her four children and husband.  While her husband is employed as a driver, his earnings do not cover the family expenses.  Four years after the civil war in the country, Manseray started her small soap-making business with capital of only $10. Later, she joined SMT and obtained a small loan for expanding.  On a small scale, Manseray diversified her business to the selling of fire wood.  She will use the requested loan funds to expand both her soap-making and firewood selling businesses.  She is planning to build a small shelter/store for the firewood business.

loans.use: Building a small shelter to house firewood stock

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: Mabinty is 40 years old and a mother of four children, living in the Makup Bana Village outside of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Engaging only in subsistence farming, Mabinty and her husband realized that they could not educate their children and provide for their basic needs.  She started an innovative business of selling fish deep into remote rural villages.  With her previous loans, Mabinty purchased fish and supplied her argents in various villages and collected the sales after one week.  Her business services village dwellers who would have to walk long distances away to Makeni town only to buy fish for a meal.  Mabinty is planning to expand the outreach of her business and with the profits has a plan to add an iron sheet roof  to her house.

loans.use: Increase amount of fresh fish stock purchased for wholesale business

loans.name: Paa Kuri

texts.en: Paa Kari M. lives in Makup Bana Village, outside Makeni, and is a village leader.  Sixty-five years old, Paa Kari is married and has seven children.  His wife assists him in managing their small shop while he is also engaged in subsistence farming.  Paa Kari is requesting the loan funds for expanding the variety of  goods in his shop to attract more customers.

loans.use: Expand variety of stock in small grocery shop

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab K. has a small grocery shop in a village on the outskirts of Makeni town.  She is one of only a few traders in the community and her store is very popular there. Thirty-six years old, she is married to a teacher and they have five children.  Since teachers' salaries are very small, Zainab’s business income plays a crucial role in the paying of education expenses for her children and other basic needs. Her previous loan from SMT, her first, was used to expand the business by purchasing more stock.  She would like to use the loan funds from this second loan for a similar purpose.

loans.use: Increase stock in grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorbicycle

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and works with his brother in a laundry. He and his brother are responsible for taking care of a big family. This is his first loan from AL-Aman. He want sto paint the shop and repair the laundry machine. He wants to increase his income and open a new branch of his shop in another place.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Paint the shop and repair the laundry machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants to sell beer, but her shop is open and too hot, so she needs a roof on her storage room.

texts.en: Mrs. B. is 46 years old and married. Her husband, 50 years old, is a fisherman, and she sells dried fish, a delicacy in Vietnam. They live in a coastal village in Nghe An province, the upper middle of Vietnam. They have 5 children: 2 sons and 3 daughters, between 14 and 25. Having 5 children is financially very hard and that's why she joined TYM. With the TYM loans it's possible for her to buy more materials and fish for her business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 57 years of age, as is her husband. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. They have a trading shop for building materials. Her husband is very sick so Mrs. L. has to do all the work by herself. Her three children are already living on their own. Before joining TYM she borrowed money from local money lenders, who charged interest of at least 2% flat per month. She wants to invest more in her shop and buy ornaments to sell as well. Her profit iscurrently $300.00 per month.

loans.use: To buy more ornaments and building equipment for her shop

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov S. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S.'s husband is a police officer and can make about $1.5 per day.  S., meanwhile, sells second-hand clothing at a shop at the local market.  This business activity generates an average of $4 per day for the family.  S. and her husband are the proud parents of three children.  Their oldest has just begun schooling, while the other two are still too young to attend school.  They hope to use this loan in order to purchase more second-hand clothing so that S. can expand her business.  In the future, the couple hopes that they will be able to build a new house for the family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for her business

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: N. T. T. Hoa is 38 years old. Her husband is N. Thu Thuy, and he is 39 years old. They have 3 children (12, 10, and 7 years old) who are in 7th, 5th, and 2nd class. He works as a daily labor, and she sells fruit at the Muong Man market. Their average income is 11$US/month/person. She wants to borrow 50$US to increase her capital.

loans.use: Sells fruit

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 37 years old, and her husband is 42. They have 2 children, a 14 yr old son and a 10 yr old daughter. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. It is very difficult for them as they have two children who are still in school. Before she had her shop, they had little money, but now it's getting better. She wants to borrow $500.00 to buy more shoes for her market stall. It's her intention to use the profit for building a bigger house with a bathroom and a kitchen.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her market stall

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: D. T. Hoa is 33 and her husband Huynh van Suu is also 33. The family has 5 persons. The elderly grandmother is 74. Mr. Suu and his wife raise green dragon bushes as a daily labor. Their children, ages 12 and 7, are in 4th grade and 1st grade at school. Their family's average income is US$13 per person per month. They want to borrow US$75 to invest in their green dragon garden. They will pay back US$15 per month over 5 months.

loans.use: invest in their green dragon garden

loans.name: Nhut

texts.en: N. V. Nhut is 34 and his wife Tôn nu thi Trinh is 29. They have two children, N. thi Thuy Vy (8 years old and in second grade) and N. Gia Quynh who is 2. They have 0.2ha that they have planted as a green dragon garden but they haven’t had enough capital to invest in fertilizer and insecticide. They work for somebody in their free time to supplement their income. They need to borrow US$75 and will pay back US$15 per month over 5 months.

loans.use: plant green dragon

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mrs. Suong S. is 25 years old and lives with her two children, her mother (pictured here because S. is unavailable), her nephew, and her niece in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. is now a widow, as her husband recently passed away.  For income, S. rents out rooms from her home to workers from the nearby garment factory.  She can make about $2.00 per day from this business activity.  S. is the mother of 2 children, both of whom are students.  She hopes to use this loan in order to build another room in their house so that they can increase their rental income.  In the future, S. hopes that she will be able to purchase a motorbike for her nephew so that he can work as a mototaxi driver.

loans.use: To build another room in their house in order to rent to garment workers

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
N. T. T. Phuong is 24 and her husband  Tran Van Lien is 20.
They have two children who are still young, ages 5 and 2. Phuong works at a green dragon store and earns a salary of US$ 562.50 per year. She only works six months a year. She sells groceries from her home in her free time and that brings in US$225 per year. The family's income per person per month is US$16.40. They need capital to invest in their green dragon garden so they want to borrow US$ 75 and will pay back $15 per month over 5 months.

loans.use: raising green dragon plants

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 42 years old, and her husband is 47. They have 3 children: her 21 year old son fixes motorbikes and her other sons, 17 and 12, are still in school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. She raises ducks and sells the eggs. Her husband makes bricks. At the moment she has 1700 ducks. Although this is a bird flu area, she's not worried for her own ducks, because they are all injected against it. It's hard to have children at school, because the summer classes cost $1.25 per child per day, and with an income of $250.00 per month it's very expensive. That's why she wants to buy more ducks and increase their income. Thanks to previous loans they were able to build a new, bigger house.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for her duck farm

loans.name: Loc

texts.en:
N. T. Loc is 27 and his wife Doan thi T. Loan is 21.
Loc works as a day laborer. They have a son who was born in 2006. They have 150 green dragon bushes and some land to plant rice, but they don't make much profit because of insect damage. Their average income is US$15 per person per month. They want to borrow US$75 to invest in their green dragon garden.

loans.use: raising green dragon bushes

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
