N. P. Chau is 40 and his wife Tran Thi Thuan is 42.
Chau earns US$ 625 per year from planting rice and green dragon bushes. Their two daughters, 14 and 10, are in the 7th & 4th class at school. The family' average income is US$13 per person per month. They want to borrow US$75 to invest in their green dragon garden so that they will get more profit  from it. They are sure they can repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: raising green dragon plants

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en: Mrs. Thlang S. is a 57-year-old widow living in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She lives with her five children, one of whom is a student, and the others have jobs at a small, private company.  S. has two sources of income.  The first is a small grocery shop that she runs from her home.  The second source of income comes from renting out rooms in her house to garment factory workers.  In total, she is able to make about $5 per day.  She hopes to use this loan in order to build more rooms to rent and also to purchase more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent in her house and also to purchase grocery products to sell at her shop

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: T. T. T. Nga is 30 and her husband Do Van Bao is 33. They have a son who is  in the first grade of a public school. Nga's husband grows green dragon bushes. Nga works as a clerk in a shop. Their elderly mother also lives with the family; she is 74. Their average income is US$13 per month per person. They want T. borrow US$75 T. invest in their green dragon garden so that they will get more profit from it. They will pay back the loan during the term.

loans.use: Plant green dragon bushes

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
T. T. L. Thanh is 24 and her husband T. Thanh Long is 27. 
They work as day laborers to provide food and other expenses for their family. They have two children (6 & 2 years old). Their average income is US$11.70 per person per month. They have planted 200 green dragon bushes that don't have fruit yet. They want to borrow US$75 to invest in their garden. They feel sure they will be abL. to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: raising green dragon plants

loans.name: Ahamad Zia

texts.en: Ahamad Zia lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated and is  unmarried. He is working to support his family. He has a shop selling cosmetics and clothes and he wants to take an individual loan to buy new kinds of clothes for woman and men and buy cosmetics like shampoo, cream, and other materials. He wants to expand his business to help his family and also make a good future for himself. He is very happy that he can solve his problems with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new kind of clothes and extra materials

texts.en: Mrs. N. is 33 years old, and her husband is 34. They have 2 children, a 12 yr old daughter and a 5 yr old son. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes tools for agriculture. She collects recyclables and sells them at her shop. The shop gives her a profit of $7.50 per day and the profit is mainly used for the education of her children. She wants a new loan to buy more recyclables to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more recyclables for her shop

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 37 years old and is married, her husband is also 37. They have two children, a 14 yr old son and a 4 yr old daughter. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband rents out work frames to building companies and she raises chickens and makes and repairs clothes. Many of her chickens died due to a strange disease (not bird flu). She wants to buy new chickens to create more income for the children's education. At the moment her income is $62.50 per month and her husband earns $125.00 per month.

loans.use: To invest in a bamboo work frame for hire, and buy chickens

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en: M. Rahim lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all the members of his family. He is educated, but he is also a tailor and wants to continue his tailoring. He wants to take an individual loan to buy machines and extra materials for his shop and also he wants to change the design of his shop to attract more clients and make a good income to help his family and support them better. He is happy now that he can help them.

loans.use: To buy machines and extra materials

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
T. Thi Hoa is 39 and her husband T. T. Sang is 37. The family has four persons. The parents sell bananas at the market. Their two children are in school. The family's average income is $10 per person per month.
They want to borrow $75 to increase their capital and be able to buy more bananas to sell. With their increased profit, they will be better able to cover the cost of their children’s education. They feel sure they will be able to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: selling bananas

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 41 years old, as is her husband. They have 3 daughters, 18, 14 and 13 yrs. old and they are all in school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. At the moment she raises chickens, pigs, and cows, and has a rice field. She wants to change the rice field into a fish pond, because the rice doesn't give them enough profit. She gets up every morning at 5:00 to feed the livestock and work on the rice fields. At 9:00 in the evening they have dinner and her working day is over.

loans.use: To invest in a fish pond

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 39 years old, and her husband is 40. They have 6 children, between 4 and 19 yrs., and four children are at school at the moment. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband buys pigs and she sells the meat of these pigs. She bought a milling machine with a previous TYM loan and now she needs a loan to buy yellow rice so she can thrash it with her milling machine and sell the white rice. Her profit is $6.25 per day. The profit is used to upgrade their housing conditions and for the school expenses of their children.

loans.use: To buy "yellow rice" for her milling machine

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 47 years old, as is her husband. They have 5 children: 2 sons and 3 daughters, between 9 and 18 yrs. The children are all at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middL. of Vietnam. They raise chickens, pigs, and water buffaloes. They also have land 4 kms away from their home, where they grow lemon, jackfruit and tea. They want to build a kitchen and bathroom attached to their house, as at the moment they don't have a bathroom at all.

loans.use: To build a kitchen and bathroom

loans.name: Pakiza

texts.en: Pakiza is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region.  She has settled in the village of Mahmudlu in the Fizuli region.  She is 51 and married with 3 children.  Pakiza started breeding cattle 5 years ago.  She now asks for a loan of $950 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the number of her cows and get a lot of milk.  That way she will be able to cover all her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

texts.en: Mrs. D. is 49 years old, and her husband is 50. They have 5 children between 17 and 24. Two are at school, one at university in Hanoi. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. She's been a member of TYM for six years, and before joining TYM she had to borrow from local money lenders, who charged 2% interest flat per month (around 55% per year). She bought a milling machine to thrash yellow rice into white and sell it, and besides that she also raises pigs, ducks, and water buffaloes. The profit she makes with the rice is going to be used to buy cows. Life before TYM was very difficult, now it's getting a little bit better, but they still find it very hard to raise 5 children. That's why they want to expand their business and create more profit.

loans.use: To buy yellow rice to thrash with her milling machine

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 34 years old, and her husband is 37 years old. They have three children between 2 and 13 yrs. Two of them are at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband is a cyclodriver in Vinh and works 11 hours a day, 30 days per month. She works on her rice fields, raises chickens and water buffaloes, and grows brown nuts. They want a loan so they can build a bathroom next to their house. At the moment they don't have a bathroom.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 25 years old, and her husband is 30 years old. They have 1 child, 7 months old. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam, where he works as a cyclodriver in Vinh city. Because his income is not enough, she provides extra income by raising pigs and ducks and growing rice. The pig farm is at her parents' house at the moment and they want to build their own, that's why they need a loan. At the moment she has two pigs, but once the farmyard is created she wants to have 5 or 6 pigs.

loans.use: To start a pig farm

texts.en: Mrs. K. is 39 years old, and her husband is 40. They have 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter, and they are all at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Her husband is a builder and earns $95.00 per month. Her oldest son needs to work part time in a local factory to provide the family with extra income, and he earns $75.00 per month. She raises pigs, and just sold 4 pigs which gave them an extra $45.00 (after 3 months raising). They want a new loan to build a bathroom, which her husband can build.

loans.use: To build a bathroom addition to her house

loans.name: Makhizar

texts.en: Makhizar is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. She has settled in the village of Bala Behmenli in the Fizuli region. She is 53 and married with 2 children.  Makhizar started breeding cattle 6 years ago.  She now asks for a loan of $725 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the number of her cows and get a lot of milk.  That way she will be able to cover all her family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

texts.en: Mrs. B. is 43 years old, and her husband is 45. They have 3 sons, who are 18, 16 and 14 years old and are all at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper middle of Vietnam. Together with her husband, she makes yogurt and candies, and during the summer she also makes ice cream. She needs the loan to buy more ingredients and to pay the suppliers promptly, instead of buying on credit with very high interest rates.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her ice cream and candy factory

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a married 34-year-old man with 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, living in Kayidish, a village built for IDPs.  

He opened his own small shop four years ago. He wishes to improve his life and to be able to cover all his  family expenses.  He needs a loan of $725 to expand the area of his shop and to attract more clients.

loans.use: to expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en:
Yagub is a 36 years old, married with 2 children.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan,  Fizuli region, living in the village of Akhmedallar.
Now he needs a loan of $725 to expand the area of his 4-year old store, where he sells foodstuffs, perfumery and other wares.

loans.use: to expand the area of his store

loans.name: Yazgul

texts.en: Yazgul is a 43-year-old woman with two children.  She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, living in the village of Kurdmakhmudlu.  She has  raised cattle for 7 years and now needs a loan of $950 to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Zarafshan

texts.en:
Zarafshan is a 44 year old mother of one child. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan,  Fizuli region, living in Kayidish, a village built for IDPs. 
She has raised cattled for 5 years and now applies for a loan of $475 to buy 2 calves for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves

loans.name: Ey

texts.en: Mr. Ey T. is 31 years old, single, and lives with his older sister in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, since his parents passed away many years ago. Her sister works in a laundry shop and makes a moderate income: about $1.2 each day. He is, meanwhile, a motor-taxi driver and makes around $3/day. Currently, he is asking for $500 to purchase a motor bike to operate a business. In the future, he and his sister hope to have enough money to open a cafe shop, where it would enable him to make additional profits to assist his sole family member.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to run a business.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Ey Theara for repaying the Kiva loan early!

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 38 years old, and her husband is 43. They have one son, 15 years old and one daughter 17 yrs old, both at school. They live in Nghe An province, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam.  Together with her husband, she raises frogs and eels and sells them from her house.  She wants a loan so that she can offer her frogs and eels to 8 restaurants in the area. This means that she has to invest more in her business to provide for these restaurants' needs.

loans.use: To buy more eels and frogs for trading

loans.name: Figan

texts.en: Figan is a 44 year old mother of 2 children.  She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Fizuli region, living in the village of Makhmudlu.  She has raised cattle for y years and now needs a loan of $1200 to buy a  Swiss cow.  She prefers to buy a Swiss cow because a Swiss cow gives more milk than other cows and this way she can increase her income more.

loans.use: to buy a  Swiss cow

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 22 years old, and her husband is 27 years old. They have a 1 year old son. While her husband makes and installs iron frames for windows, she runs a rice cracker bakery. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. The bakery has been a family business for over ten years now, and her profit is $3.00 per day. She wants a loan to pay the supplier of rice and sesame promptly, instead of buying on credit with very high interest rates.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sesame for her business

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 48 years old, and her husband is 50. They have 5 children, the oldest is 22 years old and the youngest 12 years old. Because they don't have enough money, the children have had to quit school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. Her husband has a vegetable stall at the local market and she sells porridge and breakfast at this same market. She needs the loan to pay her suppliers immediately instead of buying on credit with rates of 2.5% per month flat.

loans.use: To pay the suppliers for her porridge stall immediately instead of buying on credit

loans.name: Miraga

texts.en:
Miraga is 27 years old and married with one child.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, living in Kayidish, a village built for IDPs. 
This young man has supported his family with his own grocery store for three years.  Now he requests a loan of $950 to expand the area of his grocery store to improve his business and get good income.

loans.use: to expand the area of his grocery store

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 44 years old, and her husband is 48. They have two sons, 11 and 17, and both are at school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. Her husband is a worker at the local bicycle factory and she sells snacks at the local market. She needs a loan to buy more ingredients promptly from her suppliers. If she buys more she will get a discount of $62.50, and her profit will increase. This is the first time she has applied for a loan, and previously she sometimes bought ingredients on credit from her suppliers.

loans.use: To get better prices from her suppliers

loans.name: Tamilla

texts.en: Tamilla is a very kind woman and a mother of 2 children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, living in Kayidish, a village built for IDPs.  She has raised sheeps and goats for 5 years and now she needs a loan of $725 to buy 15 sheep to improve her sheep breeding.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean V. is 39 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband (picture here because because V. is unavailable) and a nephew in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells a variety of desserts near a primary school and typically makes on average $3/day, while her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman and contributes financially his daily wage to the household every day. One of her children is a construction worker, two are students, and another one is too young to attend school. Yean V. is currently requesting a loan of $500 to purchase her nephew a motorcycle so that he can help increase her family's saving by operating a motor-taxi. In a future, if she saves enough money, she would like to own a stand at a market selling a variety of fruits.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her nephew to operate a business.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Yean Vanny for repaying the Kiva loan early!

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 53 years old, and her husband died 8 years ago. She has two children: her 22 year old daughter goes to university in Hanoi; and her 20 year old son is at home but wants to go to school. She lives in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. She has run her shop for 18 years. Her profit is $93.00 per month, and she has to work 7 days a week from 6.30 am until 9.00 pm. Her children bring lunch and dinner to her shop. The profit is of course used for her children.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery shop

texts.en: Mrs. K. is 46 and is married to her 53 year old husband. They have 3 sons. Her 21 yr. old son studies economics in Hanoi, and her 17 and 14 yr. old sons are at school as well. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. They have run their own business for twenty years. They make and sell clothes, and their textiles are bought in Saigon. The loan will be used to buy more textiles. Before TYM they had loans from other organizations, which were more expensive and they had to pay monthly instead of weekly, which is much easier for them.

loans.use: To buy more textiles

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 49 years old, and her husband is 50. They have three children, ages 19 to 26 who all have left the house. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. Mrs. H. raises pigs and washes dishes for the next door restaurant; her husband fixes bicycles. She wants to buy more breeding pigs to increase her income. A breeding pig will give birth to piglets after three months and can do that twice a year. Mrs. H. earns $25.00 per month with dishwashing and the pig raising gives her an extra $50.00 per month.

loans.use: to buy more breeding pigs

texts.en: Mrs. B. is 47 years old and is married. They have 5 children; two are still at home. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. Mrs. B. raises pigs and cows and wants to invest more in her farm. Last year ,she also took a loan to improve her house. The pigs and cows are also for trading. She just sold 8 piglets for $ 325. The profit is used for her children's education.

loans.use: to  buy more cows for her farm

texts.en: Mrs. C. is 31 yrs old, and her husband is 32. They have two children, ages 8 and 12, both at school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. Mrs. C. sells pork at the local market. She buys pigs from farmers and sells the meat. Before joining TYM she borrowed money from local lenders at very high rates. Since joining TYM she has to pay less interest, and her extra profit is mainly used for the education of her children.

loans.use: She wants to do some maintenance on her house

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 40 years old and her husband is 42. They have four children, two sons and two daughters, between the ages of 17 and 6. All of them go to school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. Mrs. H.'s husband is a construction worker and he has no regular income. Sometimes he's away for projects far away and sometimes he's at home. To provide extra income, Mrs. H. runs a farm. She has rice fields, grows groundnuts, and has a fish pond. She wants to buy cows so she can plough her fields, which will make the work easier. She just sold her breeding pigs for $ 200.

loans.use: to buy cows for her farm

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 42 years old and her husband is 44. They have four children between the ages of 15 and 22. One child is at university and two are at school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of Vietnam. They run a recycling shop and they have three staff members. Mrs. T. wants to buy more recyclables because that will enable them to sell the recyclables directly to their clients instead of selling to an intermediary. In that case, her profit will increase.

loans.use: She wants to buy more recyclables for her shop

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 49 yrs. old, and so is her husband. They have four sons; two are still at school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the center of Vietnam. Mrs. L. raises pigs and has a fishpond, and besides that she sells beer. She wants to become a local agent for Bia Hai Phong. With selling beer she can make a profit of $ 12.50 per day.

loans.use: She wants to buy beer from the supplier and become their only agent

texts.en: Mrs. N. is 59 years old, and her husband is 61. They have 6 children; 2 are abroad and the others are already married. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the upper center of VietN.. Mrs. N. has a grocery shop and her husband is a fisherman. They want to buy a new fishing boat together with 2 other families. They each have to invest $ 500. In the future she also wants to invest more in her shop.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif A. is 51. He is married and has four children. He was born in Saatli and has lived there for his entire life. The difficult economic situation drove him to buy cows some years ago, and now he has a farm of four cows. He applied for a $900 loan from Aqroinvest CU so that he can improve the place where he keeps his cattle.

loans.use: Going to improve cattle-keeping conditions

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid A. is from Saatli. He is married and has three children. He began his business in 1990 when he borrowed money from his friend to purchase a cow and a calf. He wants to increase production and has applied for an $800 loan to purchase one more cow.

loans.use: Going to purchase a cow

loans.name: Adelet

texts.en: Adelet A. is 47 and married and has three children. He collected money and in 2000 he started his small business. Now he is the owner of five cows, and to improve the living conditions of the cattle, he is planning to build a shed. For this purpose, he applied for a $1200 loan.

loans.use: Going to build a place for keeping cattle

loans.name: Afes

texts.en: Afes A. is an internally displaced person (IDP) and he lives in Saatli. He is 31 and single. With his first loan from Aqroinvest CU in 1999, he purchased a sheep herd. Now he is going to enlarge his small business and purchase one milk cow. For this purpose he applied for a $1200 loan.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil A. is 42, and his family consists of his wife and two children. He has an animal husbandry business. This small business is the main income source for his family and all his family members participate in it. He applied  to Agroinvest for a $900 loan to purchase a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase a calf

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona A. started her small business in 1995, when she purchased one cow. She is 52, married, and has four children. She applied for a $1000 loan to enlarge her business by purchasing one milk cow. She will begin to sell the milk to the local people.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en: A. Shahmurad is a successful businessman and owner of two milk cows. He is 52, married, and has four children. The place where he keeps his cows is dirty and needs to be repaired. He applied for a $1000 loan so he can create better conditions for the cattle.

loans.use: Going to create better conditions for keeping cattle

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib B. is 32, married, and has one child. He began the business in 2003 when he borrowed some money from his friends and purchased two cows. He applied for a $900 loan from Aqroinvest CU to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Seran

texts.en: B. Seran lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He started his small business in 1999, when he purchased one milk cow. Now he is going to enlarge his farm and buy one milk cow. He applied for $900 to Aqroinvest CU to realize his idea.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif H. is only 22, but he is already the successful owner of a barber shop in Sabirabad.  Since he began his small business in 2004, the number of his clients has increased considerably. Now he is planning to enlarge his barber shop  and repair it. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of $1,000 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To repair and enlarge his barber shop

loans.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: Seyfulla H. is a local farmer from Varkhan village in the Saatli region. He is 60 years old and has three children. Seyfulla runs a very small business raising calves for meat. He would like to expand his business by purchasing a milk cow. So he has applied for a loan of $900 USD to realize this goal.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani I. has been selling food in his small shop in Imishli since1998. The scale of his business is low in comparison with increased family expenses. Khagani is 36, is married, and has two children. With summer coming, he needs refrigerators for storage of food products. He has applied for a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase two refrigerators.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerators for his food store

loans.name: Yengibar

texts.en: Yengibar I. is 41, is married, and has three children. Since 1999 he has been running his own business, a small farm consisting of cows and calves. Now he is going to broaden his business and purchase a sheep herd. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of $1,200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase a sheep herd

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam J. is an internally displaced person (IDP). He is 33, is married, and has one child. Islam runs a small shop in Saatli.  Because of increased family expenses, he needs additional working capital. So he has applied for a loan of $1,200 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To enlarge his store

loans.name: Nazkhanim

texts.en: Nazkhanim M. opened her small shop using a loan she borrowed from Aqroinvest CU in 1996. Her family has four members, and to cover family needs she is going to broaden her store and open a food section. She has applied for a loan of $1,200 USD to broaden and repair her store.

loans.use: To broaden her store by opening a food section

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh Y. is a newly started young businessman from Imishli. He is single and he is the only breadwinner in his family. He has a small food products shop. He rents the shop facility, and his own funds were sufficient to purchase commodities. But for the summer, he needs a cooling system in place. He would like to purchase a refrigerator with the loan of $900 USD he is requesting from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal M. is 52, and he has four members in his family. He owns a small farm in Saatli. He needs extra funds for the development of his animal husbandry business. He has applied for a loan of $900 USD to broaden his business.

loans.use: To develop animal husbandry business

loans.name: Amiraslan

texts.en: Amiraslan N. is 27 and owns a small sheep herd in Saatli. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He has a very small farm, and it is not effective to run such a small farm. So Amiraslan is going to extend his farm by purchasing a cow. His farm has sufficient land to provide food for the animal. He has applied for a loan of $1,000 USD from Aqroinvest CU, to buy one cow.

loans.use: To purchase one cow

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en: Ramzi M., 26, is a young and very successful businessman in Imishli. He owns a sheep herd that he raises for meat. He is a very enterprising person, and now he is going to open a small farm consisting of cows. To start it, he needs to first purchase one cow, and for this he has applied for a loan of $900 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase one cow

loans.name: Mokhbali

texts.en: Mokhbali Q.  is 47, is married, and has three children. He runs a small business in Imishli, raising calves for meat. He first applied for a loan from Aqroinvest CU to purchase a calf in 1998. Now he has applied for a loan of $1,000 USD to buy two additional calves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad Q. is 35 and lives in Imishli with his family. He is married and has three children. He owns a small sheep herd, and he has applied for a loan of $1,200 USD to start a farm and purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow and a calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her secondhand clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her secondhand clothing business

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak B. is 30 years old, married, has 2 children, and reached the secondary education level. After her school graduation, she learned sewing skills and worked in a tailor’s workshop. Eight years have passed since she worked in the tailor’s workshop.

She started her small business selling women's and men's clothing in a market. She has a point-of-sale in a big local market. It has been 8 years since she started her business, and she has a lot of experience. She wants to get a loan to increase the range of goods and to decrease the markup for goods she sells. Muborak is going to buy school uniforms because the school fair season is coming and such goods will have a big demand in the market. Later on Muborak will change the range of goods again for winter clothes. Parents can purchase the clothes for their children in the district market instead of attending the capital city markets during the year and will save their time and money.

loans.use: To increase the range of products and trade turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kurbonboi

texts.en: Kurbonboi R. is 29 years old, married, has two children and is expecting his third child. He has had his own small business for 6 years. He sells sunglasses during the summer, and bags, souvenirs and artificial flowers. All goods are brought from Bishkek.  His wife helps him with his business, but is not now as she is pregnant. He had US$150 when he started his business. He has US$1500 in turnover at the moment and is now asking for a loan in order to go to China to buy new quality goods. He plans to sell bags during the winter period and he wants to have his own shop in the future.

loans.use: Increase amount and quality of inventory

loans.name: Kibriyo

texts.en: Kibriyo I. is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children and 3 grandchildren. Her husband works as a mechanic. Her dream was to become a dressmaker, so after she finished school, she entered the technical college, and was educated to be a dressmaker.  She has been working as a dressmaker for 15 years and has 5 employees.  She sews various dresses for men and women. She would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new kinds of material

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz A. is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is a lawyer by his education. He has had his own business for 3 years, and nobody helps him. He would like to earn more money and get married. He had US$200 when he began his business of selling toys. Now, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$1000 in order to go to China to buy more inventory of toys. At the moment he buys the toys from Istaravshan.

loans.use: To purchase new kinds of toys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic bakery ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay off her vendors and to purchase more basic bakery ingredients to make pastries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair and improve her shop, and to purchase the main ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the purchasing of more inventory to replenish his grocery store

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.es:
Cresencio is married and has 3 children. He used to work in a butcher, but he did not earn enough to support his family. As he had already learnt the trade he decided to open an independent business. His butcher started with very few products as he did not have enough money to buy a lot, but, little by little, it grew and he started to rent a small shop which is now his own and in which he has a lot of clients. Cresencio is a very hard working man and he really wants his family to do well and to improve their quality of life.

Cresencio would like a loan of $550 to buy raw material for his business and to paint the front of his shop so that he can present a better image of his business to his clients, and therefore earn more. He will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. He and his family thank you for your support so that he can carry on with his business and therefore achieve his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Cresencio esta casado y tiene tres hijos, el antes trabajaba en una carnicería y sus ingresos no eran suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, por ello al aprender bien el oficio, decidió abrirse e independizarse y poner su propio negocio, y fue así como empezó con su carnicería con muy pocas cosas ya que no tenía el capital suficiente para ello, pero poco a poco fue creciendo, ya que cuando empezó rentaba un local que ahora ya es propio y con muchos clientes. Cresencio es hombre trabajador y con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Cresencio esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 550 para comprar materia prima para su negocio y pintar la fachada del mismo para dar una mejor imagen a su clientela y mejorar sus ingresos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio y así poder lograr sus metas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José Guadalupe is married and his wife is a housewife. He used to work making concrete blocks, but the salary was not very high and when his first son was born he did not earn enough to support his family. As he knew how to make concrete blocks he used his savings to buy a machine to make them and some benches to keep them on. His oldest son helps out by working in the business while studying. José Guadalupe currently has a lot of clients and wants his business to continue growing.

José would like a loan of $475 to buy raw materials to make the blocks and therefore give his clients what they want and so that he does not run out of materials. He will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. He thanks you for your support so that his business can grow and he can improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

José Guadalupe esta casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, él trabajaba como obrero en una blockera y su sueldo no era muy alto, por lo que decidió abrir su propio negocio cuando nació su primer hijo varón, ya que no le alcanzaba lo que ganaba para mantener a su familia, como el sabía como hacer los blocks, con su liquidación compró una máquina para hacerlos y unas tablas para apoyar los blocks. Su hijo mayor lo ayuda con los ingresos familiares trabajando como empleado y a la vez estudia. Guadalupe actualmente ya se hizo de muchos clientes y desea continuar con su negocio y creciendo.

José está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder comprar materia prima para la fabricación de los blocks y así poder entregar los pedidos que ya tiene y que no lo puede hacer por falta de materiales. Ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y agradece el apoyo que le brindes para continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy materials/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina is a single mother with 5 children. As she is a very hard working woman and in order to support herself and her family, 14 years ago she decided to start her own business as a stylist. She started off with only the basic things that she needed but, little by little, has been able to buy more products that she uses in her work. She now has a lot of clients and is very happy as her business is always growing and she likes to please her clients.

Josefina would like a loan of $925 to improve the image of her business as she wants her clients to know that she offers a high quality service. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. She is counting on your support so that her business can grow and she can therefore support her children alone.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Josefina es una madre soltera y tiene cinco hijos y para poder mantenerlos y por que ella también deseaba tener su negocio independiente y sacarlo adelante por que es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, fue así como hace aproximadamente 14 años que ella empezó con su negocio de estilista con sólo las cosas básicas y poco a poco fue comprando más productos y herramientas que ella utiliza al hacer su trabajo. Actualmente ya cuenta con muchos clientes y esto la llena de satisfacción por lo que ella también desea continuar creciendo y satisfaciéndolos.

Josefina esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para mejorar la imagen de su negocio por que desea que los clientes por ser una estética se vea bien para que vayan y estén a gusto en el local, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella espera que la apoyes para mejorar con su local y continuar creciendo para sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos que mantiene sola.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reyna is a single mother with three children and the eldest helps her with her business. She used to work in a government office but her salary was not enough to cover her family’s expenses, and she therefore started to make yogurt and fruit cakes which she sold to her coworkers in her office. Little by little more orders came in, so she decided to work in this full time. She made a part of her home into a small restaurant in which her daughter serves the clients. As the demands from her clients increased she started to offer a home delivery service using 5 motorbikes.

Reyna is requesting a loan of US $ 925 to purchase merchandise and also to repair one of the motorbikes. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Her and her family thank you for your support so that her business can continue to grow and their quality of life can improve.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

María Guadalupe esta casada y su esposo trabajaba como obrero, por ello su sueldo no le alcanzaba para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar, por ello, se decidió a hacer algo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, y empezó vendiendo pan, leche frituras por que no tenía más capital pero con el paso del tiempo sus excedentes los reinvertía en el negocio, luego con el tiempo pudo comprar el terreno en donde ya tenía una tiendita más surtida y ahora su esposo la ayuda con el negocio, ya que ha crecido y cada vez tiene más clientes y desean continuar con su crecimiento para mejorar su calidad de vida y la su familia.

María Guadalupe esta solicitando un préstamo por US $925 para comprar mercadería y tener mayor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por apoyo que le brindes para continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es:
Reyna is a single mother with three children and the eldest helps her with her business. She used to work in a government office but her salary was not enough to cover her family’s expenses, and she therefore started to make yogurt and fruit cakes which she sold to her coworkers in her office. Little by little more orders came in, so she decided to work in this full time. She made a part of her home into a small restaurant in which her daughter serves the clients. As the demands from her clients increased she started to offer a home delivery service using 5 motorbikes.

Reyna is requesting a loan of US $ 925 to purchase merchandise and also to repair one of the motorbikes. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Her and her family thank you for your support so that her business can continue to grow and their quality of life can improve.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, su hija mayor la ayuda en el negocio, ella estaba trabajando antes de poner su negocio en el gobierno y el sueldo que percibía era insuficiente para mantener a su familia por ello comenzó a elaborar Yogurt y pasteles de fruta naturales, y los vendía en su oficina a sus compañeras de trabajo y poco a poco tenía más pedidos por lo que prefirió dedicarse a esa actividad, con el tiempo ha acondicionado un lugar en su domicilio y lo utiliza como un pequeño restauran en donde su hija la apoya atendiéndolo, y como su demanda se ha incrementado ella comenzó a repartir a domicilio y ya cuenta con 5 motos repartidoras.

Reyna está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para la compra de materia prima y para poder darle mantenimiento a una de sus motos de reparto que esta fallando, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy products/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and her husband is a worker in a company. She used to be a worker too, but she had to leave her because she wanted to take care of her kids. She decided to quit her job as when one of her kids was sick her Mom had to take him to hospital, but the company where Yolanda worked would not let her go to see to her child. However, she had to find work, as without her income she and her husband could not cover the family’s expenses. After that, with her savings, she decided to start a small grocery store in her house and it has gone well.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of US $ 925 that she will repay over a period of six months. She will use it to purchase merchandise for her business so that it continues to grow, as she will be able to offer more of the products that her clients ask her for.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa, elL. inicialmente trabajaba también como obrera, pero por el cuidado D. sus hijos tuvo que dejar L. empresa donD. laboraba y sin el ingreso que aportaba a L. economía familiar era necesario que trabajara en algo que le permita estar cuidando a sus hijos, elL. decidió renunciar una vez que uno D. sus hijos se enfermo y tuvieron que llevarlo al hospital y en L. empresa en L. que trabajaba no le dieron permiso para poder ir a ver a su hijo y por esa razón elL. y su esposo acordaron que renuncie. Luego D. eso elL. con su liquidación se decidió a poner una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su hogar y con el tiempo le ha ido bien.

Yolanda esta solicitando un préstamo por L. cantidad D. US $ 925 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, el cual utilizará para L. compra D. materia mercadería para su negocio y continuar creciendo ofreciendo un mayor surtido D. productos que son demandados por sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Óscar

texts.es:
Oscar is married with three children of 5, 14 and 20 years of age. He used to works as a chef in a restaurant in the United States, but found being away from his family very difficult, and therefore decided to return to Mexico to be with his wife and children. Thanks to 20 years of experience as a chef and his good work he managed to find a job working as a chef in a hotel, but his income was not enough to support his family and for his children’s education. To earn some extra money he started his own business doing catering for special events.

Little by little people have got to know him and his client base has grown. He now needs a loan of $150 to buy the materials he needs to meet the needs of his clients. He will repay the loan over a period of 3 months. You can be an important part of the development of this business and in the wellbeing of Oscar and his family. They thank you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Óscar tiene es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 5, 14 y 20 años de edad. Él trabajaba como cocinero en un restaurante de Estados Unidos, pero el estar lejos de su familia era una carga muy difícil de soportar por lo que decidió regresar a México, al lado de su esposa e hijos. Gracias a los 20 años que tiene de experiencia en la cocina y su buen trabajo logró conseguir empleo en el restaurante de un hotel, pero su ingreso no era suficiente para el sostén y educación de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra emprendió su propio negocio con la elaboración de banquetes para eventos especiales.

Poco a poco, se ha dado a conocer y ha logrado incrementar sus clientes, ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para poder cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en el bienestar de Óscar y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy products/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Khakverdi

texts.en: Q. Khakverdi runs his small business, which consists of a herd of sheep.  He would like to build a good place with normal conditions to keep his animals.  He is requesting a loan of $1200 to build a shed for his herd.

loans.use: Build a shed for his sheep

loans.name: Verónica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Verónica is a single mother and has a 7 year old daughter and a 10 year old son. She does not receive financial help from anyone for her children’s education and needs and she has therefore had to work very hard. Although she works in a cafeteria in a school she also started to help a friend sell cosmetics to earn some more money. As she found a lot of clients she decided to sell by herself three years ago and fortunately her business has gone very well.

In order for her business to grow she needs a loan of $200 with which she will buy more merchandise to increase the variety of her products and to give the customers what they want. She will pay back the loan over a period of 3 months. She really needs your help to improve her children’s quality of life and you can be a part of that. Don’t think twice. They all thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica es madre soltera de una pequeña de 7 años y un niño de 10 años de edad. No cuenta con el apoyo de nadie para el sostén y educación de sus hijos, por lo que ha trabajado mucho, aunque tiene un empleo atendiendo un snack en una escuela, para obtener un ingreso extra Verónica empezó a ayudarle a una amiga con las ventas de cosméticos y calzado, al haber conseguido muchos clientes decidió vender por su cuenta desde hace tres años, afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien con su negocio.

Para poder hacer creer su negocio requiere de un crédito de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de sus productos y cubrir a demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar este préstamo en 3 meses. Ella necesita mucho de tu ayuda, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, tú puedes ser parte importante en sus logros, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
"My daughter and I have more than 3 years in the paper business. I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD to buy more merchandise and to buy a copier as well. I would like to put together back-to-school packages with school supplies to sell at reasonable prices. I want to make more money to support my family."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo mas de 3 años con el negocio de papelería en el trabajamos mi hija y yo. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para la compra mercancía y una copiadora, en este regreso a clases quiero hacer paquetes de artículos escolares para vender a un buen precio y así tener mas ingreso a la familia.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and a copier

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús Antonio is married and has three children of 10, 12 and 16 years of age. He used to be a worker in a factory but was let go due to staff cuts and since then has not been able to find a fixed job and had to drive a taxi to earn money. In 2000 he started to repair stereos and then decided to start his own business selling radios and alarms. He does this full time in order to earn more.

In order to improve the quality of his family’s lives Jesús wants his business to grow, and for that to happen he needs a loan of $375 which he will use to buy merchandise to meet his clients’ demands. He promises to repay the loan over a period of 4 months. You can help this family and they thank you very much for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús Antonio es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 10,12 y 16 años de edad. Él trabajaba como obrero en una fábrica pero fue liquidado por recorte de personal, a partir de entonces no ha encontrado un empleo fijo y ha tenido que rentar un taxi para obtener algo de ingresos, en el año 2000 inició reparando estéreos y después decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de audio y alarmas, en donde se ha dedicado de tiempo completo para obtener mayores ingresos.

Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Jesús desea hacer crecer su negocio para lo que necesita de un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar este dinero en 4 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Q. Suleyman is a young businessman of 18 years old.  He has a small farm consisting of  3 cows.  He wants to enlarge his business, and breed cattle for selling milk.  He has applied for a loan of $900 to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.use: Going to purchse a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Inés

texts.es:
For twelve years Martha has been making and selling tortillas. She is married with four children. Her husband helps her with her business and he delivers her products to village shops. They come from Creel in the state of Chihuahua. The family union has been a fundamental part of the development of this business and it has therefore grown.

At the moment, Martha needs a loan of $475 which she will use to buy the ingredients that she needs to make her products. Martha wants to increase the area which they serve and her and her husband are willing to work hard to be able to improve their family’s quality of life. You can help this family, and they thank you

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Martha se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijas. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, él se encarga de distribuir sus productos en las tiendas del pueblo, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Creel, en el estado de Chihuahua. La unión familiar ha sido pieza fundamental en el desarrollo de este negocio, así como de su crecimiento.

En estos momentos Martha necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que requiere para incrementar su producción, Martha desea poder ampliar su área de servicio, ella y su esposo están dispuestos a trabajar mucho para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila is a very hard-working woman. She is a widow and has three children. Since her husband died she has been in charge of looking after her children. In order to earn the money necessary to support them and for their education, Dalila started her own business selling food. She opened a small restaurant and, with the help of her daughters, it has done well.

Now Dalila hopes that her business will grow, but for this to happen she needs a loan of $475 which she will use to buy the ingredients that she needs to make her food. She will therefore increase her production and meet her clients’ needs. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. With your help they will be able to see their business grow and improve their quality of life. They sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalila es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Desde que murió su esposo ella se quedó sola a cargo de sus hijas, para obtener los recursos necesarios para el sostén y educación de su familia Dalila emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, abrió su pequeño restaurante que con ayuda de sus hijas ha logrado sacar adelante.

Ahora Dalila espera hacer crecer su negocio y para esto necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus comidas, con esto incrementará su producción y podrá cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda podrán ampliar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, ellas te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Senora Maria Del Refugio U. has a sewing business. "I have more than 16 years sewing. I have my business at home, in a small room, but I would like a bigger room because my business is growing and I have more clients, and I want to provide them with a better service. I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 USD which I will use to expand my business and to provide a better service and to make more money since this is the main source of income for my family."

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Del Refugio U. tiene un negocio de costura. Tengo ya mas de 16 años dedicándome a las alta costura, el negocio lo tengo en mi casa en un cuarto pequeño me gustaría tener algo más amplio mas el negocio, porque ya tengo más clientes quiero darles un mejor servicio a mis clientas. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para ampliar el negocio y dar un mejor servicio para tener más ingreso ya que es el ingreso de mi familia.

loans.use: To build a bigger room for sewing

loans.name: Alma Idalia

texts.es:
Alma is a young mother who has had to work to raise her 11 year old son. She has never had help from her partner to support her child or to pay for his education. As she therefore needed to ean money but also have time to spend with her son, Alma decided to start her own business selling gifts and souvenirs which, fortunately, has gone very well.

Lately her client base has grown and she now needs a loan of $275 to buy merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her clients so that her business can continue to grow. She promises to repay this quanity over a period of 4 months. Your help will be very useful to the development of her business and to the wellbeing of her family. Alma and her son thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma es una joven madre que ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo de 11 años de edad, ella nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja para el sostén y educación de su hijo, ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso y disponer de tiempo para atender a su pequeño, Alma decidió abrir su propio negocio con la venta de regalos y novedades, en el que afortunadamente le ha ido muy bien.

Últimamente los clientes se han incrementado y necesita de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que destinará a la compra de más mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran utilidad en el desarrollo de este negocio y en el bienestar de esta familia, Alma y su hijo agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
Carlos is a responsible and hard-working young man. He is married and has a young daughter. He works in construction and installs flooring in peoples’ homes. He is known for his good work, and his years of experience have allowed him to constantly improve his services. There is a lot of demand for his services, so much so that he needs to buy a texturizing machine for which he needs a loan of $925 which he will repay over a period of 4 months.

You can contribute to the growth of his business and improve his family’s quality of life. Carlos sincerely thanks you for any help you can offer him as he only wants to give his family the best and with your help this will be possible, thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, él es casado y tiene una pequeña hija. Carlos labora en la construcción, se dedica a instalar tabla roca en las casas y se ha distinguido por su buen trabajo, los años que tiene de experiencia le han servido para mejorar la calidad de su servicio constantemente, ahora la demanda por sus servicios es cada vez mayor y para poder agilizar su trabajo necesita de una máquina para texturizar, para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en sólo 4 meses.

Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, Carlos agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle, él solo quiere darle lo mejor a su familia y con tu ayuda será posible, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his work/Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Shamama

texts.en: Q. Shamama started her business in 1998 when she bought a dairy cow.  She is now 43 years old, married and has 6 children.  The difficult economic situation in her family pushed her to sell the cow, and buy a calf.  Now she is planning to adjust her business and purchase a dairy cow.  To achieve her aim, Shamama has applied for a loan of $900.

loans.use: Going to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso opened his car parts store twenty years ago. He is married and has 4 children, all of whom help him in the business. The good service that Alfonso offers and the quality of his products are what have enabled him to stay in business for such a long time. Family unity has played a fundamental role in the development and success of this business.

To improve his service and be able to increase his sales, Alfonso needs a loan of $275.00, which he will use to remodel his shop. He is committed to returning the loan in 3 months. With your collaboration, Alfonso and his family will continue their work. They sincerely thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años Alfonso abrió su negocio de refaccionaria, él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, los cuales colaboran en el negocio. El buen servicio que ofrece Alfonso y la calidad de sus productos le ha permitido estar en el negocio por tanto tiempo. La unión familiar ha sido una pieza fundamental en el desarrollo y éxito de este negocio.

Para mejorar su servicio y poder incrementar sus ventas, Alfonso requiere de un préstamo que $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la remodelación de su local, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Con tu colaboración Alfonso y su familia podrán continuar con su trabajo, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To remodel his shop

loans.name: Humberto Luís

texts.es:
Humberto is married and has a small child. He and his father had a carpentry shop, and to become independent Humberto opened his own business selling crafts. He sold things that his father made. Unfortunately, Humberto’s father died five years ago and he has had to work very hard to get ahead with both businesses. However, the demand for his products is good and with hard work and the help of his family, he has made his business prosper.

Now, in order to increase the variety of products he offers in his store, Humberto needs a loan of $275.00, which he is committed to repaying in 3 months. You can help contribute to the growth of this business and improve the well-being of Humberto and his family. They thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Humberto es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo, él y su padre tenían una carpintería y para independizarse Humberto abrió su propio negocio con la venta de artesanías, donde comercializaba algunos productos que su padre elaboraba, lamentablemente el padre de Humberto murió hace cinco años y él ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante los dos negocios, pero la demanda por sus productos es buena y con base en su esfuerzo y la ayuda de su familia ha hecho prosperar su negocio.

Ahora para incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda, Humberto necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 3 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar el bienestar de Humberto y su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: R. Teymur is 21 years old, and he is the owner of a shop where he sells spare car parts.  His shop is in big demand of the car enthusiasts in his city.  He is single and recently started his business in 2006.  He has applied for a loan of $700 to move his business to a big, bright place and enlarge his working space.

loans.use: Going to rent a new shop to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is married and has three children. Her husband works as a teacher in a small school in the town of Creel, in the state of Chihuahua, which is where they are from. In order to have an extra income that would help them improve the quality of life for their family, Magdalena began selling used clothes 10 years ago. It is the good service that she offers her customers that has allowed her to stay in business for such a long time.

At the moment, Magdalena needs a loan of $925.00, which she will use to buy merchandise to increase the variety of products she offers to her clients and thereby increase her income. She promises to return the loan in 6 months. You can be an important part of her business. Decide to help Magdalena, she and her family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Magdalena es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo se desempeña como maestro en una pequeña escuela de la localidad de Creel en el estado de Chihuahua, de donde son originarios, para obtener un ingreso extra que les ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Magdalena inició con la venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años, el buen servicio que ofrece a sus clientes le ha permitido estar en el negocio durante tanto tiempo.

En estos momentos Magdalena necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en su negocio, decídete a ayudar a Magdalena, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús is 46 years old and is single. He lost his job 9 years ago due to an illness, and the lack of jobs in the country made it difficult for him to find new employment. He had a lot of debts and in order to pay them he began selling ceramic figures and floral arrangements, and he had good results. He began with very little merchandise because he didn’t have much to invest. However, thanks to his liking for sales and his character, it was easy for him to relate to other people. He managed to get ahead with his business and increase his sales.

In order to continue growing his business as he has been able to up to this point, Jesús is requesting a loan of $925.00. He will use it to buy merchandise so that he can offer more variety to his clients. He is committed to paying it back in 6 months. Be an important part in Jesús’ achievements. He sincerely thanks you for your support. .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús tiene 46 años de edad, él es soltero, hace 9 años a causa de una enfermedad perdió su trabajo y la falta de empleo que hay en el país le dificultó encontrar otro trabajo, tenia muchas deudas y para poder cubrirlas inició vendiendo figuras de cerámica y arreglos florales, pero obtuvo buenos resultados. Empezó con muy poca mercancía porque tenia poco que invertir pero gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora, Jesús solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Jesús, el agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cherkez

texts.en: S. Cherkez is 39 years old and is married with 2 children.  He started his business in 1999.  He is the owner of a small farm consisting of a sheep herd.  He is successfully implementing his farm business and is going to improve it and begin to keep cows as well.  He has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase a dairy cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase a dairy cow and a calf

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio is married and has six children. His wife takes care of the home. He began his business due to economic necessity, because the salary he earned didn’t cover the expenses of all his children. José Antonio began by doing repairs from his home and, little by little, his business grew until he could rent a shop. Apart from individual clients, he also provides maintenance services to some nearby hotels, especially for televisions and internal alarm systems.

José Antonio is requesting a loan of $325.00 to be able to buy electronic parts for internal antennas that he makes. He offers to pay the loan back in 6 months. He thanks you much for your support in helping him to get ahead with his business and to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

José Antonio esta casado y tiene seis hijos, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar. Él empezó con su negocio viendo la necesidad económica por la que pasaba ya que con los gastos de todos sus hijos no le alcanzaba su sueldo como empleado que percibía. José Antonio comenzó realizando reparaciones en su hogar y poco a poco fue creciendo hasta poder rentar un local especial para continuar con su negocio y aparte de tener clientes individuales, el también brinda servicio de mantenimiento a algunos hoteles de su localidad, especialmente a los televisores e instalaciones y los sistemas de alarmas internos.

José Antonio está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para poder comprar piezas electrónicas para la elaboración de antenas internas que fabrica, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante con su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: To buy electronic parts for internal antennas that he makes

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: S. Eldaniz  is 32 years old, and is married with 1 child.  He has been running a small business - a food market - since 2000.  He is a very successful and enterprising businessman.  That is why he has applied for a loan of $1200 from Aqroinvest CU to purchase a cooling system and increase his inventory of products to sell.

loans.use: Going to purchase cooling system and increase inventory

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: S. Tahir is 34 years old.  He is a local farmer and he lives in Imishli.  He is the owner of one cow, and he  wishes to increase his business scale by purchasing one more young calf and a cow for breeding.  He has applied to Agroinvest CU for a loan of $1200 to be used for purchasing 2 additional cattle.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Sefter

texts.en: S. Sefter is a local farmer from Sabirabad.  He has a big family: a wife and 3 children.  Animal husbandry is the only income source for the family besides pensions received by himself and his wife.  Sefter is 59 years old.  His business is very small, and he keeps a herd of sheep.  He has decided to improve his business by expanding into calf breeding for meat production.  To realize this idea, he has requested a loan of $1200 from Agroinvest to purchase 3 calves.

loans.use: Going to purchase 3 calves for meat production

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a charismatic, entrepreneurial, hardworking and very sociable person. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl, 8 and 7 years old respectively, and his wife is a housewife. Armando started in this business 10 years ago in Mexico City, and then he moved to another city to establish his own business and also obtain a fixed income to support his family expenses. He did it 5 years ago. He started in a little place in a house which was lent by his uncle and there was the place in which he began, and with the passing of the years his business grew and he also maintained his family and continued with this and also improving their quality of life.

Armando is requesting for a loan of US $ 475 to purchase merchandise for his business and also to makeover his business to have a better place for his clients. He offers to repay this loan in four months and he appreciates very much all your support to continue his business growth.

Translated from the original text in Spanish.

Armando es una persona carismática, emprendedora, trabajadora y muy sociable, el esta casado y tiene dos hijos un niño y una niña de 8 y 7 años de edad respectivamente, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, Armando empezó en el negocio de la carnicería hace 10 años atrás en la ciudad de México y luego se mudo de ciudad para poner su negocio propio y poder tener un ingreso que le permita mantener a su familia, fue hace 5 años atrás. Empezó acondicionando un espacio en una casa que le fue prestada por su tío y ahí comenzó su negocio, con el tiempo ha ido creciendo y le ha permitido su negocio poder mantener a su familia y espera continuar con el mismo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Armando está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar materia prima para su negocio así como también para remodelar su local y tener un mejor aspecto para sus clientes. Él ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 4 meses y les agradece mucho la ayuda que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer para poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Flora Verónica

texts.en:
Flora is a single and entrepreneurial woman. She studied beauty culture, and for this reason she wanted to start her own business and apply everything she learned. Also she lost her parents and she had to support her young brother, and she knew that if she was working as an employee in a beauty salon she could not obtain enough money to cover their expenses, because she was working before in a beauty salon to save money and also gain experience. In 2002 she started her own business at home and until today her business is going very well, but presently she is saving her income to purchase or rent a better location in order to improve her service to her clients.

Flora is requesting for a loan of US $ 375 to purchase merchandise that she will use in her business and also let her offer a better service to her clients. She offers to repay this loan in 4 months. She appreciates very much your support in establishing her business in a location that will offer better service to her customers.

Translated from the original text in Spanish.

Flora es una mujer soltera y emprendedora, ella estudió cultura de belleza, por lo que quiso poner su propio negocio y aplicar lo que había estudiado, además ella quedo sin padres y tuvo que ver por su hermano y mantenerlo, y si trabajaba como una empleada de una estética no le iba a rendir para poder mantenerse a ambos, ella lo sabía por que ya había trabajado como empleada para ahorrar y para obtener experiencia. Fue en el año 2002 que empezó con su negocio propio en su casa y hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien, pero actualmente esta ahorrando para poder tener un local establecido por que es mejor que atender a sus clientes en su casa.

Flora esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para poder comprar mercadería que usará en su estética que le permitan dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder tener su negocio de manera establecida en un local que pueda dar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es:
Felipe is separated and has a 25-year-old son. His son helps him with the business, just as Felipe got started by inheriting it from his father; this is a family business, which is why Felipe knows it so well. He has 30 years experience with this business, which started out in his home and later moved to the trailer which he uses to this day to sell barbecue in tacos and by the kilo. With this work he has been able to support his family and help his son get ahead by giving him an education.

Felipe is asking for a loan in the amount of $750 to buy merchandise to keep his business stocked and stable, and in this way take care of his customers. He will repay the loan in 6 months. He and his son thank you for the support you give them as they continue with their business and improve their quality of life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Felipe esta separado y tiene un hijo D. 25 años D. edad, su hijo le ayuda en el negocio y él empezó con el negocio heredándolo D. su padre, ya que es un negocio que viene D. familia, por ello es que Felipe conoce muy bien el mismo. Tiene 30 años con su negocio y empezó en su domicilio y posteriormente compro un remolque en el que actualmente se dedica a la venta D. barbacoa en tacos y por kilos, con este trabajo ha podido mantener a su familia y sacar adelante a su hijo dándole educación

Felipe está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad D. US $ 750 para comprar mercancía y mantener surtido su negocio y estable, además así atender a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su hijo te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Alicia De Jes

texts.es:
Alicia is a single mother and her daughter is 3 years old. Because she had to support herself and her daughter, she decided to start a business where she could work and look after her little one at the same time. Since she liked sales, she decided to go into clothing sales, starting out by offering her products to relatives and friends, and little by little her customers increased through word of mouth. Today, with the increase in clients, she has several orders to fill and she is happy with the profits and better sales she is having.

Alicia is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to buy merchandise in order to fill the orders she has at present. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She thanks you very much for the support you offer as she continues making her business grow, and giving her little daughter the opportunity to get ahead.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Alicia es madre soltera y su hija tiene 3 años de edad, el tener que mantenerse a ella y su hija la llevo a decidirse por tener un negocio ya que tenía que cuidar de su pequeña y como a ella le gustaba las ventas decidió incursionar en la venta de ropa, empezando a ofrecer sus productos entre familiares y amigos y poco a poco fue incrementándose sus clientes por recomendación, ahora con el crecimiento de sus clientes tiene varios pedidos que atender y se siente contenta por los logros y mejores ventas que está teniendo.

Alicia esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería y poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene actualmente y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindes para poder continuar con su negocio, hacerlo crecer y poder brindarle la oportunidad de sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda Janeth

texts.es:
Yolanda is a young married woman, and she has a baby one year old. Her husband works as a welder. She started her business because they needed additional income to improve their quality of life, since her husband's salary was not sufficient. Before having her little daughter, two years ago, she started selling shoes from a catalog. At first, her principal customers were relatives and friends, but with their recommendations her number of clients has increased. Later, after the birth of her daughter, she already had a stable client base, which she wants to maintain and continue to increase.

Yolanda is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to fill the orders she already has, and also to have enough stock to offer more products to her customers. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She thanks you for the support you offer.
