(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Yolanda es una mujer joven casada y tiene una bebé D. 1 año D. edad, su esposo trabaja como soldador, elL. inició su negocio por que necesitaba D. ingreso adicional para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida, ya que con el sueldo D. su esposo no era suficiente y antes D. tener a su pequeña hija, hace dos años atrás elL. empezó con L. venta D. calzado por catálogo, luego al nacer su hija, elL. ya tenía una cartera D. clientes estable, ya que sus principales clientes al inicio fueron sus familiares y amigos, ahora con el paso del tiempo L. fueron recomendando y sus clientes se fueron incrementando y ya tiene una cartera estable a L. que quiere mantener y hacerL. crecer.

Yolanda está solicitando un préstamo por L. cantidad D. US $ 250 para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene ya a L. fecha y también tener surtido para continuar ofreciendo más productos a sus clientes, ofrece pagar este préstamo en 3 meses y te agradece el apoyo que le brindes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.es:
Karina is married and has two chilren, a girl age 4 and a boy age 2. Her husband works as a laborer. She started her business because they needed another income to help with the expenses of the household, since her husband's salary did not cover them. Because her children were little, she needed to evaluate various options to not leave her children alone, and a friend recommended catalog sales. She decided to do that, so she could be at home and not neglect her children. She started selling shoes by catalog among her relatives and neighbors, and now she has a portfolio of regular clients.

Karina is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to fill the orders she already has from her customers, in order to maintain them, to meet their demand, and to have stock. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She thanks you for your support in fulfilling her orders, and even more for helping her get ahead and be able to offer a better quality of life to her family and little children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Karina esta casada y tiene dos hijos, una mujer D. 4 años D. edad y un hombre D. 2 años D. edad, su esposo trabaja como obrero. ElL. empezó su negocio por L. necesidad D. obtener otro ingreso para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, ya que con su sueldo no les alcanzaba, pero como sus hijos estaban pequeños, elL. tuvo que evaluar varias opciones para no dejar solos a sus niños, una amiga le recomendó L. venta por catálogo y elL. decidió dedicarse a ello y así estaba en su hogar y no descuidaba a sus hijos. Empezó vendiendo zapatos por catálogo con sus familiares y vecinas y ahora ya tiene una cartera D. clientes frecuentes.

Karina está solicitando un préstamo por L. cantidad D. US $ 250 para poder surtir los pedidos que ya tiene D. sus clientes y así mantenerlos y poder cubrir su demanda y tener stock, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, y te agradece tu apoyo para que pueda cumplir con sus pedidos y sobre todo por ayudarL. a salir adelante y poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus pequeños hijos y familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Laura Susana

texts.es:
Laura started her business eight years ago. She is married and her husband works as a taxi driver, her daughter is 12 years old and is in secondary school. Laura started her business to collaborate with her husband in covering the family's expenses, since his salary was not sufficient to support the family and, with their daughter growing up, the needed to offer her education. With the passage of time, she identified her market and decided to sell children's shoes. Before this she sold clothing, but with this business things have gone better and she has more and more customers.

Laura is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to buy merchandise, since in this season her sales increase because it is the time for children's graduations. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family thank you very much for the support you offer them in continuing with this business and getting ahead.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Laura inició su negocio hace ocho años atrás, ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como taxista, su hija tiene 12 años de edad y esta cursando la secundaria, Laura empezó su negocio para colaborar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ya que el sueldo de él no era suficiente para mantener a su familia y con su hija creciendo tenía que brindarle educación. Con el paso del tiempo, ella fue identificando su mercado y decidió vender zapatos para niños, antes de esto ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pero con este negocio le comenzó a ir mejor y a tener cada vez más clientes.

Laura está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería ya que en esta temporada sus ventas se incrementan por que es época de graduaciones de los niños, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindes para continuar con su negocio y poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Martha Delia

texts.es:
Martha is married and has two children who are currently in primary school. Her husband works a fork lift truck and she started her business to help him cover their family expenses. She started offering her products to family members, friends and neighbours and concentrated on selling women’s clothing from a catalogue. It went very well and she was able to pay for her children’s education. She hopes her business will grow and her income will increase as as her children grow the family’s expenses do too.

Martha would like a loan of $250 to buy merchandise for her business and so that she can buy the things people have already asked her for. She will repay the loan over a period of 3 months. She thanks you very much for your support so that her business can grow and she can improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijas las cuales están en primaria actualmente, su esposo trabaja como montacarguista y ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su esposo en la economía familiar, ofreció inicialmente sus productos entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, centrándose con el tiempo en solo venta de calzado para dama por catálogo, le ha ido bien y así a podido brindarles estudios a sus pequeñas hijas, espera poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos por que mientras van creciendo sus niñas sus gastos también se incrementan.

Martha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así poder surtir a varios pedidos que tiene actualmente pendientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha works selling clothing from catalogues. She is married and her husband is an electrician. They have one son who is 16 years old and is studying in high school. Martha started her business 10 years ago and before this she sold jewellery. However, when she started to sell from the catalogue she made more money which she needs to pay for her son’s education and to help her husband with the household costs as his salary is not sufficient to cover them. She has various clients and one of her friends has offered to help her by offering her products to the people who work in her office.

Martha would like a loan of $250 which she will repay over a period of 3 months. She will use it to buy merchandise and to order what her clients in her friend’s office have asked her for so that she will always have stock and her business will continue to grow. She thanks you for your support and hopes that her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo. Esta casada y su esposo trabaja como eléctrico y tienen un hijo de 16 años de edad que está estudiando en la preparatoria. Martha empezó con su negocio hace 10 años atrás, antes de este negocio ella se dedicaba a vender joyería, pero cuando empezó con este nuevo negocio de venta por catálogo le fue mejor y lo hizo ya que tenia que aportar con ingresos para poder educar a su hijo y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos ya que el sueldo de él era insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Ella tiene varios clientes y con la ayuda de su amiga ha podido ofrecer sus productos a todas las personas de la empresa donde trabaja su amiga.

Martha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $250 que pagará en 3 meses, el préstamo lo utilizará para comprar mercadería y cubrir los pedidos que ha logrado en la empresa de su amiga y cubrir su demanda, así como para tener stock y continuar creciendo, agradece mucho tu apoyo y espera continuar creciendo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Estefana

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband works as a printer. Before she started her own business she used to sell clothes, but she decided to change trade as she knew more about jewellery than clothes and she is able to sell them better and has more clients. She started her business to help her husband to cover the household costs and to give her children a better quality of life, even though they do not live with her anymore. She is used to working and wants to be able to leave money for her children and their families.

Maria would like a loan of $250 which she will pay back over a period of 3 months. She will used the loan to buy graduation rings which someone has asked her for and as they are very popular at the moment. She thanks you for your help that she hopes will enable her to keep on working and acheive her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y su esposo trabaja como impresor, ella trabajaba antes de su negocio actual en la venta de ropa, pero decidió cambiar de giro ya que tenía mayor conocimiento en joyas que en ropa, por ello comenzó a tener mejores ventas y a tener una mayor cantidad de clientes. Inició su negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y pudo dar educación a su hijo el cual ya no depende de ella, pero ella desea mantener y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo, ya que viven solos y nadie ve por ellos, además está acostumbrada a trabajar y quiere dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio para ayudarlos con sus familias.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 que ofrece pagar en 3 meses, utilizará el préstamo para comprar anillos de graduación que le han solicitado, ya que en esta época son muy solicitados por sus clientes, ella te agradece mucho la colaboración que le das y espera seguir trabajando y lograr sus metas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. S., 26 years old and a mother of one child, lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by operating a tailoring business and makes in average about $3/day in revenue, while her husband is a staff at a local organization. In order to maximize her family's savings, S. has an idea to grow mangoes in a plantation, which she thinks it will brings huge amount of income in a period of four to five months. To do this, S. is currently requesting for a loan amount of $800 to purchase a plot of land to grow mango and a small part of money is to purchase more clothes and threads for her inventory. In the future, S. dreams of being able to have enough money to build a new house for her family and offers her children a high level of education

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow fruits.

payments.comment: Keo Sokha has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Phork

texts.en:
Mr. Phork S. is 46 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. In order to support his family, S. works as a mechanic at his home and typically makes around 2.50 USD per day in profit while his wife rents out rooms in their house to garment workers. Her income serves to supplement S.’s for their family's upkeep. One of their children is a student and the other is still too young to attend school.

Due to recent increased demand from his clients and the needs of his household, Mr. S. would like to increase his inventory. He is asking for a loan of 500 USD to purchase vehicle repair tools and a variety of vehicle spare parts to run his shop. He would be grateful for your help; you can play a very important role in his business's growth.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle repair tools and some spare parts for his inventory

payments.comment: Congratulations! Phork Samnang has repaid his loan early!

texts.en: Mrs. N. lives in Nghe An, a rural province in northern central Vietnam. She is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman and works for a local cooperative. Her two daughters, 20 and 18, are both at university in Hanoi. For 3 years she has been a member of TYM. Before joining TYM she had a profit of $1.25 per day, but with the loans she was able to invest more in her shop and her profit nowadays is $6.25 per day. She wants to sell beer in her shop, but her storage room is open and too hot, so she will use the loan to erect a roof.

loans.use: She wants to sell beer, but her storage room is open and too hot, so she wants to erect a roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on the stock

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Mrs. Chit S. A. is 44 years old and is mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, and makes a living by selling water A. a market. She typically makes around $7/day in revenue, while her husband makes on average about $ 5/day from working as a mechanic. Therefore, two of their children are enrolled school but the rest gave up their studies when they were in grade 9 of secondary school. Fortunately, they are talented mechanics like their father.

Mrs. Chit S. A. is currently requesting a loan of $1000 to help her two children invest in an auto repair business by building a simple tin-roofed shop and purchase some vehicle tools and a variety of spare parts for their inventory. In the future, Mrs. Chit S. A. hopes to save enough to offer her children a better education.

loans.use: To build a simple shop and purchase tools to start an auto repair business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the amount of pigs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Sayaad Khanam

texts.en: Sayaad Khanam lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her family. She wants to help her husband support the family. She is an embroiderer who has good experience. She took her first cycle group loan and bought new machines and made a good income. Now she wants to take anther loan to rent a shop and make a good business to support her family with her husband. She is happy that she can expand her business with this loan.

loans.use: To rent a shop

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tan N., 46 years old and a widow, lives with her 3 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells clothes at a local market and generally makes around $6/day in revenue. Tan N. is a diligent mother who is struggling very hard to support her entire family, especially to provide for her children's education, since her husband passed away many years ago. Two of her children are students and one works at a small hotel.

In order to increase her business and to meet her clients' needs, Tan N. is currently asking for a loan of $700. She will use part of that sum to purchase more clothing for her inventory and the remainder to buy a motor-bike for one of her children to ride to work, so that he no longer has to pay for public transport. She would be grateful for your help, which will play a most important role in her business's growth.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her inventory

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Tan Nary has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his pineapple business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his vegetable selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her onion business

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K., 33 years old, is a married father of two from the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  He manages a small open-air shop in the Makeni town center.  He started the business 5 years ago and joined Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) two years later.   Abdul uses the small income he earns from his shop to provide his family with their basic needs.  He has invested past SMT loans in expanding his inventory and selection and will use these loan funds for the same purpose.

loans.use: Increase inventory and selection of men's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his pineapple-selling business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Thirty eight years old Aisha K. is a married mother of four children.  Aisha started her business with initialcapital of $60 borrowed from a relative.  With the capital, she started selling African print cotton materials but could not do much business as the capital was too small.  In 2005, Aisha joined SMT where she got loans to expand her business.  Later, she expanded her business to the selling of window and door curtains, table clothes and other female clothes.  She uses the income from the business to supplement her husband's salary.

loans.use: Increase inventory of fabric for window and door curtains and women's clothes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali K. is 27 years old and married with two children. Before migrating to the Makeni town of Sierra Leone, Ali was a susbistence farmer in a remote Sierra Leonean village. After two years of farming, he managed to save $100 which he invested in his current second-hand clothing business.

With previous loans from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Ali has been able to generate greater income to help pay for his family's expenses. He is requesting an additional loan to expand his business. Ali says that customers are attracted to well-stocked shops and that an increased inventory will allow him to earn a good income from the increased sales he will make.

loans.use: Increase inventory of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his garlic-selling business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs N. is 47 years and has 4 sons and one daughter ages 27-18. She lives in Nghi Loc in Nghe An Province, one of the poorest regions of Vietnam. Her family does the traditional farming: growing rice, and raising pigs and chickens. The oldest son is now a guest worker in Taiwan. She joined TYM in 2002 and used the loan to buy a rice mill. Now she needs $450 to buy a cow and rice for the mill.

loans.use: Buy rice and a cow

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuon S. is 30 years old and mother of 1 child. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To support her family, she has two sources of income. First, she sells cooked food and rice along the roadside in her area. Second, she rents some rooms of her house to local garment workers. The two sources bring in an average of $3.50 per day in revenue, while her husband can typically earn around $5 each day from working at a small private company as a security guard.

In order to maximize her family's savings, Mrs. Chuon would like to add more rooms to rent out to the workers, which would give her additional income. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase construction supplies such as cement, bricks, wood, zinc, and sand in order to build rooms to rent. In the future, she dreams of being able to expand her business and send her children to university.

loans.use: To add more rooms to rent out to garment workers in her area

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chuon Sopheap has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his lemon-selling business

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama T. is married with three children. She started a firewood business five years ago but found that it could not generate enough income to support her family because she had insufficient capital.

With her previous loan, she was able to expand her business into tie-and-dye pattern making on textiles and would like to use this loan to enhance her tie-and-dye production capacity. Adama works with her husband, whose teacher salary is not enough to meet their family’s expenses. She therefore supports her husband and family by helping to run their firewood and now tie-and-dye business.

loans.use: To raise tie-and-dye design production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her vegetable and fruit selling business

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
55 year old Abdulai is married with three children. He runs a small shop in the open air market in the Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With his previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Abdulai was able to increase his business.

He plans to use the funds from his new loan to purchase materials in bulk and sell them wholsale to retailers in more remote Sierra Leonean villages.

loans.use: To add to his inventory of second-hand clothes for wholesale operation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her assorted pepper business

loans.name: Alfa Umaru

texts.en:
Alfa B. is sixty-five years old and married with 10 children. In addition to being the father of a large family, Alfa runs a small general store in the remote Makup Bana village outside Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. However, that is not all ---on top of taking care of his family and running the general store, Alfa is also a subsistence farmer.

He is able to use the income from his general store to pay school expenses for his children and buy other basic items for the family, while the family's food mainly comes from their farm. Alfa is seeking loan funds to expand his small but vital store's inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to add variety to his small general store

loans.name: Maa Musu

texts.en: Maa Musu is 36 years of age with seven children.  With all the children in school, Musu and her husband are unable to generate enough income from subsistence farming.  Musu decided to engage in the business of selling firewood to the city wholesalers who come to the village to purchase the items.  In addition, Maa Musu also sells saucepans by hawking them from door-to-door.  The businesses have enabled Maa Musu to meet her children’s education expenses.  Musu would like the loan funds to expand her business of selling sauce pans.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of saucepans for door-to-door hawking

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 40 and has 4 sons aged 5 to 14. Her main business is raising ducks. She buys eggs and breeds the ducks at her house. With the help of TYM she has been able to increase her flock to 1,000 ducks. Now she wants to buy an incubator to breed more and under stable conditions. She also needs to buy vaccines, since her home province Nghe An was hit by the bird flu.

loans.use: buy an incubator for raising ducks

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en: Adamsay M. is a clothes trader in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Aged thirty two years with three children, she supports her husband to meet the family’s basic needs.  Her husband is a self-employed carpenter whose income is insufficient to meet all the family’s expenses.  Adamsay has been able to use past loans from CCF-SMT to expand her business and would like to use the new loan funds for the same purpose.  She said she is determined to get her family out of their poverty situation.

loans.use: Increase inventory and selection of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her orange and lemon fruit business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. K. is 44 years old and has 5 children from 13 to 22 years of age. She lives in Nghe An Province, one of the poorest areas of Central Vietnam, which is often hit by droughts or flooding.  Mrs. K. has small rice paddies, a rice mill, and pigs and chickens. The last harvest was 30% lower than usual because of bugs. Mrs. K. plans to use the loan to buy rice for the mill and to make rice wine.

loans.use: buy rice for milling

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. N. is 46 and has 3 boys and 3 girls, aged 10 to 23. She lives in Nghe An, a poor province of Central Vietnam. Her family grows rice and raises chickens and cows. They also have a small fish pond. Mrs. N. wants to use TYM's loan to buy additional fodder and a calf.

loans.use: buy fodder and a calf

loans.name: Mballu

texts.en: Mballu C. is thirty-three years old.  She is married with five children.  In her small store in Makeni town of Sierra Leone, she sells both wholesale and retail.  As with many women in Sierra Leone, Mballu’s husband's earnings as a teacher are too small to support the family’s upkeep.  Her income from the business supplements her husband’s income.  She intends to use the loan to purchase forty gallons of palm oil to increase her stock for better profit.

loans.use: Forty gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Dau Thi

texts.en: Mrs. V. is 35, and she has 3 children aged 9 to 14. Her husband is a fisherman and, together with 8 other men, is usually out to sea for 8-10 days. Since income from fishing is unstable, V. opened a small store in her house to sell foodstuffs and cosmetics. She will use the loan to buy more goods. Last year she was elected a TYM Center Leader.

loans.use: buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday B. is married with six children.  He runs a small business in his house in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  A hard-working man, Foday expanded his business with his first loan from SMT. Foday is requesting a new loan to diversify the business to include rice and other local agriculture products.  This will earn more income for the family to meet household expenses such education expenses, medicines, etc.

loans.use: Expand inventory of shop to include rice and local agriculture products

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 34 and has 3 daughters aged 5 to 13. Her husband is a fisherman and they live in the poor central province of Nghe An.  Each time her husband's and the other fishermen's boats return after 8-10 days at sea, Mrs. T. and several others rush to the shore to buy the fish and carry it to cold storage. There, a large company buys the fish and brings it to Hanoi or Saigon for processing and exporting. With US$500 Mrs. T. can buy about 100 kilos of fish and make a profit of $40-50.

loans.use: buy fish for trading

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Motorbikes are the main means of transport in Vietnam. Mrs. N., 48, and her family make a living by selling spare parts and repairing bikes. Mrs. N.'s husband and her 2 sons (23 and 18) are doing the repairs and ordering the spare parts, while she is selling and keeping track of the money.

Mrs. N., who also has a 15-year-old daughter, is the Leader of the TYM Center in her small town, where 45 women meet each month to share their experiences and discuss their business and loans.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Taime

texts.en: Taime M. owns a small kiosk in her house in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  A thirty-one year-old mother of four children, she sells general food items.  Her husband is employed but his income cannot provide for all the family's basic needs.  Taime therefore also supports the family economically from her small business.  With her small business income, she is able to provide her children with school lunches and has repaired the roof of the family home.  She needs the new loan to expand her inventory for better profit.

loans.use: Increase food items inventory for her small kiosk

loans.name: Manzar

texts.en: A. Manzar is 51 years old and has a secondary school education. He is married and has six children. Manzar has 20 years experience with animal breeding. Animal breeding and selling milk are the main source of income for his family. Manzar would like to use the loan amount for the purchase of young cows. It will help him to increase the number of livestock and, as a result, the volume of the milk produced by the household. Manzar's neighbors and inhabitants of the neighboring villages who do not have appropriate conditions for keeping animals or do not have enough experience will purchase fresh milk for their children every day. He is planning to repay the loan by the end of the term.

loans.use: Purchase 3 cows

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.en: Mrs. L., 41, lives in a small town in central Nghe An Province, one of the poorest regions of Vietnam. She is working for the local Women's Union. But her salary plus her husband's (he is working for the local government)  are not enough to pay for the education of her son, 19, a university student in Hanoi, and her daughter, 13. So Mrs. L. has opened a small shop to sell shoes, shirts, and cosmetics. Hats sell especially well, since all Vietnamese girls consider white skin the ideal of beauty and are afraid of getting a sun tan.

loans.use: buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu runs a small kiosk at her residence in Makeni Town.  As a petty trader, she sells soft drinks and some small food items.  Before her first loan she had a very limited variety of drinks and thus had few customers.  After the previous loan, the thirty one year old Ramatu expanded her business and has acquired more customers as a result.  She uses the profit to assist her husband in paying the family expenses. while she saves to repay her loan.  Ramatu feels a strong sense responsibility and is determined to further develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her small drink kiosk

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. lives in Magburaka town in the Northern Region of Sierra Leone.  At forty-five years old, he is married with four children.  K. runs a small shop where he sells general items.  The business is the sole source of income for the family expenses.  This will be his third loan with SMT and with the new funds he will expand his inventory.

loans.use: Increase the general merchandise inventory of his small shop

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu Kaba is married with four children. She is forty-two years old and runs a small business selling peppers and peanuts wholesale. Her husband is also a petty trader in Mogburaka town in Sierra Leone.

Fatu has successfully repaid her first loan from SMT, using it to expand her inventory. She is requesting a second loan with the plan of renovating her market stall and increasing her inventory.

loans.use: Renovate her stall in the market and purchase addtional inventory of peppers and peanuts

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en: Abdul Karim is fifty years old and married with four children.  Since getting a salaried job is difficult in the post civil war country Sierra Leone, Abdul decided to run his own small business to generate income for the family.  He owns a small general shop in the town of Mogburaka in Sierra Leone. With his first loan with SMT, he was able to expand his business. He is dedicated to expanding his business further and provide for his children needs.

loans.use: Increase inventory in small general store

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie L. is married with four children.  She sells hot peppers, peanuts, and beans wholesale and retail.  Although her husband is self-employed as a mobile trader, his income is insufficient to meet all the family’s expenses. As with most families in Sierra Leone, both parents need to work to make ends meet to provide for basic needs.  At thirty-six years old, Marie is willing to work hard to provide for her family’s future.  She is requesting the loan to expand her inventory to increase profit.

loans.use: Increase inventory of agriculture products for wholesale and retail

loans.name: Maseray

texts.en:
Maseray K. sells fish in Magburaka town in Northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-two years of age with three children. Maseray’s husband helps with fish selling by hawking in the nearby villages. They both work together to increase the family income.

With her previous loan, Masarey was able to buy five baskets of fish at wholesale prices as compared to the usual one basket before the loan. This has enabled her husband to participate in the business as well. Looking at expanding her business, Maseray is requesting another loan for purchasing an addtional four more baskets of fish per inventory cycle.

loans.use: Increase inventory quantities of fish per selling cycle

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Mbalu K., is a married mother of two children and lives in Magburaka town in Northern Sierra Leone. Both Mbalu and her husband work at running a business of producing and selling smoked fish. Her husband deals mostly with the purchase of raw materials and smoking of the fish while Mbalu does the selling in the market.

With the income from their business, the couple is able to meet family expenses, but this forty-one year old mother is determined to provide her children with a good education. With the additional input of capital from this loan, Mbalu is confident that she will be able to make more profit and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for smoked fish production

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto C. G., age 42, is a mechanic. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker, she takes care of her children and husband. Alberto has worked since the age of 15 as an automotive mechanic; he worked in various mechanic workshops, and quickly acquired a great deal of experience, finally becoming an official mechanic in a well-known workshop in the city.

His goal was always to open his own workshop, and after several years of saving he was able to get it. For the past two years, Alberto has worked in his own workshop, located in his home, along with his oldest son. He has his own tools and a truck, which is the most important element of his work because it helps him get around to contact customers and buy repair parts.

Alberto is requesting this loan in order to make improvements in the infrastructure of his workshop. He wants to make it larger and easier to work in, since the demand for his services has grown quite a bit thanks to his good performance.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Alberto C. G. de 42 años de edad es mecánico, está casado y tiene 2 hijos. Su esposa es ama de casa, cuida de sus hijos y su marido. Alberto trabaja desde la edad de 15 años como mecánico automotriz; trabajó en varios talleres mecánicos y de a poco fue adquiriendo mayor experiencia hasta llegar a ser mecánico oficial en un renombrado taller de la ciudad.

Su meta siempre fue la de abrir su propio taller, y tras varios años de ahorro pudo conseguirlo. Desde hace dos años Alberto trabaja en su propio taller situado en su casa junto con su hijo mayor, posee herramienta propias y una camioneta que es su elemento de trabajo mas importante ya que le ayuda a movilizarse para contactar con clientes y comprar repuestos.

Alberto solicita el crédito para poder realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su taller, desea ampliarlo y así poder agilizar sus trabajos, ya que la demanda de sus servicios han aumentado razonablemente gracias a su buen desempeño.

loans.use: To expand the infrastructure of the workshop

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en: Eight years ago, Yaroslav G. opened a small business for the sale and repair of household engineering, electric, and plumbing systems.  Over that time, he has received and successfully repaid six loans from Nadezhda Ukraine. Combined with his hard work and experience, these loans have helped Yaroslav expand his business into a successful company with twenty-eight employees. Despite some financial hardships, Yaroslav remains focused and committed to improving the standard of living for his wife and three small children. He plans to continue expanding his business and hopes to operate throughout all of Western Ukraine. Currently, Yaroslav is seeking a loan for $600. This loan will help him to purchase a car and thus more efficiently travel between the various locations of his work.

loans.use: Purchase car for work

loans.name: Erica

texts.en: Erica B. operates a fruit and vegetable kiosk in the Gid Market of Mukachevo, Ukraine. Erica opened her business nine years ago and chose to specialize in fresh produce, knowing that they are in constant demand. Her business helps to support her family of three. Erica is hard working and kind - she has built a loyal customer base by offering a wide selection of fresh produce and quality service. Erica has a perfect repayment history and has used previous loans to effectively and consistently grow her business. Currently, Erica is seeking a loan for $1200 to increase her inventory. With the profits, she plans to expand her business and purchase a car to transport produce more effectively.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Fedr

texts.en: Fedr K. operates a bicycle parts kiosk in the Gid Market of Mukachevo, Ukraine. He opened his business eight years ago to support his family of five, including three children whom he now supports at the university. Fedr is hard working and kind – he responds easily to people’s needs and enjoys helping clients understand the best methods of repairing bikes. His services are constantly in demand; as such, he would like to learn more about effectively selling his products in order to expand his business. Fedr is currently seeking a loan of $1000 to purchase additional inventory and a wider assortment of parts. With the increased profits, Fedr plans to increase his business base and continue providing quality service and advice to his clients.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Vasily

texts.en: Vasily T. operates a taxi service based in Ivano-Frankovsk, Ukraine. After serving for a time in the military, Vasily opened his taxi business eight years ago. His business is the main source of income for his family of three, which includes his wife and eight year old daughter. Hard-working, humble, and reliable, Vasily’s dedication has helped him to establish a high reputation among clients and co-workers. He works seven days a week and transports clients throughout the country. He has differentiated himself and increased the demand for his services by having a radio in his taxi. Over the past eight years, Vasily has received several loans from Nadiya Ukraine to help establish and develop his business. He has repaid all loans with a perfect credit history. Currently, Vasily is seeking a loan for $850 to complete essential repairs on his taxi engine. This loan will help him to continue offering safe and reliable services to his clients.

loans.use: Repair engine on taxi

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: A university graduate, Vladimir K. has operated a taxi service from Ivano-Frankovsk, Ukraine for the past six years. He and his wife, Oksana, have three children together. Vladimir’s taxi service business provides the main source of income for his family. Vladimir is hard working and reliable – he utilizes radio communication in his taxi to ensure high quality, efficient transportation services for his clients. His dedication and responsible work ethic have helped him to obtain a good reputation among his co-workers. Previously, Vladimir has received two loans from Nadiya Ukraine to develop and operate his business. Vladimir repaid both loans in full and on schedule. He has requested a new loan for $600 to complete repairs on his taxi. With the loan, he will be able to continue offering quality services to his clients. In the future, Vladimir plans to purchase a newer car to improve his taxi services and expand his business.

loans.use: Taxi repairs

loans.name: Korneliya

texts.en: Korneliya R. specializes in gifts, souvenirs, and decorative household items. A true entrepreneur, Korneliya saw an opportunity to develop a business that caters to tourists and visitors to Mukachevo, Ukraine, where she operates her business. Her unique kiosk faces little direct competition and has grown over the six years she has been in business. Korneliya is friendly and lively and has developed an excellent reputation among clients and tourists. She is attentive to the needs of her customers and professional in working with her creditors. Due to previous loans through Nadiya Ukraine, Korneliya has been able to increase her inventory and successfully expand her business. As such, she has helped her husband Ivan to provide a better standard of living for their family of four. Currently, Korneliya is seeking a loan for $1,100. This loan will help her to increase the variety of her inventory. With the additional profits, Korneliya hopes to increase her working capital and purchase a car.

loans.use: Increase variety of inventory

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica is 43-years-old single mother of five. Like many women in her region, she had to work at a spinning mill in the city for the 23 years. With a lot of sacrifice she was able to provide for her family without the help of her children's father. A staff reduction left her without work, but she was indemnified, and with the money she opened up a store in her home to serve as the family's source of income. Along with this, she took up making baby's clothing. Through these activies she had a decent life and could feed her kids and provide them with a good education. Her store has good earnings, since this year her clientele has increased, and at times it has been difficult to have a supply that meets the demand. To correct this situation, Angelica is requesting a loan of $200, which she plans to use to purchase necessary supplies in larger quantities, like flour, sugar, rice, noodles and oil, because those are in the highest demand at her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Angélica tiene 43 años. Es soltera y tiene 5 hijos. Como tantas mujeres luchadoras tuvo que trabajar en la hilandería de la ciudad desde los 23 años. Con mucho sacrificio mantuvo su hogar sin la ayuda del padre de sus hijos. La reducción de personal la dejó sin trabajo. Sin embargo, fue indemnizada y con el mismo dinero abrió una despensa en su casa que le sirve como sustento para la familia. Aparte se dedica también a confeccionar ropa para niños. Mediante estas actividades tiene una vida digna y puede brindarles a sus hijos alimentación y buena educación. Su almacén le está dando buenos ingresos, ya que este año han aumentado sus clientes, y hasta en ocaciones le resulta difícil cumplir con su demanda. Para contrarestar esta situacion, Angélica, desea solicitar un crédito de $ 200 con los que planea comprar mercaderías de primera necesidad y en mayor cantidad para su despensa, tales como harina, azúcar, arroz y fideos, pues estos son los de mayor demanda.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, rice, noodles, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hawa K.

texts.en: Hawa B. is twenty-eight years old, married with four children.  Her husband is a government employee whose earnings are not sufficient to pay for all the family’s needs.  Hawa started a small stall shop in the open market where she sells onions, hot peppers, salt and spices to supplement her husband’s income.  Hawa is happy with her business because she can earn income to pay for the education expenses of her children.  She is requesting the loan funds to enable her to purchase the business items in wholesale bulk to reduce frequent travels of purchasing the goods in small quantity thus increasing her profit.

loans.use: Purchase food items inventory in bulk from wholesalers

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu C. is thirty-two years old and married with four children.  Her husband migrated to a mining area in Kono, in Eastern Sierra Leone with the hope of getting employed in the mining business, leaving the sole responsibility of the family care to Yeabu.   She runs a small stall business of selling food items like salt, beans, coconut and tomato paste.  With the absence of her husband Yeabu is able to earn enough income to feed her four children.   She is requesting the loan funds to expand her business for better profit. She is determined to keep providing for her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory and diversity of food items for sale in the market

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie Bangura is a single parent with five children. She is forty-five years old and runs a palm oil business.  She purchases the oil from the villages and sells it in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone. Marie is requesting the loan funds to expand her business.  She would like to purchase fifty gallons of palm oil to meet the high demand during the rainy season.  As the price is expected to increase, Marie hopes to make a good profit and improve her children’s livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase fifty gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata J. is a mother of four children.  She is engaged in palm oil selling.  Palm oil is the local oil made from the palm cannel and it is widely used in Sierra Leone for cooking and soap making.  Aminata’s family income comes from her business and she is solely responsible for family’s expenses since her husband is jobless. Aminata is requesting this second loan with SMT for expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of palm oil

loans.name: Ruth Rudicela

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ruth Rudicela and I am a businesswoman. I have a small business where I sell clothing, located in the plaza of my city. I have several years experience, and thanks to this business I am able to help cover household expenses and also have time to care for my son. I currently need to stock my store a little bit more, because my sales are improving and I would like to offer a wider variety of products to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola Mi nombre es Ruth Rudicela, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño de nogocio de venta de ropa, ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio pued contribuir con los gastos familiares, gracias a este negocio puedo atender a mi hijo, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas el negocio ya que las ventas mejoran entre mas variedad de producto puede uno ofrecer al cliente.

loans.use: To purchase pants, jeans, men's shirts,  children's clothing, underwear and other items.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is a very hard-working woman. She is married and her husband is a traffic policeman. She used to work selling jewellery but decided to change trade to something that she enjoyed more, so she started selling hot dogs which she has now been doing for ten years. She started doing this to help her husband to pay the household costs and to provide for their children and this is something they have acheived. She wants her business to keep growing and she will keep working hard at it as she has a lot of motivation and she enjoys what she does.

Eugenia would like a loan of $250 which she will pay back over a period of 3 months. She would use it to buy the raw materials she needs to make her products and cover her clients demands. Her and her husband thank you very much for your support which will enable the business to grow and improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Eugenia es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora, esta casada y su esposo trabaja como policía de transito, ella antes de su negocio se dedicaba a la venta de joyería, pero decidió cambiar de rubro a algo que ella hace mejor y le gusta más, así fue como incursionó en la venta de hot dogs, llevando ya con su negocio más de 10 años, el cual inició para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y sacar a sus hijos adelante, lo cual ha logrado pero ella quiere continuar creciendo como microempresaria y seguir trabajando por que es una actividad que le da mucha motivación y gusto hacerla.

Eugenia está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 que ofrece pagar en 3 meses y con esto poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos y poder cubrir la demanda que tiene, ella y su esposo te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les das para poder continuar creciendo como microempresaria y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia is married and her husband is a worker She has three daughters, they are five, four and three years old. They are the source of her inspiration and drive as she wants to give them a better life so that they can study and do well for themselves. She started her business four years ago to help her husband out financially. She started off with few products, but her business has grown as she has many frequent clients.

Oralia would like a loan of $250 to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider variety of products and so that her business can grow as clients are always asking her for new things. She will repay the loan over a period of 3 months. Oralia and her family thank you very much for your support which means that her business can grow and she can fulfill her goal of providing for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Oralia esta casada y su esposo trabaja como obrero, tiene 3 hijas una 5 años de edad , otra de 4 años y la última de 3 años de edad, quienes son la fuente de inspiración para salir adelante y brindarles a ella una mejor calidad de vida así como estudios para que sean alguien en la vida y sean mejor que ella misma. Inició su negocio para ayudar a su esposo en la economía familiar y desde hace 4 años atrás ella tiene su negocio, inició con muy poco surtido de productos, pero poco a poco ha ido creciendo con el mismo y ya tiene varios clientes frecuentes.

Oralia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería y así tener mayor surtido y poder mantener su negocio estable e ir creciendo, ya que sus clientes cada vez le van solicitando de cosas nuevas y ella quiere poder tener todo lo que ellos le solicitan, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Oralia y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y poder lograr las metas que tiene y sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Jimmy Franz

texts.es:
Jimmy has two grown daughters, one is 19 years of age and the other 11. He is unmarried but lives with his partner. With the help of his business, he has been able to provide for his family but he needs to continue to grow to offer his daughters a better education and support the household. He started his business with skills he learned from his father. Jimmy learned quickly and was good at the job, so he decided to continue with it. He is a very hard worker and a family man without vices. He sought out the microfinance program in hopes of finding the means to support his business.

Jimmy is seeking a loan in the amount of $475 to purchase equipment for his work, including a larger grill and a bell to speed up production, thereby continuing his growth and improving his sales. He is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family appreciate your support in helping them get ahead and continue to better themselves to offer their daughters a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Jimmy tiene dos hijas mujeres, una de 19 años de edad y la otra de 11 años de años de edad, no esta casado vive con su pareja en unión libre y con su negocio a podido sacar adelante a su familia, pero el necesita continuar creciendo para ofrecerles una mejor educación a sus hijas y mantener a su familia. Él empezó con su negocio como herencia de su padre, el le enseño el oficio y Jimmy aprendió bien así que continuó con el mismo, él es muy trabajador y es un hombre de familia sin vicios y muy trabajador quien se acerco al programa microcréditos en espera de un buen apoyo para su negocio.

Jimmy esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder comprar equipo de trabajo que consta de un asador más grande y una campana para así poder agilizar su producción y continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le des para poder salir adelante y mejorar cada vez más para ofrecerles a sus hijas y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase production equipment

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina is a married woman with 6 children, 3 sons and 3 daughters between 2 and 17 years old. Her husband is a travelling salesman selling fruit and vegetables. His [bank] deposits do not cover the daily cost of living, so she began to work in order to help out with the expenses. She began her business 12 years ago as a travelling saleswoman selling out of her home and among acquaintances. With time this changed, and now she sells in popular markets and has a good amount of reliable clients who purchase her products.

María Cristina is asking for a loan of $250 over the course of 3 months. With this loan she will purchase larger quantities of groceries and thus have a greater profit margin and be able to expand her business. She and her husband are very thankful for your support to enable them to continue to support their 6 sons.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

María Cristina es una mujer casada y tiene 6 hijos, tres varones y tres mujeres entre 17 y 2 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como vendedor ambulante de fruta y verduras, por ello sus ingresos no cubrían los gastos familiares, por lo que ella tuvo que empezar a trabajar para poder ayudar con estos gastos a su esposo. Ella empezó con su negocio hace doce años vendiendo como ambulante por su casa y entre conocidos, con el tiempo ella ahora vende en tianguis o mercados populares y ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes que gustan de sus productos.

María Cristina está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 que ofrece pagar en 3 meses, con el préstamo ella va a comprar mercadería al por mayor y así tener un mejor margen de ganancias y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella y su esposo te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindes para continuar saliendo adelante y poder mantener a sus 6 hijos.

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia is married and has four daughters, one of whom lives with her. Her husband works as a chauffeur at a construction company. Each of her daughters help her with her business. She began her business by selling used clothing that she no longer wore, after which she purchased clothing in bulk and began selling it in her home. With time her business grew and today she sells clothing in her home and in three markets. She began this in order to support her husband with general expenses as well as because she is a hard working woman and she has a knack for sales.

Amalia is asking for a loan of $275 in order to purchase products and therefore be able to offer better products to her clients. Understanding that their their tastes change over time, she would like to have the best in order to have better sales. She would like to pay back this loan in 3 months and is very thankful for the support your support so that she can continue to expand her beusiness and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Amalia esta casada y tiene cuatro hijas de los cuales una de ellas vive aún con ella, su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa constructora, todas sus hijas la ayudan en el negocio, ella empezó vendiendo ropa usada que ya no la ocupaba y después compro ropa por pacas y empezó vendiendo en su domicilio, con el tiempo fue creciendo y ahora vende en su casa y en tres mercaditos, empezó para apoyar a su esposo en la economía familiar, también empezó con el negocio por que es una mujer muy trabajadora y tenía gustos por las ventas por ello es que poco a poco lo hizo crecer.

Amalia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería y así tener más surtido y poder ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes, sobre todo siempre que hay cambios de temporada ella desea tener lo mejor para tener mejores ventas, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindes para que continúe con el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Jairo Alejandro

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Jairo Alejandro and I am a mechanic who specializes in motorcycle repairs. I have a small shop in my home, called "T.," which generates enough income to cover household expenses and other bills. I currently need to buy more spare parts in order to better serve my customers. I am a father of a family with 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre es Jairo Alejandro, mi actividad principal es la reparación de Mótocicleta, cuento con un pequeño taller en mi casa de habitación, llamado taller de Motocicletas "T.", el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas gastos, actualmente necesito comprar mas repuestos para poder atender mejor al cliente. soy padre de familia y tengo 2 hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a pistons kit, handbreaks,   handlebars, tires, rims

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is married and her husband works in construction. They have two sons. She began her business in order to help support her husband with family expenses. Since she only has a primary school education she was unable to secure a job. She therefore dedicated herself to selling beauty products through catalogs and subsequently added shoes and clothing sales. She has had her business for 5 years and is hoping to continue to expand it in order to improve the quality of life for her sons since with only the salary of her husband they are unable to achieve this.

Graciela is asking for a loan of $200 in order to purchase more products to satisfy the demand of her clients as well as have products in stock to be able to show her clients firsthand what they are purchasing rather than have them simply rely on the catolog. She is hoping to repay this loan in 3 months. She is very thankful for the support you are bringing to her.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela esta casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, ellos tienen dos hijos, ella empezó su negocio debido a que necesitaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares y ella no solo tener estudios de primaria completos no pudo conseguir ningún empleo por ello se dedicó a la venta por catálogo de artículos de belleza y posteriormente fue incluyendo en sus ventas zapatos y ropa, ella tiene con su negocio 5 años y espera continuar creciendo y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que con solo el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanza.

Graciela está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para comprar mercadería y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes así como tener algo de stock para que sus clientes puedan apreciar los productos de manera directa y no solo por el catálogo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te acrece el apoyo que le brindas para poder lograr sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Nancy  Jeaneth

texts.es:
My name is Nancy Jeaneth, and I am a businesswoman. I have a store where I sell new clothing, located in the plaza of my city. I have several years experience in this store and the earnings I make are used to cover household expenses and other bills. Currently, I need to stock my store in oder to offer a wider variety of products to my clientel and through which increase my earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Nancy Jeaneth, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio, para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes y de esa forma mejorar los ingresos

loans.use:
To purchase underwear, women's blouses, skirts, children's clothing
 and jeans.

loans.name: Maria Ninfa

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband works as a machine operator. They have 3 small children ages 3, 1 1/2 and 6 months. Her husband's low salary does not allow them to provide for the family's needs. For this reason, Maria decided to start her own business selling gold jewelry two years ago. At first she received some sales help from her sister-in-law and then went out on her own. With three children, her expenses have increased considerably. She now has various customers who enjoy her products as well as the payment plans she offers to help them make purchases.

Maria is seeking a loan in the amount of $200 to acquire merchandise and therefore continue her growth and increase her sales, particularly to help cover the very high costs of supporting her youngest son. She is offering to repay the loan in 3 months. She very much appreciates your assistance with helping her support her family and grow her business, which will allow her to offer them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y su esposo trabaja como operario, tienen 3 hijos pequeños de 3 años de edad, 1.5 años de edad y 6 meses, con el sueldo bajo que percibe su esposo no pueden sustentar a las necesidades de su familia, por ello María decidió empezar con su negocio de venta de joyería de oro hace dos años atrás, inicialmente le ayudaba a su cuñada en las ventas y después ya se abrió de manera independiente, ya que con tres hijos el gasto se incremento considerablemente y ahora ya tiene varios clientes que gustan de los productos que ella ofrece y los planes de pago que les da para que puedan adquirir sus productos.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder comprar mercadería y así continuar con su crecimiento e incrementar su ventas especialmente para la manutención de su hijo más pequeño que son muy altos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder mantener a su familia, crecer y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina has two small children who are 6 and 3. Her husband works as an electrician and as a construction worker. His earnings vary greatly and at times there is not enough to cover all of the household expenses. So, Paulina decided to start her own business, now five years ago, where she sold clothing. With time, her products became more varied and she now sells jewlery and women's purses as well. She began by selling items to her neighbors and to her friends. Now she has quite a number of customers and her allowing customers to buy on credit helps her to keep them.

Paulina is applying for a loan of $200.00 which she will repay in 3 months, and will be used to purchase merchandise and to have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers. This way she can attract more customers and give her children better opportunities in life. She thanks you very much for your support in helping her achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Paulina tiene dos hijos pequeños de 6 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como electricista y construcción por su cuenta, y sus ingresos son muy variables y a veces no cuenta con lo necesario para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, por ello es que Paulina decidió comenzar con su negocio, y fue hace 5 años que ella empezó con su negocio, inicialmente vendía ropa y con el paso del tiempo fue ampliando la gama de los productos que ofrece joyería y bolsas para dama, primero con sus vecinas y familiares y ya ahora tiene una cartera considerable de clientes y las formas de pago en abono que ofrece ayuda mucho a mantener sus clientes.

Paulina está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 que ofrece pagar en 3 meses, este lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería y tener mayor cantidad de productos variados que ofrecer y así obtener mayor cantidad de clientes y poder sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, ella te agradece mucho por tu apoyo en el logro de sus metas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita is married and has three children who are all married. Her husband works as an electrician and a metalworker, and his income varies greatly. So, Benita needed to help him with their household income. She wanted to do something she already knew how to do; she saw that in her local market, no one sold hamburgers and in order to find them, one had to travel quite a long way away. And so, she began to sell hamburgers from her home, and with time saw her business grow. Now she has many customers and her own stock is not enough to keep up with demand.

In order to meet demand, Benita is applying for a loan of $200.00 so that she can purchase a hamburger stand that she has seen is being sold and with the stand prepare and sell her hamburgers in a more timely manner. She will repay the loan in 3 months and she thanks you very much for your help which she needs to see her business continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Benita esta casada y tiene tres hijo que están casados, su esposo trabaja como electricista y albañil por lo que sus ingresos son muy variables y ella tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlo en traer ingresos a su hogar, por ello ella viéndose en la necesidad de poner ago que ella sepa hacer, vio el mercado en el que se encontraba y nadie por su casa vendía hamburguesas y tenían que ir lejos para poder conseguir estas, así que ella empezó vendiendo en su casa, con el tiempo le fue bien y ahora ya tiene muchos clientes y ya no le basta con las que puede preparar en su hogar.

Por ello, Benita solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder comprar un carrito de hamburguesas usado que le están ofreciendo y así poder prepararlas ahí de la manera adecuada y más rápida, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindes para poder hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes lives with her partner and has six children, the elder four of whom help her in her grocery store. Her partner works as a metalworker, but his salary was not enough to cover all of the household expenses and so she decided to do something to help him. She decided to sell sweets and "chicharrones," from a stand in front of her home. Little by little, her sales grew and she needed to store her products on shelves she made for herself and then she bought metal shelves, which help to liven up her home, which has only a dirt floor. She has been selling grocery items for 8 years now.

Maria de Lourdes is applying for a loan for $750.00 so that she can buy more merchandise and to stock her store, helping to see it grow. She will repay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for your support which will help them to improve their lives and to give their children better opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

María de Lourdes vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen seis hijos, de los cuales los cuatro hijos mayores la ayudan en el negocio de abarrotes que tiene, su pareja trabaja como albañil y con su salario no podía cubrir los gastos para sus seis hijos, por ello ella decidió hacer algo para apoyar con la carga de los gastos a su pareja, y entonces ella decidió vender dulces y chicharrones en una pequeña mesa en la puerta de su casa y poco a poco fue incrementando sus productos en anaqueles fabricados por ella misma y luego compro unos de metal los cuales ambientó en su casa que tiene el piso de tierra, ya tiene ocho años con su negocio.

María de Lourdes está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 dólares para comprar más mercadería y así tener surtido su negocio y poder crecer con el mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para poder salir adelante y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca lives with her unmarried-partner and her five children. Her partner is a photographer, but his income was not enough to support their family. So, Francisca decided to start to work and one of her friends asked her to work with her selling beauty products. Before she began working as a saleswoman, she had helped her husband with his photography, but her own sales continue to grow, adding to the family's spending money. She is very happy with her achievements and with her earnings, which are going towards helping her children.

Francisca is applying for a loan of $275.00, which she will pay back in 6 months. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise and improve her family's standard of living. She already has many orders to fulfill and she doesn't want to disappoint her customers. She and her family thank you very much for your support, which they need to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Francisca vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos, su pareja trabaja como fotógrafo, y por ello sus ingresos no eran suficientes para mantener a su familia, por ello ella decidió empezar a trabajar, fue por invitación de una amiga por la que ella entro a la venta de productos de belleza para mujer, ya que antes de este negocio ella le ayudaba a su pareja con la toma de fotografías, pero actualmente le esta yendo mejor cada vez y teniendo más clientes y así apoya con un ingreso adicional en la economía familiar, ella esta muy contenta con sus logros y sus ingresos, ya que le están ayudando a sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Francisca solicita un préstamo por US $ 275 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, ella utilizará este préstamo para comprar mercadería y así sacar adelante a su familia, ya que tiene varios pedidos que surtir y no desea quedar mal con sus clientes, por ello ella y su familia te acrecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Hernan and I am a businessman. I have a store where I sell new clothing, located in the center of my city. I have several years experience in this store and the earnings I make are used to cover household expenses and other bills. Thanks to this business, I have been able to give an education to my children, who help me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre es Hernan, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gasto de mi familia y demas compromisos, gracias a este negocio he dado educación a mis hijos, los que me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: To purchase men's shirts, underwear, jeans,  mosquito nets, towels and an assortment of other shirts.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria is 38-year-old married mother of an 11-year-old daughter. Her husband is a public employee and contributes to household expenses. Her daughter is taking elementary classes and is also studying at a dance institute. Maria sees her daughter as a source of inspiration; she wishes she keeps studying and becomes a professional and able to have the opportunities that Maria couldn't.

Maria says that she has worked from a very early age. Her parents were very poor, and what they earned was not enough to proviD. for the family. She could not finish he studies, only making it to sixth graD.. Her mother was her principal teacher. She was dressmaker, and taught Maria the traD.. Today, Maria makes all types of garments, chiefly uniforms for schoolchildren and office workers, with distinct types of fabrics. She works out of her home where, along with her tailing shop, she runs a haberdashery, selling crafts, toys, party supplies and gift items. Maria wants to acquire cloth in large quantities, since she has received several orders from schools for uniforms in the spring, which she should already start working on. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase the necessary fabric, needles and buttons.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora María tiene 39 años es casada con una hija D. 11 años. Su cónyuge es empleado público y aporta con los ingresos D. la casa. Su hija esta cursando sus estudios básicos y también estudia danza en un instituto D. baile; su hija es su fuente D. inspiración, ella desea que siga estudiando para llegar a ser una profesional y tener las oportunidades que ella no tuvo. María nos cuenta que desD. muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar; sus padres eran muy pobres y con lo que ellos ganaban no alcanzaba para el sustento D. la familia. Ella no culminó sus estudios, solo llego hasta el 6to. Año D. la escuela primaria; su madre fue su principal maestra, ella era modista y le enseño el oficio D. la costura y la confección. Hoy día María cose todo tipo D. prendas, con distintos tipos D. telas, desD. buzos, uniformes para alumnos, docentes y para oficinistas. Ella trabaja en su casa donD. aparte D. su taller D. costura también tiene una mercería donD. se dedica a la venta D. aretesanías, juguetes, cotillón y artículos para regalo. María desea adquirir telas livianas en gran cantidad, pues ha recibido propuestas D. diferentes colegios que solicitan que se les confeccione los uniformes para la temporada D. primavera, para lo cual ya debe empezar a trabajar; por eso, ella solicita un crédito D. $ 200 con los que podrá adquirir las telas, hilos y botones que necesita para su labor.

loans.use: Purchase fabric at wholesale, needles and buttons

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe is a married man and has two children, he started his business to maintain his family and three years ago he began with arts and crafts sales and also antiques that are very common and also required in his town because is a tourist zone with a lot of tourists. His children are young and they do not have studies and for this reason he wants to have a better income to offer his kids basic education, so, he decided to expand his business making rustic furniture which are required by his clients. His business lets him grow little by little and he wants to continue this growth, this way he can offer a better quality of life to his family.

Guadalupe is requesting a loan of US $550 and offers to repay this loan in 6 months, with this loan he will purchase raw material to make his rustic furniture because he has orders to complete and this kind of product takes a time to make. He also wants to maintain his clients. He thanks you for all your support that you can give to him that will let him continue grow with his business.

SPANISH

Guadalupe es un hombre casado y tiene dos hijos, él inició su negocio para poder mantener a su familia y empezó hace tres años atrás con la venta de artesanías y antigüedades que son muy solicitadas en su región por que es una zona turística bastante visitada. Sus hijos son pequeños y no estudian y por ello el desea tener una mejor fuente de ingresos para poder brindarles educación e incursiono en la elaboración de muebles rústicos, los que también tuvieron mucha aceptación por parte de sus clientes. Su negocio le ha permitido crecer poco a poco y desea continuar con su crecimiento y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Guadalupe está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 que los ofrece pagar en seis meses, con el cual el podrá comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los muebles rústicos que ya tiene pedidos y como son hechos artesanalmente toman algo de tiempo y quiere cumplir con sus pedidos y mantener a sus clientes. Él agradece mucho el apoyo que le des para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena is a married, but her husband does not live with her right now because he immigrated to the United States. She has three children to take care of and three brothers as well because her father is an alcoholic. Together with her husband she provides for the family. Because of this she has to work, but there are no jobs in her town. So she decided to sell clothes because her husband told her that he could sent clothes from the U.S., clothes that are not common in her town. She found success and little by little gained more clients, and now she goes to Hidalgo to purchase merchandise for her business, which is growing because she is the only one who offers new clothes that are hard to find.

Lorena is requesting for a loan of $550 to purchase merchandise, specifically seasonal clothes, and keep her clients satisfied. She offers to repay this loan in six months, and she is very grateful for your support in helping her continue growing her business and improving her quality of life.

Translated from the original Spanish text

Lorena esta casada pero su esposo actualmente no vive con ella, el se fue de inmigrante a los Estados Unidos de Norte América y ella tiene tres hijos a quienes tiene que mantener, además de sus tres hermanos, ya que su padre es alcohólico y junto con su esposo ellos mantienen a su familia. Por este motivo ella tuvo que trabajar y por la falta de empleo en su localidad, decidió empezar con la venta de ropa, que fue el negocio que le planteó su esposo, ya que el andaba en EE.UU., le podía enviar ropa a buen precio y que no encontraban en su localidad, fue así desde hace dos años que empezó con su negocio y ahora ya ella viaja a Hidalgo a comprar mercadería para su negocio, el cual ha ido creciendo por que fue de las primeras personas en ofrecer cosas nuevas y que no se podían conseguir con facilidad.
