Lorena está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar mercadería, que es específicamente ropa de temporada y así mantenerse al día con sus productos y continuar satisfaciendo a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante con su negocio y continuar creciendo para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Yahaira Lizeth

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Yahaira Lizeth, I am a saleswoman and I have a small store where I sell shoes and sandals, in the center of my city. It is called YACKI, and I have been working there for 3 years. My earnings are used to cover household expenses and other bills from my suppliers. I have a good clientel because the location of my store was entirely strategic. I need to stock more items and to be able to offer a wider variety of products to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre es Yahaira Lizeth, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos y sandalias, en el centro de mi ciudad, llamado variedades YACKI, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, cuento con buena clientela ya que la ubicación de mi negocio estrategica, el que necesito surtir mas y poder ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: To purchase Bebe sandals, platinum, tennis shoes, girl's sandals, hairpins  and men's wallets.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria is a single mother and has two kids, ages 16 and 8 respectively. She has to work to take care of her children because without extra income from a partner all expenses are very high and now that her kids are going to school the expenses will be even higher. Initially, she started with a small investment of $180 to begin her business, selling shoes by catalogue. Little by little her sales increased because she is a very hard working woman and the well being of her family motivates her.

Maria is requesting for a loan of $925 to purchase merchandise and increase her stock, satisfy client orders on time, and, above all, always have floor models to show her clients. She is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. Maria and her family appreciate your support in helping her continue with her business and give her kids a better education.

Translated from the original Spanish text

María es una madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad respectivamente, ella tuvo que trabajar para mantener a sus dos hijos por que sin el apoyo económico de una pareja los gastos son muy fuertes y ahora ambos niños están estudiando por lo que los gastos se incrementan aún más. Inicialmente ella tuvo un capital muy pequeño de US $ 180 con el cual invirtió para comenzar su negocio de venta de calzado por catálogo, poco a poco sus ventas fueron mejorando por que María es una mujer muy trabajadora y por su familia es que ella se esfuerza mucho.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para poder comprar mercadería y así tener más surtido su negocio, pedidos a tiempo y sobre todo calzado siempre actual y mantener a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en seis meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo brindado para continuar con su negocio y poder brindarles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Corina and I am a saleswoman and I have a business in which I sell new clothing. I have several years experience in this activity and thanks to this business, I am able to cover household expenses and other obligations I have with my suppliers. Considering I am already reaching old age, and all of my children are married and live in their own homes, I am happy that I am still able to work and to do so for my own self-improvement.Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Hola mi nombre  Corina soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores,  considerando que soy   de la tercera edad y mis hijos todos se casaron y  tiene su propio hogar y eso  me sastisface saber que todabia puedo trabajar y salir adelante por mi misma.

loans.use: To purchase long and short lycra skirts, underwear,  men's shirts,children's pants and other assortments of shirts.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia runs a small outlet where she sells grain, legumes and drinks. She started her business four years ago with a $35 investment. At first, Nidia sold her products from her porch, but as her business grew she was able to convert one of her rooms to display her products. With the support of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, Nidia has been expanding her business. Currently, she acquires most of her supplies from the city market, which she goes to at 5 a.m. every morning to purchase her supplies in small quantities. Because she has to buy a bus ticket to get there, it costs her two hours of time she could have spent running her business at home. To increase her earnings, Nidia is requesting a loan of $200 so she can purchase rice, surgar, oil and drinks at wholsale. Buying in 50kg bags, large boxes and barrels, wholesalers offer her a better price, and, on top of that, deliver the supplies to her home. Nidia calculates that this investment will substantially increase her margins and her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Nidia B. tiene una pequeña despensa en la que vende grano, legumbres y refrescos. Inició su negocio hace 4 años con un capital de US$35. Al principio Doña Nidia vendía sus productos en el patio de su casa, pero a medida que el negocio fue creciendo pudo adaptar una de las estancias de su casa para exponer ahí sus productos. Con el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya, Doña Nidia ha ido expandiendo su negocio. En la actualidad ella adquiere la mayor parte de sus mercaderías del mercado municipal, al que acude todos los días a las 5 de la mañana para comprar sus mercaderias en pequeñas cantidades, por lo que tiene que gastar en el billete de autobús para llegar ahí, invirtiendo además dos horas de tiempo que podría utilizar para estar en la casa atendiendo su negocio. Para poder incrementar sus ganancias Doña Nidia requiere de un préstamo de US$200 que le permita comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite y bebidas al por mayor. Comprando en bolsas de 50 kilos, en cajas grandes y en barriles, los proveedores le ofrecen un mejor precio y además hacen la entregan de la mercancía a domicilio. Doña Nidia calcula que con está inversión en mercaderías podrá aumentar sustancialmente su margen de ganancias e incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil and drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok M. E., 37 years old, is a mother of 4 children, and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She stays at home, looking after her children and cooking meals for her entire family. Meanwhile, her husband (pictured here because ME. E. is unavailable) plays an important role to take care of the family's expenses by operating a motor-taxi business. He can moderately earn around $2.50 each day. One of her children is employed at a local industry, and three are students. Sok M. E. is currently requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motor-bike for her husband's business. In the future, her husband hopes to save sufficient money to expand his business by purchasing a passenger cart attached to his motor-bike, so that he can operate a Tuk Tuk, which will enable him to increase his family's savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sok Meng Eang has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok C., 41 years old, is a mother of 2 children who are students, and she lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement the household income, Sok runs a store selling a variety of soft drinks, and pork/beef rice and noodle soup to the people in her area. From this business activity, she can typically earn around $6.00 each day, while her husband also helps the family's finances by driving a motor-taxi. With the progress of her business and the idea of getting ahead, C. is currently requesting a loan of $500 to expand her business by purchasing more utensils and equipment to operate her store . In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to keep expanding her business and send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils and equipment to operate her store.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: A 42 year old mother of 3 children, Mrs. Kheng N., lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband run a grocery store in a village and make an average of $7.00/day in revenue. Two of her children work at a nearby beauty salon and one attends school. Kheng N. is currently asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery products to keep investing in her store, as well as satisfying her clients’ needs. In the future, she hopes to be able to save money to provide her children with a high level of education, as well as keep expanding the business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Kheng Noeun has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. H. is 57 years old. She lives in a Catholic village 10 miles from the next town in central Nghe An Province, one of the poorest regions of Vietnam. She has 7 children from 37-21. Her family has a plot of land on a hill where they grow lemon trees and eucalyptus. They also have a buffalo and pigs. Now she wants to buy 2 cows for breeding and some piglets.

loans.use: To buy pigs and 2 cows

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Nguyen Thi T., here with her husband Luyen in front of their grapefruit and mango trees, is 43 and bought her fruit garden 5 years ago with a loan from TYM Fund. Last year they were able to sell 1 ton of mango, lemon and grapefruit! But because bad harvests can always happen in this central Vietnamese province, they also have chickens, ducks and pigs. Now she wants to buy fertlizer for her garden and a buffalo for plowing. They have one daughter, rather exceptional in this area where many people have 8-10 children.

loans.use: To buy buffalo and fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. C. is 49 and has 5 children, 2 of them still in school. Close to her house in the middle of the fields, she is practicing the Vietnamese field-garden-pond model. She has divided her paddies into several small areas, which in an alternating way are used to grow rice, raise ducks and fish. Last year she was able to sell 2 tons of rice. She wants to use the loan to buy more ducks and eggs for breeding and to buy food for her fish.

loans.use: To buy ducks and fish food

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Mrs. Chab C. is a 51 year old widow who lives with her daughter in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a chef at a small restaurant in her area, where she can make an average of about $2.50 /day. Her daughter, meanwhile, operates a grocery store, which is assists in taking care of her entire family. Currently, Chab is requesting a loan of $600 to buy more grocery products for her daughter to keep investing in her store. In the future, she and her daughter hope to expand their business by adding a variety of products in order to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase  grocery products for her daughter to run a business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 53 yrs old and lives in Hung Nguyen, a deeply Catholic area of poor central Vietnam. She has 13 children aged from 11 to 36, 7 sons and 6 daughters. They had barely enough food some years ago. They raise pigs, poultry and cows. Now two sons have found jobs as builders in the city. Mrs. L. wants to use the loan to build a barn and to repair her house.

loans.use: To build a barn

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. M. is 24 years old with a daughter aged 4. She joined TYM in 2003. From her first loans, her husband bought a little old pick-up truck to offer transportation services in their neighborhood. Mrs. M. sells cosmetics at the local market. They also have a small rice field and fruit garden. Mrs. M. is a TYM center chief and organizes monthly meetings of all borrowers in her village.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 34 and has 3 children aged 4-14. The family has been making a living by raising pigs and chickens, and farming a small rice field and fruit garden. Two years ago, her husband Khoat found work as a builder in Vinh City, 20 km away . From his salary and her first loans, they bought a water buffalo which they use to plow both their own and the rice fields of their neighbours. Mrs. L. now wants to buy more pigs and also try to raise ducks.

loans.use: To buy ducks and pigs

loans.name: Nos

texts.en: Mrs. Nos K. is 52 years old and is a mother of 6 children, and lives in Seim Reap province, Cambodia. She works very hard on her farm growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables, that she sells to wholesalers at a market. This business activity provides barely enough to cover the expenses of her entire family. Fortunately, two of her children have a transportation business, which involves driving a trailer attached to a motor-bike to transport passengers in their area to and from the market. With this kind of business, they make an average of $10/day in revenue, which is a big help for their household. Nos K. is humbly requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motor-bike and a trailer for her children to operate a business and she will be extremely grateful for any kind of help.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to run a business as a trailer driver.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. H., 47, and her husband Mr. Dong, are something like local heroes in their village of Da Son in the central Vietnamese Province of Nghe An. The village has always been famous for the craft of making bamboo wattles. But until recently, sales were volatile and limited to the nearby town. Now Mr. Dong has found buyers in Hanoi, and things have really taken off. Mrs. H. and her husband have 8 people working for them to make partitions and fences. They also organise getting the bamboo from nearby plantations, and Mr. Dong goes to Hanoi once a month to make sure everything is sold at a fair price. The people working with Mrs. H. were mostly petty traders before and earned at best $20 per month. Now they get about $50-60. Considering the above, TYM wants to give Mrs. H. the maximum loan possible, 20 million Vietnamese Dong.

loans.use: To buy bamboo

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.en: Outside it is 38 degrees (100 F), and next to her oven it must be over 50 degrees (125 F). That is where Mrs. P. sits for 6-7 hours every day to make 600 rice crackers with sesame. With the loan from TYM she will be able to make 750 crackers every day. They sell them to cafes and at the nearby market. Her husband is trying to set up a bricks trading business and, although already 57, he still sometimes works as a builder. They have 8 children between 15 and 37, and 10 grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy rice and sesame

loans.name: Puy

texts.en:
Mrs. Puy C. is 44 years old, is a mother of 5 children and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works on her farm growing rice crops and a variety of vegetables, but she barely makes enough money to take care of  the family’s expenses. Meanwhile, her husband is talented in fishing and he can typically make up to $7/day, which is a big help to the family’s savings. Three of her children are construction workers and two attend school. 
Currently, Puy C. is humbly asking for a loan amount of $1000 to purchase a boat, fishing nets, and other fishery tools which will enable her husband to run his business more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a boat, fishing net and other fishery tools to run a business.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Puy Chum start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs T. is 34 years old, and she has a 4 year old daughter. She lives in the small town of Do Luong, about 50 km from the border with Laos. Her husband is a border guard who comes home every 2-3 weeks. Two years ago she opened her little butcher shop. Farmers bring her the meat, but now she would like to buy a cow for breeding, to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 28 years old and has just recently joined the TYM Fund. She has a 3-year-old daughter, and her husband is a driver and often on the road for an entire week. For the past 2 years, Mrs. T. has been operating a small grocery store on the ground floor of her house. Sales are low, because she has few goods to offer. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US$250 to buy refreshments and cookies and, possibly, set up a little cafe in the back of the store.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for sale

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en: Mrs. M. is 42 and has 3 children, aged 17 to 22. We were lucky to be at Mrs. M.'s small cafe at 8:00 in the morning to taste her speciality: snail liquor (you can see the snails in the bowl). The cafe hosts up to 80 guests every night, and the snail liquor only adds value to Mrs. M.'s main business, a soup kitchen, where the delicious Vietnamese noodle soup called "pho" is served. Mrs. M. is asking for a loan of US$250 to buy soft drinks and beer for her guests.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: It is wonderful to be a guest at Mrs. H.'s cafe. She prepares not only delicious soups and rice porridge for breakfast, but also welcomes every guest with her bright smile. At 46, Mrs. H. has almost brought up her 4 children, aged 17-26. Her husband is a retired soldier and is helping his wife, especially by making rice wine. Mrs. H. is asking for a loan of US$375 from TYM to buy more food ingredients and drinks, and, possibly, to do some repairs to her small cafe.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Every day Mrs. X., 28 years old, spends 6 to 7 hours by an oven heated to over 50 degrees Celsius (130 F) to make rice crackers with sesame. Every hour she makes about 100 crackers that are later dried in the sun. Sometimes Mrs. X.'s sister-in-law helps her, so they can make 1,000 crackers a day. Then, she also has some time for her 2 daughters, 4 and 6 years old. Her husband is working as a carpenter. He makes doors, tables and chairs, ordered by his neighbours. Mrs. X. is asking for a loan of US$375 to buy wood and more tools for her husband to help him at his work.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and tools

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en: Le Thi Luong, 23, seen in the photograph, is one of TYM Fund client Nguyen Thi Muoi's 5 children. Mrs. Muoi is 53 and runs a mobile phone card business which has become very successful since last year, when a second mobile service provider arrived at the small town of Do Luong and the price of phonecalls went down. Mrs. Muoi and her family also run an outdoor cafe offering tea, coffee, beer and snacks. On a hot day they have up to 100 guests. Mrs. Muoi is asking for a loan of US$250 to buy more drinks and SIM cards for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and phone cards for sale

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun R. is 25 years old and the mother of one child, who is a student. She lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. To supplement the family’s savings, she buys pillows from the pillow-makers or wholesaler and resells them to retailers at a market. She makes around $7/day in revenue. Her husband (pictured here because R. is at a market) is a construction worker and earns a moderate amount, about $3 per day. Due to a great demand of her clients recently, R. is currently requesting a loan of $1000. She will use the loan to increase her inventory by purchasing different kinds of pillows and a motorcycle for transportation, so that she no longer spends money on public transportation. In the future, R. hopes to build a new house for her family and provide her children a high level of education.

loans.use: To  purchase more pillows to invest in her booth and a motorcycle to transport pillows to and from market.

payments.comment: Lun Reaksmey has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en: It is characteristic to the Vietnamese people to smile even if they are hit hard by destiny. Mrs. N., now 55, was born in the Southern highlands, where as a child she got in contact with Agent Orange during the American war. She was lucky to survive, but she could never give birth to children. Over the years, she survived with the scarce support the Vietnamese government could offer. With a loan from another bank, Mrs. N. opened 2 market stalls for underwear and children's clothes in Do Luong, Nghe An Province, where she moved to live with her husband. She is now asking for a loan of US$200 from TYM Fund to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Cheri Maiya

texts.en:
Cheri Maiya M., 34 year old, lives in Thecho Nepal. . Thecho is one of the under developed villages of Nepal. Most of the People of this region are poor and work in the farm. 
She lives in single family with her husband and two sons. Mrs. M. and her husband, Dil Bhakta M. both make brass religious statues. They have 14 years of experience in making statues. Her older son is in grade 7 and younger son is in grade 5. 
She seeks $375 to purchase raw materials for making brass religious statues. In Nepal the cost of education is very high. So she is planning to spend her income for better education of her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for statue making

loans.name: Luu Thanh

texts.en: At 24, Ms. T. is the oldest of 6 children in her family. 3 years ago she decided not only to earn her own living, but also to help her aging parents who are farmers. She rented a market stall in the nearby Do Luong township and started to sell ladies' clothing.  3 to 4 times a month she makes the 8-hour bus ride to Hanoi to buy stock from wholesalers. Ms. T. took her first loan of US$200 from TYM in March and now is ready for the next one. With her bright and joyful character, she also agreed to become a Center Leader for TYM and assemble all the women for weekly meetings.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Laxmi Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi Devi M., 30 years old, is a shopkeeper who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. She lives in a single family with her husband and two children, a son and a daughter.
Her husband, Krishna M. is a cook and her son is in grade 7 and a daughter is in grade 6. She opens her tea shop 5 years ago. In Nepal tea is preferred by all and demand for tea is increasing day by day. She is selling tea in local area since early morning to evening. 
She seeks $375 to purchase necessary goods for her shop like tables and chairs. She plans to repay the loan on monthly basis. She wants to earn more and more to increase the status of her family among her relatives and friend circles.

loans.use: To Buy tables and chairs for her shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Y. is 31 and has 3 children, aged 1 to 8. They live on the outskirts of Do Luong, a small town in the central province Nghe An. Together with her husband, Mrs. Y. farms a small rice field, but the rice is not enough for the couple's main business of making glass noodles. Mrs. Y. therefore joined  TYM Fund and applied for a loan of US$250, hoping to increase the production of noodles by 50%.

loans.use: Purchase of rice for making noodles

loans.name: Ram Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Devi M., 33 year old, is a shopkeeper and lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. Thecho is one of the under developed villages of Nepal. Most of the People of this region are poor and work in the farm. 
Mrs. M. has two children, a daughter and a son. Her daughter took SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam recently and her son is studying in grade 7. Her husband Mr. Krishna Bhakta M. is working in office.
Mrs. M. has opened a grocery shop 4 years ago. She needs loan of Rs20000 ($307) to buy necessary goods for her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She plans to provide better education for her children from her income and she also wants to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Benedito Jose

texts.pt:
Benedito Jose C., 52 years old, a native of Matola, in the province of Maputo, grew up with his parents and brothers. His family's financial situation only gave him the opportunity to study to 5th grade. He lost his father when he was 7.

Since 1973, he has taken on the entire management of the family business, having started with a few sales points for sweets and cakes. Today, he has a store.

Starting in 2006, through his daughter, he found out about Hluvuku Adsema, and requested a loan to apply to his business.

With the loan of 20,000 meticais, he plans to increase the volume of merchandise. His business has a large impact on the community because, in addition to providing a job for himself and his wife, it brings products closer to customers at competitive prices, particularly for the population of the Matola Rio community.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO : Matola Rio - Boane CLIENTE : Benedito Jose C. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 20.000,00MT (800.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE: Compra e venda de produtos INICIO: 18/06/2007 FIM: 31/07/2008 Benedito Jose C. de 52 anos de idade, natural de Matola, provincia de Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos seus Pais e Irmaos, a situacao financeira da familia criou lhe oportunidades para estudar ate 5 classe. Perdeu o seu pai quando tinha 7 anos de idade. Desde o ano 1973 vem assumindo na integra a gestao de negocio da familia tendo iniciado com pequenas bancas de venda de doces e bolachas, e hoje possui um estabelecimento comercial. A partir do ano 2006 por indicacao da sua filha teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku Adsema, tendo solicitado um emprestimo para aplicacao do seu negocio. Com o emprestimo de 20.000,00 MZM, pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria. A sua actividade tem um grande impacto na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele proprio e a sua esposa coloca os produtos mas proximos dos clientes a precos competitivos, com particular destaque para toda a populacao da comunidade de Matola rio.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

payments.comment: Benedito paid 2 months in advance and ended this loan ahead of time.

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Celine M. is 47 years old, a native of Bilene Macie, Province of Gaza. She grew up with her grandparents, and the family situation created few opportunities, and she studied until the 4th grade. She's now a single mother of 4 children. At 18, she took on the management of the business to support her family and has a commercial store in the Km 16 Market. Starting in 2006, after referral from colleagues and friends, she found out about Hluvuku-Adsema, and approached them and requested a loan to apply to her business. Since then, her business has really changed.

Currently, her business is going at a good pace, and provides employment for herself and supports her family responsibilities.

With a loan of 21,000 meticais, she plans to increase the volume of her business in order to respond to her clients' needs. Her business has greater impact in the community given that, in addition to bring products closer to the customer, it provides a job for herself and supports her family responsibilities.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO : Km 16 – Boane CLIENTE : Celina M. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 21.000,00MT (840.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos para revenda INICIO: 18/06/2007 FIM: 31/07/2008 Celina M. de 47 anos de idade, natural de Bilene Macie, Provincia de Gaza, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos seus avos, a situacao financeira da familia criou lhe poucas oportunidades tendo estudado ate 4 classe, solteira mae de 4 filhos. Aos seus 18 anos de idade vem assumindo na integra a gestao do negocio para sustento da familia e possui um estabelecimento Comercial no Mercado do Km16. A partir do ano 2006, por indicacao de colegas e amigas teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo aproximado e solicitado um emprestimo para aplicacao no seu negocio. Desde entao, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para ela propria e suporta os encargos familiares. Com o emprestimo de 21.000,00Mts pretende aumentar o volume de negocio de forma a responder com as exigencias dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na sua comunidade dado que, para alem de colocar o produto mais perto do cliente providencia emprego para ela propria e suporta os encargos familiares.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Cacilda Jaime

texts.pt:
Cacilda Jaime F., 59 years old, single, mother of 10 children, native of Moamba, Maputo Province, grew up with her mother, and lost her father when she was 9. The family's financial situation created few opportunities for her to study. Since she was 20, she has taken on the management of the family business and has a small store. Starting in 2006, through her neighbors, she learned about Hluvuku-Adsema, and requested a loan to increase the volume of merchandise.

Since then, her business has grown, and currently she does a good business and provides jobs to two people, including herself. With the earnings from her business, she supports her family responsibilities. She would like to expand her store to improve storage of her products.

With a loan of 15,500 meticais, she plans to increase the volume of business in order to respond to her customers' needs, since demand has been increasing.

Her business has a larger impact on the community because, in addition to providing a job for herself and another perosn, she brings the products closer to her customers.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Km 16-Boane CLIENTE: Cacilda Jaime F. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 15.500,00 MT (620.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos para revenda INICIO: 18/06/2007 FIM: 31/07/2008 Cacilda Jaime F. de 59 anos de idade, solteira, mae de 10 filhos, natural de Moamba, Provincia de Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade sa sua Mae, perdeu o seu Pai quando tinta 9 anos de idade, a situacao financeira da familia lhe criou poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde os seus 20 anos de idade vem assumindo na integra a gestao de negocio da familia e possui um pequeno estabelecimento Comercial. A partir do ano 2006, por indicacao de vizinhos teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku Adsema, tendo solicitado um emprestimo para aumentar o volume da mercadoria. Desde entao, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica, actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para duas pessoas, incluindo a propria, com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares ampliacao do estabelecimento comercial para melhor armazenamento dos seus produtos. Com o emprestimo de 15.500,00MT, pretende aumentar o volume do negocio de forma a responder as necessidades dos clientes, pois a procura tem sido cada vez maior. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ela propria e outra pessoa, coloca o produto mais perto dos clientes.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Assa Andre

texts.pt:
Assa M. is 42 years old. She is a single mother of two sons. Assa was born in the city of Maputo, she studied until the 5th grade. Since 2000 she has been supporting her family though the family business of raising chicken. In 2006 she was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema by friends. There she requested her first loan. Today her business is doing well. It employs two people including Assa.

With the loan of 9.2000,00 MT, Assa plans on increasing the volume of her business from 200 chicks to 300. Assa’s work has a positive impact in her community because it brings fresh chicken closer to her clients. With the income from her business Assa supports her family and pays for the education of her sons who are almost graduating from pre-university school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Bairro 1 - Boane CLIENTE : Assa M. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Avicultura VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 9.200,00MT (368.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de pintos para engorde INICIO: 18/06/2007 FIM: 31/12/2007 Assa M. de 42 anos de idade, solteira, mae de dois filhos, Natural de Cidade de Maputo, estudou ate 5 classe. desde ano 2000 vem assumindo na integra a gestao de negocio da familia (Criacao de pintos ). Em 2006, por indicacao de amigas teve conhecimento da existencia da Hluvuku-Adsema tendo aproximo e solicitado e seu primeiro emprestimo para a criacao de pintos. Actualmente a sua actividade esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para duas pessoas, incluindo ela propria.

Com o emprestimo de 9.200,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume do negocio, dos actuais 200 para 300 pintos. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego coloca o produto (frangos) mais perto dos clientes. Com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, incluindo despesas escolares dos dois filhos que estao a concluir o ensino pre universitario.

loans.use: To produce chicken

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin has been married since 1993 and has 1 daughter. She learnt to weave and started a silk production business almost 20 years ago. Her husband is a construction worker. Sarin has borrowed a loan from MAXIMA already before. Now she is asking for another loan of US$300 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to prepare thread on the loom. She is capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Sarin Sroeurng has enough money to pay off the loan early.

Thank you.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Saran has been married for over 20 years and has 1 son and 5 daughters. She learnt to weave from her neighbors two years ago. Her husband has been working as a construction worker for over five years. Two of her daughters are also able to weave and have their own looms. The others are studying in a local school. Saran is asking for a loan of US$250 to buy sewing thread, silk materials and fee for preparing thread on the looms. Four of her family members have a job that can generate income, and therefore she will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Saran Rous has enough money to pay off the loan early.

Thank you.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San has been married since 2004 and has 1 son. She learnt to weave three years ago. Her husband has been working as a truck driver for the past five years. In addition, the family is also doing farming. San is asking for a loan of US$500 which she will use to purchase silk material, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom. This way, she will be able to sell her silk products at a higher price, continue to work at home and have enough time to look after her son. With a very good character and steady income, Son will be able to repay the loan

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, fees for preparing thread on the loom

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. San Mom paid off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath has been married since 1979 and has 2 sons and 6 daughters. Her husband only completed 4 grades of school, and Sambath is illiterate. She has been selling groceries for the past 10 years, while her husband has been a motor taxi driver for the same period of time. One of Sambath's daughters is working in a garment factory, while another 3 are still studying. The rest of Sambath's children are already married and living in a separate house. She needs a loan of US$1,000 to repair her old motorbike and to buy grocery items, rice and noodles. Sambath's business can earn enough money for her family and can support her children's education. Sambath and her husband are polite and honest, and will be capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items and rice for sale and repair of a motorbike.

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva lenders - As of today, Sambath Huon has paid off the balance of this loan in-full.  He is in the process of applying for a new loan with Maxima/Kiva to further expand his business.  

Thank you very much for your support!

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy has been married since 1981 and has 1 son and 1 daughter. He has been a fisherman for twenty years. His wife is a housewife and his two children stay at home, too - they had to stop studying, because Thy did not have enough money to support them. Thy and his wife did not have a chance to study because of the war. The family is now asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a fishing net, bamboo and other fishing materials. Thy hopes to sell the fish he catches in the village. He is healthy and loyal, and will therefore be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing fishing net, bamboo and other fishing material

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Mr. Thy Auoch already paid off his loan. Thank you very much to all lenders.

loans.name: Loeurng

texts.en: Loeurng has been married for 5 years to her second husband who is a farmer. She has 1 son and 4 daughters. She has been selling vegetables and meat for over 7 years. Three of her children are working in a factory, while the others are still studying or stay at home. Both Loeurng and her husband have little education, but they have a very good character. They will use the loan of US$300 to buy cement, bricks and other materials to repair their house, and to purchase more vegetables and meat for sale to expand the business. Loeurng will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: (1) House repair - purchase of cement, bricks and other materials; (2) Purchase of more grocery items for sale

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs.Loeurng Huy has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en:
Vuth has been married since 1993 and has four daughters. He has been a motor taxi driver for 7 years. His wife is a housewife. All of their children are studying. Vuth has finished grade 7, while his wife has never studied at school, but they both are polite, honest and reliable.  
Vuth is borrowing US$500 to change the motorbike. With the new motorbike he hopes to increase the revenues and decrease expenses related to repairing and the use of petrol. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike .

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mr. Vuth Sem has enough money to pay off his loan early before contract and requesting for a new loan.

Thank you.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocenta M. wishes to take a loan in order to purchase more raw materials. She will purchase water and other basic ingredients, such as cooking oil. Aside from selling “drinking” water, she also does raffles with the cooking oil (in one gallon units) at RD$10 per ticket. She also does “bottle washing” as a (major) complementary job to aid her in getting food to the table of six people.

Inocenta, a mother of 5, lives in a community called “Casabe” (comes from “Casava”, an ancient Taino Indian substitute for bread). One of their children lives with her sister, so as to alleviate the "load," but along with her husband, she has to to feed their other children.

loans.use: To buy water and ice

loans.name: Bartola Siriaco

texts.en:
Bartola Siriaco M. started out working in a “Pica pollo” (a small diner) with her mother ever since she was a little child. She decided to take this loan so she can invest in her establishment. She wants to have clients feel pleased with the ambiance, and attract new customers as well. She also plans to split the loan to buy more food to offer on her menu. Amongst other things she sells chicken, toasts, assorted fruit juices, and fried plantain.

Bartola is married and has 3 children. Her family helps her run the business and prepare the food every day for their customers. The interesting point in this loan is the fact that it will serve to assist the needs (of the women) in a whole family.

loans.use: Invest in establishment

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa S. is twenty years old and has one child. She is married to a self-employed tailor. She runs her small market stall business in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone). She mainly sells sugar, onions and chicken stock cubes.

Hawa’s business income supplements her husband's income so her aim is to expand her business for more profit. Hawa is determined to help provide for her family. She is requesting this loan for the purpose of diversifying her inventory.

loans.use: To diversify the items she sells in her market stall business

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
My name is Ana Lilian, I’m a merchant, I have a small local store called "ANA" in downtown. It generates an income to help with my family’s expenses. Thanks to this business I’ve been able to help in education of my children, I have a son in school and my daughter graduated last year. The most important is that I can run the business and take care of my family. I also have the support of my children during their time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ana Lilian, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en el centro de mi comunidad, llamada Pulperia "ANA" La que me genera ingresos contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, gracias a este negocio he colaborado para que mis hijos estudien, tengo hijo en el colegio y año pasado se me graduo una muchacha, y lo mas importante es que puedo atender el negocio y mi familia, tambien cuento con la colaboración de ellos en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, corn flour, soap, toilet paper, etc

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar is a married man and has two children. His family owns a little ranch, which his wife takes care of and uses to cut and sell wood. However, wood cutting season only lasts for a month. The earnings are not enough to cover his family's expenses, which increase every year since his children get older and start going to school. Therefore, Oscar decided to open a grocery store about a year ago. He started selling sodas and little by little he incremented his inventory. He is now able to pay for his children's school. However, he wants to give his wife and children a better quality of life and move his business forward.

Oscar is requesting a US$ 275 loan in order to purchase merchandise, thereby increasing his inventory and providing more and better products which his clients specifically request. He offers to pay the loan back in three months. Oscar and his family greatly thank your support, which will help them move forward and give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Oscar esta casado y tiene dos hijos, su esposa se dedica al negocio de la madera por que tienen un pequeño rancho donde da madera pero ella se encarga de cuidar del mismo y la temporada de madera es solo de un mes al año para la cual se tiene que trabajar dos veces en el mismo año, por ello esto no cubría ni cubre sus gastos familiares que cada vez se incrementaban por que sus niños van creciendo y ya están en edad escolar por lo que decidió poner su negocio propio, él empezó hace un año con su negocio de abarrotes vendiendo sodas, y poco a poco comenzó a mejorar, con eso puede cubrir la educación de sus hijos, pero el quiere que sus hijos y su esposa tengan una mejor calidad de vida y sacar adelante a su negocio.

Oscar está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así poder surtirlo más y tener más y mejores productos que ofrecer que aún le hacen falta y que sus clientes le solicitan, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante y poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea is a divorced woman who is now living in free union with her current partner. She has three children, two daughters and a son. Her partner works as a freelance construction worker. Therefore, his salary is not enough to cover the family's expenses. One of her daughters moved to Laredo and started bringing clothes for her mother to sell amongst her friends and neighbors. Andrea used to work at a fish restaurant before she started her clothes selling business. The restaurant was at the other side of the city so her income wasn't enough and she also did not have enough time to take care of her children. Therefore, she decided to start her own business and stay close to her family. She started selling the clothes her older daughter gave her. Time passed and she then started selling shoes and quilts. Now everyone in the family helps with her business. Even her ten year old daughter helps her out by riding around in her bicycle receiving payments from nearby clients.

Andrea is requesting a loan of US$475 to purchase more merchandise and increment her inventory. This will allow her business to continue growing and she will be better able to maintain her family. She offers to pay back this loan within six months. She and her family thank your support which will help them move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Andrea esta divorciada y ahora vive en unión libre con su actual pareja, tiene tres hijos dos de ellos son mujeres y un hombre, su pareja trabaja como albañil por su cuenta, por lo tanto su salario no le alcaza para cubrir los gastos familiares, una de sus hijas se fue a vivir a Laredo y ella fue la que inicialmente le traía ropa a su madre para que la vendiese a sus vecinas y amigos. Andrea antes de su negocio trabajaba en un restaurante de mariscos pero quedaba al otro lado de la ciudad y sus ingresos no le alcanzaban así como desatendía a sus hijos por ello decidió poner su propio negocio y estar alado de sus pequeños, con la ropa que le daba su hija mayor empezó su negocio y con el tiempo agrego la venta de zapatos y colchas, ahora todos le ayudan en el negocio hasta su pequeña hija de 10 años ayuda cobrando en su bicicleta los abonos de los clientes que tiene cerca de su hogar.

Andrea esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar mercadería que le permita tener más inventario y así continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder mantener a su familia, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia is a widow and has three daughters, one of which helps her sell her products in her workplace amongst her workmates. When Otilia widowed she found the need to obtain a better income to support her three daughters. Her husband's pension was not sufficient to cover her daughter's expenses, which started increasing as they got older. She heard a catalog sales add over the radio and decided to give it a try. Since then, she has created a solid client portfolio and people recommend her a lot since she has good products.

Otilia is requesting a US $275 loan to be able to purchase merchandise and fulfill her current orders. She also wants to keep some stock for future orders in order to shorten their delivery time. She offers to pay the loan back in three months and greatly appreciates your support - which hill help her continue with her business' growth and better her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Otilia es una mujer viuda, y tiene 3 hijas, de las cuales una de ellas la ayuda ofreciendo los productos de su mamá en su lugar de trabajo entre sus compañeras, al quedarse viuda Otiia se vio en la necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos para poder mantener a sus tres hijas, ya que la pensión que recibía de su esposo era insuficiente para poder cubrir con estos gastos que eran cada vez mayores según iban creciendo sus hijas. Escucho por radio los anuncios de las ventas por catálogo y fue así como se decidió a incursionar en el mismo, ahora ella ya tiene una cartera de clientes fijos y cada vez la recomiendan más por que sus productos son buenos.

Otilia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para poder comprar mercadería y surtir los pedidos que tiene actualmente, así como para tener stock para los futuros pedidos que tenga y proporcionar de productos en tiempos más cortos, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y agradece mucho el apoyo que le des para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
My name is Rosa Idalia, I’m a merchant, I have a small local store called “El Campo” in my house. I’m a single mother of one child who is in school and this business generates an income to cover my family’s expenses. At present the sales volume is bigger therefore I need to buy more merchandise to be able to offer a larger variety of products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Rosa Idalia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia "El Campo" la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo el que esta estudiando, actualmente el volumen de venta es mayor por lo que necesito surtir mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Buy chicken, soft drinks, soap, sugar, rice, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Luis  Alonso

texts.es:
Hello my name is Luis Alonso, I’m a carpenter. I’ve had a carpenter’s workshop in downtown for several now. It generates an income to cover my family’s expenses and other obligations that I have with providers. I have 3 children and they all are in school. My biggest need is to purchase wood since I have a lot of clients that for lack of wood I haven’t been able to meet their needs, taking into account that for these works the wood has to be dry.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Luis alonso mi actividad principal es la carpintería (elaboración de muebles de madera), cuento con una carpintería en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demás compromisos con los proveedores, tengo 3 hijos y están en la escuela. mi mayor necesidad es la compra de madera ya que tengo muchos clientes y por falta de madera no me es posible atenderlos. tomando en cuenta que para estos trabajos la madera tiene que estar seca.

loans.use: Buy pine, cedar and mahogany wood.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
My name is Carlos Alberto, I’m a street salesman. I sell plastic products in the different communities; I have been doing this for the past 2 years. It generates an income to cover my family’s expenses. I have a good clientele, but now there is a bigger demand and I don’t have the capital to satisfy the growing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Carlos Alberto, soy comerciante mi actividad principal es la venta de productos plasticos de manera ambulante en las diferentes comunidades, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, cuento con buena clientela, pero actualmente tengo un problema porque la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Buy plastic buckets, sippy cups, aluminum, glass and plastic glasses, etc

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es:
My name is Erika Patricia, I’m a merchant, I have a business of selling new clothes in downtown. I have been doing this for the past 2.5 years. I’m a single mother of two children and this business generates an income to cover my family’s expenses. At present I need to buy more merchandise, because I have bigger sales when I have a larger variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Erika Patricia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa Nueva, en el centro, tengo 2.5 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos mi familia, ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos, actualmente necesito compara mas producto, tomando en cuenta que se vende mas cuando el negocio se ve bastante surtido.

loans.use: Buy T-shirts, skirts, underwear, children clothes, etc

loans.name: Uryi

texts.en: Uryi runs a business helping people with something very important in Ukraine – keeping warm in the winter. He sells and installs small, self-contained gas heating units that work very well with the traditional hot water heating found in many buildings in Ukraine. Not only do the units provide heating, they also can provide hot running water if necessary. Uryi has been in business for six years. He supports himself, his wife Lena, an eight-year old daughter and a three-year old son. Uryi has requested a loan to help purchase a supply of flexible plastic pipe that he uses for installations. He has proven to be an excellent loan client in the past with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist him with his business.

loans.use: Purchase plastic pipe

loans.name: Arminda Esperanza

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Arminda Esperanza, I’m a merchant. I have a small business of selling new clothes, located in a strategic place of my city. I have been doing this type of business for the past 3 years. It generates an income to cover my family’s expenses. At present my three children are in school, therefore I need to improve my income. In order to do it I need to buy more merchandise to have a larger variety and I don’t have the capital for such investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Arminda Esperanza, soy Comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, ubicado en un lugar estratégico de mi ciudad, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, actualmente mis tres hijos están estudiando, por lo que necesito mejorar los ingresos y para poder hacerlo tengo surtir mas el negocio y no cuento con el capital para tal inversión.

loans.use: Buy spandex skirts, underwear, T-shirts and shirts for men and boys, blouses for women, etc

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Sandra Patricia, I’m a merchant. I started a small business of selling new clothes for all the ages 3 years ago. I‘m a single mother and this business generates an income to cover my children’s expenses; since they depend on my income now I need to buy merchandise to be able to offer a larger variety of products to my clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Sandra Patricia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva para todas las edades, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mis hijos, ya que soy madre soltera y ellos depended de mis ingresos, actualmente necesito surtir un poco mas para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a los clientes.

loans.use: Buy T-shirts, underwear, skirts, trousers for men and clothes for children.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
I have been selling second hand clothes for one year and I have done very well. I would now like to buy more merchandise so that I can sell more as my family and I live off this money. I would like a loan of $1,200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Tengo 1 año con el negocio de venta de ropa usada y me va bien, solo que ahora me gustaría comprar más mercancía para poder tener más ventas ya que de ahí vivimos mi familia y yo”. Solicito $ 1.200.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell/Comprar más ropa para vender

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en: Andrei has loved mechanical things since childhood. He found a good fit for his own business when he began driving his car as a taxi. He’s been driving for eight years now, and is able to make enough to support himself, his wife and their two daughters. Andrei works with a taxi cooperative/dispatch company called Radiotaxi 051. It allows self-employed taxi drivers to work more efficiently by working together and using radios to dispatch requests for taxis. Andrei works part of the time as a manager for Radiotaxi 051. He has a good reputation and is well-respected by his fellow workers. Andrei has requested a loan for $600 to help make some repairs to his taxi. This loan will enable him to continue working hard and provide quality transportation services for his customers.

loans.use: Make repairs to taxi

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: After finishing school, Svetlana was not able to find a good paying job so she decided to open her own business at the Central market in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine, selling a selection of women’s clothing. She has been in business now for two years and is doing really well. She has built up about $2000 worth of inventory on hand and she makes around $900 a month income. Svetlana is a lively, hard working young lady. She has gained a good reputation among other market vendors who attest to her skills in business. She has requested a loan for $700 that will allow her to purchase new inventory to update her product selection. In the future she hopes to be able to open an additional sales location. With her success in business thus far, she should have no problem fulfilling this goal and accomplishing much more.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander Fuzyk drives his taxi all over the Ivano-Frankivsk region of western Ukraine, serving the transportation needs of many grateful customers. In business for eight years, he had worked as a vendor in the market but decided to become a taxi driver instead because he could make more money. On a typical day, he will earn about $35, which is enough to meet the needs of himself, his wife, Svetlana, and his two sons, age nine and two.  Alexander and Svetlana are expecting their third child soon. Alexander is a hard-working father. Many times he works straight through a week without taking any days off. He has requested a loan for $600 to make some repairs to the engine in his taxi. This is his tenth loan with Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting him with his livelihood.

loans.use: Repair engine on taxi

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Edwin Omar, I’m a merchant, I have a small business of selling new clothes for both men and women, located in the market of my city. I have been doing this type of activity for several years; it generates an income to cover my family’s expenses and other obligations I have with suppliers. Thanks to this income I’m being able to build my house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Edwin Omar, soy comerciante, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva para ambos sexos, ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a los ingresos que percibo de este negocio estoy construyendo mi casa poco a poco.

loans.use: Buy trousers, jeans for both men and woman, blouses, dresses for girls, underewear, etc.

loans.name: Inna

texts.en: Inna G. has operated a socks and undergarment sales business in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine for twelve years. Enterprising and hardworking, Inna has succeeded in her business due to experience and a joyful spirit. With the profits of her business, she is supporting her parents and is sending her son, Vladimir, to the university. Inna has a perfect repayment history with Nadiya Ukraine. She is currently seeking a loan for $1000 to enlarge the assortment of her products and repair her car. Both endeavors will help her to expand and develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and repair car

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: A single mother of two children, Nataliya opened her own clothing sales kiosk in the central market of Kalush one year ago. Previously, Nataliya worked as an employee of another business owner in the market. Nataliya opened her own business with the help of microfinance loans in order to better support her family. Nataliya is lively and hardworking and has successfully repaid all the loans she has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Nataliya is currently seeking a loan for $1200. This loan will help Nataliya to refresh and expand inventory for her clothing kiosk. With the increased profits, Nataliya plans to expand her business and begin renting space for a larger store.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Sandra Raquel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Sandra Raquel and my main activity is sales. I have an undergarment business located in the main square of my city. I have been doing this for 3 years, which generates income to contribute with the expenses of my family. Mi biggest desire is to have my own store. I have my products on the sidewalk and I have to pack and unpack everyday.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Sandra Raquel, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa interior,, ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente mi mayor deseo es tener mi propio local para no estar empacando y desempacando todos los dias ya que producto lo mantego en la Acera.

loans.use: Purchase of undergarments for all ages and sexes.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Before opening his own toy sales and pet supplies kiosk, Ivan often had to travel to Moscow to find part-time work. Since opening his own business ten years ago, Ivan has been able to support his wife and two children without having to travel. His business is the sole source of income for the family of four. Ivan is a determined and pioneering entrepreneur. His toy and pet supplies kiosk is the only one of its kind in Ganoosivka, Ukraine. Over the years he has been in business, Ivan has received ten loans from Nadiya Ukraine; he has repaid each in full and on schedule. Currently, Ivan is seeking a loan for $1200 to increase his variety of toys. With the increased profits, Ivan plans to purchase his own vending facility. By owning rather than simply renting his place of business, Ivan will be better able to support his family.

loans.use: Purchase toy inventory

loans.name: Michail

texts.en: Michail B. operates a taxi service from Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. In business for four years, Michail’s taxi service operates throughout the country. His business is the primary source of income for his family of three. Michail is humble, responsible, and hardworking – traits that have helped him to earn a high reputation among clients and co-workers alike. Michail has differentiated his business from others by maintaining a portable radio in his taxi. This added service has kept his business in high demand. Currently, Michail is seeking a loan for $500. This loan will help Michail to complete car repairs and continue offering quality taxi services to his clients.

loans.use: Repair taxi

loans.name: Ana Esmeralda

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Ana Esmeralda and my main activity is sales. I have my own fruits and baleadas business located in my home, which allows me to generate income to make a contribution to the family expenses and support my children. What satisfies me is to know that I am able to make this contribution and give my children a better quality of life.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi Nombre es Ana Esmeralda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y baleadas (productos para consumo Homano), ubicado en mi casa de habitación, el que me permite generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y atender a mis hijos, lo que me satisface saber que con este negocio puedo contribuir con los gastos y brindar a mis hijos un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of mangos, flour, pineapples, oranges and y papayas.

loans.name: Senovia

texts.es:
My name is Senovia, I am a merchant and my main activity is to sell fruits of the season. My stand is located in the center of my colony. I have dedicated many years to this activity, which generates income. I am able to contribute to the family expenses with the profit of my business.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Senovia, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de frutas de temporada, ubicado en el centro de mi colonia, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos y con las utilidades puedo colaborar con los gastos de mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits of the season

loans.name: Blanca Norma

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Blanca Norma. My main activity is sales. I have had a small grocery store in my home for many years, which generates income to cover our family expenses. I need to provide a larger variety of products for my clients, considering that they like to buy everything in one same place. Thanks to God, I am able to generate this income and take care of my family.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Blanca Norma, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento una pequeña pulperia, en mi casa de habitación desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, tomando cuenta que a los clientes les gusta comprar todo en un mismo lugar, gracias a Dios con este negocio puedo generar ingresos y cuidar a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, lard, toilet paper, milk products and flour.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman. She is married and has five children, the youngest being 16 years old. Her husband is a carpenter. Nonetheless, his salary is very low and they are not able to cover their children's school expenses. Since she wanted her children to finish school so that they can have access to a better future, Ana started selling natural products. When she started she had very limited selection. Since she noticed there was plenty of demand for her products she decided to extend her business.

Ana Maria is requesting a loan of US $650 in order to increment her inventory to provide her clients a better service. She commits to repay this loan within six months. Be an important part of this business' growth and help Ana's children finish their studies, they will thank you!

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maria es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales el menor es de 16 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, sin embargo, el salario que recibe era muy bajo y no se cubrían los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, ella desea que ellos puedan culminar sus estudios para que tengan acceso a un mejor futuro, para esto Ana inició con la venta de productos naturales, cuando empezó tenia muy poca mercancía y al ver que la demanda por sus productos se incrementaba, decidió ampliar su negocio.

Para poder incrementar su surtido y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Ana Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a que los hijos de Ana puedan terminar sus estudios, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Mrs. Petrona is 57 years old and opened her shop in 1997. Her intentions at the time were to help out her husband, who is a public transportation chaufferu, as well as proviD. for her four sons who are close to entering University, which is costly. Today, the business functions very well, and there are plans of expanding it. The expansion would serve to pay for education costs as well as improving their quality of life.

She came to us at a time when the economy of her country is not at its best. She has counted on her good luck, and has been able to expand her business to its current state. Now she is looking to greatly increase the diversity of articles and would like to also sell toys, children's clothing, souvenirs and jewelry as there is a great demand for this from her current and potential clients.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Petrona D. 57 años abrió su despensa en el año 1997. La intención era ayudar a su marido, que es chofer D. una linea D. transporte público, pues contaba con 4 hijos quienes estaban por iniciar la carrera Universitaria cuyo costo fue y sigue siendo muy elevado. Hoy día el negocio funciona muy bien, inclusive con perspectivas D. crecimiento que contribuyan no solo a cubrir gastos D. educación sino para tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Ella nos cuenta que aunque la economía del país no se encuentra en su mejor momento, ella ha contado con una suerte extraordinaria, pues ha visto crecer su negocio a pasos agigantados, ahora desea ampliar más la diversidad D. sus mercaderías y desea vender también artículos D. mercería, regalos, ropa para niños, souvenirs y bijuterie pues existe una gran demanda D. parte D. sus clientes actuales y potenciales futuros clientes.

loans.use: Purchasing toys, souvenirs, children's clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo is married and has a little son. They are originally from San Juanito, Chihuahua, which is in the north of Mexico. Since there's a lack of job opportunities where he lives, in order to obtain the resources that his family needed, Reynaldo started making and selling "Pinole", a typical Mexican corn-based drink. When he began this business he toasted between 5 and 6 corn kilograms and he used a hand mill. Fortunately, since he makes high quality products and he has been able to count on his clients, he was able to purchase a foliage crushing machine, therefore increasing his production.

Reynaldo needs a loan of US$925 in order to cover his clients orders. He will use this loan to purchase Pinole raw materials. He commits to repay this loan in six months. You can improve this family's life and help this business grow. Do not hesitate any more and help him!

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Reynaldo es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo, ellos son originarios de San Juanito, Chihuahua, al norte de México. Ante la falta de empleo de la localidad, para poder obtener los recursos que necesitaba su familia, Reynado inició con la elaboración y venta de pinole, que es un bebida típica mexicana fabricada con maíz, cuando empezó tostaba entre 5 y 6 kilos de maíz y utilizaba un molino de mano, afortunadamente sus productos son de muy buena calidad y ha contado con la aceptación de sus clientes, ahora tiene una trituradora de follaje y es como ha hecho crecer su producción.

Para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, Reynaldo necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia y colaborar en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y apóyalo.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio V. is from Carapeguá, he is 38, married and father to a newborn baby. When he was 12 years old he was taught his father's craft, and he is now a blacksmith who works mostly making the grills and ironwork for windows.

After years of apprenticeship and his father's passing away, Eladio took charge of the small business. He did it well, and even worked on developing the tools so as to be able to work the iron better and improve the quality of the products.

He needs a credit to invest in purchasing steel and iron sheetswholesale, and a new blowtorch, so as to improve the quality of his work and thus increase his income. Eladio says that he does all he can to give his son all that he needs and for him to grow up healthy and with all the opportunities possible.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Maite Barragán

Eladio V. es de Carapeguá, casado con 38 años y un hijo recién nacido. Desde los 12 años aprendió el oficio del padre que también fue herrero con fuerte orientación hacia la fabricación de rejas de hierro para ventanales.

Después de años de aprendizaje y el fallecimiento de su padre, Eladio tomo el desafío de seguir con la microempresa. Lo hizo de manera correcta incluso mejorando en herramientas de manera a mejorar la calidad de los productos y la comodidad en la producción.

Hoy día necesita un crédito para invertir en chapas de acero, hierros al por mayor y un soplete nuevo de manera a abaratar sus costos y conseguir un mejoramiento en el acabado de sus trabajos, que le generarán un aumento en sus ingresos . Eladio dice que extrema sus esfuerzos por llegar a darle todo lo necesario para que su hijo crezca sano y con posibilidades de ser educado y desarrollarse como persona.

loans.use: purchasing steel and iron sheets wholesale and a new blowtorch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de seats for bicycles, brake cables, balance wheels, rims and tires

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 58 years old and has one of the busiest grocery stores in downtown Carapeguá. He has 3 children of which two are in college. Francisco had opened a small store 25 years ago, but because it was hard for him to expand the business and his wife and him started to have children, Francisco decided to leave his family to work at the construction of Yacyretá dam. Ten years went by and everything that Don Kiko (as he is known in the neighborhood) earned, he invested in his children's education and his store, which was left in his wife's care. When Francisco came back, he once again focused in his business. Today, he wishes to get a loan to buy a new freezer to increase his beverages and ice cream sales, especially since his business is located in a busy area of the city and the store is very popular. With the loan, Francisco will be able to continue to support his children's education so that they learn to become professionals and thus have a comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Don Francisco de 58 años cuenta con una de las despensas más concurridas en el centro de Carapeguá. Cuenta con tres hijos dos de ellos estudiando en la universidad. Empezaron con una pequeña despensa ya hace 25 años pero como le costaba crecer y vinieron los hijos tomó la decisión de dejar a su familia e ir a trabajar en las obras de construcción de la represa de Yacyretá. Pasaron 10 años y todo lo que Don Kiko, como es conocido en el Barrio, ganaba, invertía en la educación de sus hijos y en la despensa donde su esposa quedó encargada. Luego volvió y se concentró nuevamente en dicha actividad. Hoy día piensa en un crédito para la compra de una nueva heladera freezer para aumentar su venta de gaseosas, helados y refrescos ya que está en un barrio céntrico de la Ciudad y su almacén es muy concurrido, de esta forma poder seguir invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos para que puedan ser profesionales y desarrollarse de manera estable en la vida.

loans.use: Para la compra de un heladera freezer

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.es:
Fulgencia is 62 years old and has 10 sons and daughters. As a child, she learned how to make bedding with typical handmade fabrics of the Carapeguá area, especially since many women learn this trade from generation to generation in this city. They create these remarkable handicrafts that are highly valued in the local market and by tourists who are left marveled with their work. After getting married, Fulgencia continued making bedding while her husband sold them. However, it's been 5 years since her husband became bedridden due to a disease and she has had to support her household alone, with the help of two daughters who assist her in making the products. Nowadays, she supplies for large stores dedicated to selling handicrafts. Fulgencia would like to buy a loom and threads, using the loan she is applying for so that her eldest daughter can knit with her. At the moment Fulgencia has only one loom and since there is a growing demand for her products, she needs to increase her production. Fulgencia plans to increase her income this way and thus be able to help her husband through his sickness and give a better education to their two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Fulgencia tiene 62 años es casada y tiene 10 hijos.
