Desde pequeña aprendió el oficio de hacer colchas con los telares caseros característicos de la zona de Carapeguá, ya que en esta ciudad existen muchas mujeres que adquieren el oficio generación tras generación y que se dedican a la elaboración de esta maravillosa artesanía que es bastante cotizada en el mercado local y por los extranjeros que visitan el país quedando maravillados con esta labor. Luego de casarse, ellav siguió dedicandose a la fabricación de las colchas mientras que el marido salía a venderlas. Sin embargo desde hace ya 5 años el marido está en cama por una enfermedad que lo aqueja, por lo que ella enfrenta a la vida sola con dos hijas que la ayudan en el oficio. Hoy día ella es proveedora de grandes tiendas que se dedican a la venta de artesanías. El crédito lo quiere utilizar para la compra de un telar e hilos para que su hija mayor teja a la par que ella, pues por el momento, cuentan con solo una, y como la demanda ha aumentado necesitan aumentar su producción. De esta manera ella planea aumentar sus ingresos para sobrellevar la enfermedad del marido y darle una educación a sus dos hijas.

loans.use: Compra de un telar e hilos

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores is a very entrepreneurial and responsible woman. She is a widow and has four children. Her husband passed away eight years ago. Therefore, she had the need to start her own business in order to have enough income to maintain her children and give them the time and attention they needed. She therefore started making food and offering it to nearby offices. Fortunately, demand for her products started to increase and now she has a small food stand.

In order to provide a better service and continue growing like she has so far, Maria Dolores is requesting a US$475 credit, which she will use to purchase chairs and tables to better her business' appearance and increment the number of clients. She promises to repay this quantity in five months. With your loan, Maria can make great things. Be part of her achievements! She sincerely thanks your support.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Dolores es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, hace ocho años que falleció su esposo ella tuvo la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio para poder obtener un ingreso que le permitiera sostener a sus hijos y darles el tiempo y las atenciones que requieren, así es como inició elaborando comidas y ofreciéndola en unas oficinas cercanas, afortunadamente la demanda por sus productos fue incrementándose y ahora tiene un pequeño puesto.

Para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora Maria Dolores solicita un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mesas y sillas para mejorar la apariencia de su negocio e incrementar sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 5 meses. Con tu ayuda Maria puede hacer grandes cosas, se parte de sus logros, ella agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Food Stand Remodeling

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo is 38 years old. He is married and has 4 children, all of which are in school. He learned carpentry in his neighborhood while he worked as a carpenter's assistant with his uncle. Besides working as a carpenter, Gerardo was also a street vendor selling bedding in his neighborhood to save money and open his own workshop. Gerardo was not making enough money, so he traveled to Argentina looking for better opportunities, just as many others did. He got a good job and 3 years later he came back fulfilled his dream by opening his own workshop. Now, Gerardo needs more capital to keep his workshop well stocked with wood, since it has been several instances when he has received a rush jobs, but could not fulfill them because he did not have enough capital. Gerardo's work allows him to support his children's education; his dream is to see them become professionals and this is his driving force to improve each day.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Gerardo tiene 38 años y es casado con 4 hijos, todos estudiando. Aprendió el oficio en su barrio cuando trabajaba como ayudante en la carpintería de su tío. Aparte de trabajar en la carpintería, Gerardo realizaba ventas de colchas ambulando por los barrios con la finalidad de ahorrar dinero para montar su propia carpintería. Como las ganancias no eran buenas, el viajó a la Argentina como muchas personas emigran al vecino país en busca de mejores oportunidades y consiguió un buen trabajo con el que después de 3 años volvió y cumplió el sueño de establecer una carpintería propia. Hoy en día necesita reforzar su capital operativo para poder mantenerse con buen stock de maderas ya que muchas veces recibe pedidos urgentes que no puede satisfacer por no contar con el capital de trabajo fortalecido. Con esta actividad está consiguiendo que sus tres hijos estudien con comodidad y su sueño es verlos profesionales, por lo que cada día se empeña en mejorar.

loans.use: Para comprar madera al por mayor

loans.name: Ada  Luz

texts.es:
My name is Ada Luz, I am a merchant and I have a small grocery store at home called “Pulpería SAN JUAN". I have dedicated many years to this type of business. With the profit that it generates, I am able to contribute to our family’s expenses. The location of this store is very good and each day the sales’ volume is larger, which requires a larger investment to offer my clients a larger variety of products.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ada luz, soy Comerciante, cuento con una pequeña pulperia en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia "SAN JUAN", tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio y con las utilidades que me genera puedo contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, la ubicación de mi negocio es muy buena y cada dia el volumen de venta es mayor, por lo que requiere una mayor inversión para poder ofrecer a mis clientes con variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, lard, beans, corn, toilet paper, soap, and milk products.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo is 26 years old, is married, and has 2 children. He is from the city of Carapeguá and comes from a family of very humble circumstances. Marcelo had to emigrate to the city of San Lorenzo when he was only 8 years old, which is when he began working as a helper in a tire store there. After several years of sacrifice, and when he was only 22 years old, Marcelo achieved his dream of returning to the city of his birth, this time with enough savings to open his own tire store. Shortly thereafter, his first wife died. However, Marcelo was able to overcome difficulties and take care of his newly-born daughter and still manage to get ahead in his business. Today he also sells used wheel covers in his store. He has remarried and has an 8 month old son. He tells us his wife works in the home taking care of their children. He would like to add on to his business and wants to incorporate the sale of new wheel covers, since the ones he currently sells are used. He is asking for a credit of $200.00, with which he plans to buy new wheel covers to sell; he has more and more requests for them, but he doesn’t have enough capital to buy the variety he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelo tiene 26 años y es casado con 2 hijos. Oriundo la Ciudad de Carapeguá y proveniente de una familia muy humilde, el joven Marcelo se vio obligado a emigrar a la ciudad de San Lorenzo en busca de trabajo a la temprana edad de 8 años cuando comenzó como ayudante en una gomería de la ciudad. Luego de varios años de sacrificio y con 22 años cumplidos, Marcelo logró el sueño de volver a su ciudad natal, esta vez con ahorros suficiente para poder montar su propio negocio de gemería. Poco después falleció su primera esposa, sin embargo Marcelo se supo sobreponer quedando con una niña recién nacida y aun saliendo adelante a pesar de esta difícil situación. Hoy cuenta también con venta de cubiertas usadas en su gomería, se ha vuelto a casar y tienen un hijo de 8 meses, nos cuenta que su esposa se dedica a la crianza de sus hijos. El esta deseoso de ampliar su negocio y desea incorporar a la venta cubiertas nuevas, pues las que esta vendiendo en su gomería son usadas. Solicita un crédito de $200 con los que planea comprar cubiertas nuevas para la venta, ya que cada vez cuenta con mayor cantidad de pedidos y no le alcanza el capital para cumplir con la variedad necesaria.

loans.use: To buy new wheel covers for re-sale

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial is a young man of 27 and is married but does not have children. He is the only child of a single mother and was never able to count on the support of his father. Because of this, he helped his mother with the household income from the time he was very young. When he was 12 years old, he began selling blankets in the streets, a traditional activity in Carapeguá. When he was 15 years old, he began selling things on his own, working hard even when it was cold, raining, or very hot, always enthusiastic and with a desire to get head.

After several years of sacrifice and saving, he began another business with his new companion in life. He and his wife opened a bar where they sell fast food and also grocery items. He wishes to return to selling woven blankets, because his wife handles the bar very well, and in order to increase their income, he wants to begin selling blankets again. He is asking for a credit of $450.00, which he will use to buy various types of blankets. This will help him prepare to receive the children he and wife dream so much of having.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcial es un joven de 27 años, casado pero sin hijos. Hijo de madre soltera no contaba con el apoyo de un padre por lo que desde muy pequeño ayudo a su madre con los ingresos de la casa. Desde los 12 años ya se desempeñaba como ayudante en las ventas ambulantes de colchas, actividad tradicional en Carapeguá. A los 15 años se independizó iniciando su actividad por cuenta propia, sacrificándose en días de frío, lluvia o intenso calor, entusiasmado por el deseo de progresar. Luego de varios años de sacrificio y ahorro, se inició otro negocio con su nueva compañera en la vida, el abrió junto con su esposa un bar donde se dedican a la venta de comidas rápidas y también una surtida despensa. El desea reinvertir en su actividad inicial, ventas de colchas de hilo, pues su esposa se desempeña bastante bien en el bar y para aumentar los ingresos de ambos el desea volver a vender las colchas. El esta solicitando un crédito de $450 que los invertirá en la compra de diversos tipos de colchas, para prepararse a recibir los hijos que tanto sueñan tener junto con su esposa.

loans.use: To buy woven blankets for re-sale

loans.name: Mari

texts.es:
Mari is 42 years old and is a single mother with three children. She was abandoned by her children’s father, so she has had to raise them alone. Due to this complicated situation, she confronted the difficulties of life with her small business, which is located in the municipal market of Carapeguá. With this business, she is supporting her children and also her mother, who has come to live with her.

She has a very good client base and would like to invest in selling children’s clothes, since this is what she has had the most demand for over the last few months. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy baby clothes at whole-sale price. In this way she will progressively increase her income. Her plan is to push her business as far as she can, so that she can continue to provide for children, as father and mother, and see to it that they continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mari tiene 42 años, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Ella fue abandonada por el padre de sus hijos por lo que tuvo que criarlos sola. Debido a esta complicada situación enfrentó las dificultades de la vida con su microempresa ubicada en el mercado municipal de Carapeguá, con la cual está sustentando a sus hijos y ahora también la madre vino a vivir con ella, a quien también debe dar sustento y cuidados. Ella posee muy buena clientela y ella desea invertir en la venta de ropa para niños, pues es la que mayor demanda ha tenido estos ultimos meses; para ello solicita un crédito que lo utilizará para la compra al por mayor de prendas infantiles y de esta forma aumentar progresivamente sus ingresos. Su plan es empujar al máximo su negocio de esta manera continuar proveyendo a sus hijos como padre y madre, y lograr que sigan estudiando.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa is 41 years old, is married, and has two children. She weaves bed covers and is a street merchant, selling her bed covers and other products. She is the daughter of another weaver, from whom she learned this occupation. After she married, she continued weaving and sold her farm. She and her husband worked very hard in order to earn their daily living. María Elsa wove blankets and her husband sold them. They currently work as street merchants, selling the blankets and items of clothing in various cities of the country, such as Luque, Capiatá e Itauguá; they are able to earn a better profit this way.

Her oldest son, who is 18 years old, wants to get into sales, and to do this he needs a loan of $200.00 to buy merchandise such us t-shirts, coats, and children’s clothing, and in this way earn some capital. Her son very much wants to begin his university studies, which because of economic limitations he can’t yet start.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elsa tiene 41 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Es tejedora de colchas y vendedora ambulante de este y otros productos. Ella es hija de otra tejedora de quién aprendió el oficio, y luego de casarse continuó con esta actividad para lo cual vendió su finca. Junto con su marido trabajaron duro para poder obtener el sustento diario, ella se dedicaba a tejer las colchas y su marido salia a venderlas. Hoy día realizan la venta ambulante de su producción y a la vez de prendas de ropas en varias ciudades del país como Luque, Capiatá e Itauguá, ellos obtienen buenas ganancias. Su hijo mayor de 18 años desea incorporarse al negocio de ventas y para empezar necesita un créditode $200 para comprar mercaderías como camisas, remeras, camperas y ropa para niños y de esta forma hacerse de capital. Su hijo tiene muchas ganas de iniciar sus estudios universitarios que por limitaciones económicas no puede empezar.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, coats, and children's clothing

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresita is 35 years old, is married, and has two daughters, who are 8 and 9 years old. When she was young she learned how to weave bed covers from her mother. After she married, with much sacrifice she was able to use her savings from her weavings to buy a milk cow so that she could feed her children well and sell the milk. Due to the difficult economic situation in which they live, her husband had to emigrate to the capital city, Asunción, where he works in a shoe store. Teresita now has three milk cows. She sells the milk and at the same time continues weaving blankets, which she sells to a store located in the center of the city. Thanks to these activities she has been able to support her children, who are in primary school.

Sales of milk generate a good income, which is why she plans to buy one more cow. This way there won’t be any periods during the year when there isn’t milk and her husband can return home to his wife and children and work at selling milk. .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teresita tiene 35 años es casada y tiene dos hijas de 8 y 9 años. Desde jovencita aprendió el oficio de tejer sobrecamas con la madre. Luego de casarse, con mucho sacrificio pudo comprar con los ahorros de su actividad una vaca lechera para alimentar correctamente a sus hijos y comercializar la leche Debido a la difícil situación económica que vive, el cónyuge tuvo que emigrar a la ciudad capital,Asunción, donde trabaja en una zapatería como empleado. Hoy día Teresita cuenta ya con tres vacas lecheras, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y a la vez sigue tejiendo sus colchas que los vende a una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad. Gracias a estas actividades ha podido mantener a sus hijos que estan estudiando en la escuela primaria. La venta de leche genera buenos ingresos, por lo que planea comprar una vaca más, de esta forma no habrá temporadas que quede sin abastecimiento de leche y su marido podrá volver a la casa a dedicarse de lleno a la venta junto con su esposa e hijos.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run P., 24 years old, is a mother of 1 child, and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She makes her living by making wine and raising pigs, and earns around $2.50 each day. Her husband (pictured here because Run P. was unavailable) is both a construction worker and a farmer and daily contributes his income to the household. Currently, Run P. is humbly asking for a loan of $600 to increase her livestock by adding more pigs and cows. She loves this kind of animal breeding, because it enables her to increase her family savings in a very short time. For instance, with pig breeding, she uses the waste from the winemaking to feed them, because whenever they are fed like this, they fall deeply asleep, which enables them to grow very fast. In the future, she dreams of being able to increase even more the amount of pigs and cows she has, and as a result, make more profit and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To increase her livestock by adding more pigs and cows.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa L., 43 yeas old mother of 3 children, lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works on her farm growing rice crops and some kinds of vegetable such as tomatoes, lettuce, chili and cabbage and she then sells them to a nearby market. This kind of business activity contributes her in average about $3 each day, while her husband works as a village chef and typicalL. earns up to $7/day, which is a big help in financing the famiL.’s savings. CurrentL., Soa L. is requesting for a loan of $500 to purchase more seeds and some parts of money is to repair her house, which normalL. gets leaking during a rainy season. In the future, Soa L. is thinking about the possibility of expanding her crops by purchasing a plot of farmland.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to grow and needs to repair a house from the leaking during a rainy season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Bernadette would like to buy pigs and renovate the pig sty.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a high breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a cereal business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more varieties of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 2 blow driers, a steam machine and renovate her salon

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn R. is 39 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their 3 children.  They work as farmers and grocers, earning a combined income of $6/day.  Two of their children are students and the third works on the family farm with his father.  Morn R. will use this loan to purchase more groceR. items for her store in order to meet the increased demand from her clients.  In the future, Morn R. would like to make her shop bigger by buying a variety of new products.  She also hopes to be successful enough to send her children to university and to repair their home for the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her inventory in order to meet clients' needs.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Morn Ry start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fruit salad and juice business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: selling home-made washing gel and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng C. is 31 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband (pictured here because Heng Charthy was working in Poipet when we visited) and their 2 young children.  She buys and sells small baskets and other handmade items near the Cambodian-Thailand border in the city of Poipet.  Her husband works as a driver for a private company and can earn $3/day.  Mrs. Heng C. currently earns $3/day in her business, but would like to have this loan in order to buy a motorbike.  With the new motorbike, she will be able to transport her baskets to new markets and earn more income.  In the future, she hopes that her business expands to new areas so that she can earn enough money to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transporting her product to new markets

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Heng Chanthy start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa L. is 43 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their 3 children.  She works as a small farmer and housewife, taking care of her famiL..  Her husband is the village chief, and earns $5/day in this occupation.  Mrs. Soa L. will use this loan to purchase construction supplies.  The supplies will be used to help fix their current house, but also so that she and her husband can be hired to make small repairs to other people's homes.  In the future, she hopes to save enough money to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

payments.comment: Soa Ly has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok P. L. is 25 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband (pictured here because Sok P. L. was busy at work) and their 3 children.  She works in a hotel in the tourist city of Siem Reap, and her husband works in a hospital.  Combined, they earn $10/day which is enough to send their children to school.  Sok P. L. and her husband spend money on motortaxi drivers every day so that they can get to work.  She would like to have this loan so that they can buy their own motorbike.  Over time, this investment will make their overall transportation costs much cheaper.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her and her husband to work

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Mok Phaly start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Miraga

texts.en: A. Miraga is 44 years old, is married and has a big family of 5 members. He is the owner of a small food and textile shop in Imishli. He began his business in 1996 when he first opened a food market, and then a textile section in his shop. He now wants to borrow 1200 USD to purchase a refrigerator system to keep food cool.

loans.use: Going to purchase a refrigerator for food

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: A. Mahammad lives in Varkhankend village of Saatli region. He is 47 years old, is married and has 4 children. He began his small business in 1995, when he took out a loan and purchased calves for meat purposes. It brought good income and helped to cover his family’s needs. Now he is going to expand his business, and to reach his goal he has applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase three additional calves.

loans.use: Going to purchase three calves

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: A. Akif is 24 years old. He is single and a successful businessman. He is the owner of a small farm and is engaged with animal breeding. He has applied for a 1200 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU to purchase one milk cow and one calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: H. Araz is 42 years old, is married and has 3 children. He sells spare parts for cars and rents a small garage. His business has brought him income since 2000 and he would now like to build his own garage to continue running his business. He has applied to borrow 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU to begin building the new garage for his shop.

loans.use: Going to build his own auto shop

loans.name: Muslum

texts.en: J. Muslum is Saatli businessman. Muslum is 46 years old, is married and has a family of 4. In 2002 he purchased a cow and a calf. He is now planning to expand his farm and for this purpose he has applied for a 1200 USD loan. He is going to purchase one more cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Tezgul

texts.en: K. Tezgul is 46 years old, is married and has 5 children. She is a teacher in a local school and owns one milk cow. The cow is main source of income for her family. Her large family lives under difficult economic conditions, so she has decided to apply for a 1200 USD loan in order to purchase one more milk cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en: M. Elnara lives in Fatalikend village in Saatli. She is 30 years old, married and has one child.  Her small business started when she purchased one milk cow in 2001. Now she has applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase one more milk cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow and one calf

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: J. Tahir started his small business in 1999 when he purchased a cow and a few calves for meat purposes. Now he is going to enlarge his business and bring in additional income from animal breeding. He is going to purchase one calf and mixed fodder and has applied for a 700 USD loan from Aqroinvest CU to achieve his goal.

loans.use: Going to purchase a calf for meat purpose and fodder.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: N. Yasin is one of the youngest businessmen in Varkhanend village in Saatli. He started his business in 2006 when he borrowed money from his friends and opened his small food store. He wants to expand his store and purchase refrigerators with a loan of 1200 USD.

loans.use: To expand his store and purchase refrigerators

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: O. Ismayil started his business in 2001 with a loan from Aqroinvest CU when he purchased a calf.  This calf is now a milk cow. Ismayil is 36 years old, married and has one child. Because of the difficult economic conditions of his family, he would like to broaden his business and borrow 1200 USD to purchase one cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en: O. Israfil has lived in Saatli for his entire life. He is 45 years old, married and lives with his parents and wife`s parents. He is owner of a small farm with one cow and one calf. He started his business in 1997, with a loan from Aqroinvest CU. Now his next step to expand the business is to apply for a 1200 USD loan to purchase one more cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Nureddin

texts.en: O. Nureddin is 45 years old, married and has 4 children. He started his business in 1995 after borrowing a loan from Aqroinvest CU. With the loan, O. purchased calves for meat purposes. He would like another source of income. He borrowed 1200 USD to purchase one milk cow and a calf for animal husbandry.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)
